 Section 1

Data from Section 1:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="edit"><strong>    Section 1. Short title, extent and commencement. -</strong></div><div id="edit"><strong>    <br>   </strong><p><span>     (1) This Act may be called the Customs Act, 1962.    </span></p><p><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     (2) It extends to the whole<sup>1&nbsp;</sup>of India</span><sup><span style="text-indent: 0in;">2&nbsp; </span></sup><span style="text-indent: 0in;"><sup>3</sup>[and, save as                otherwise provided in this Act, it applies also to any offence or contravention thereunder committed                outside India by any person.]    </span><br>   </p><p><span>     (3) It shall come into force on such date    </span><sup>     <span>      4     </span></sup><span>    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     as the Central Government may, by                notification in the Official Gazette, appoint.    </span></p><div><div class="footnotes"><div><div>       1. Extended to Sikkim w.e.f. 1-10-1979 vide Notification No. 185/79-Cus., dated 1-9-1979.      </div><div><br>      </div><div>       2.       <span style="text-indent: 0in;">        The Customs Act, 1962 and Customs Tariff Act, 1975 has been                  <a href="content-page/explore-act/1000540" target="_blank">  </a></span>extended<span style="text-indent: 0in;"> to the whole of the Exclusive Economic Zone and Continental               Shelf of India for certain purposes by Ministry of External Affairs                    Notification SO No. 189(E), dated 7-2-2002.              </span></div><div><br>      </div><div>       3. Inserted (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) by s. 57 of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018).       <br>      </div><div><br>      </div><div>       4.       <span style="text-indent: 0in;">        Brought into force w.e.f. 1st February, 1963 vide Notification G.S.R.                    155, dated 23-1-1963.       </span></div></div></div></div></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="edit"><strong>    Section 1. Short title, extent and commencement. -</strong></div><div id="edit"><strong>    <br>   </strong><p><span>     (1) This Act may be called the Customs Act, 1962.    </span></p><p><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     (2) It extends to the whole<sup>1&nbsp;</sup>of India</span><sup><span style="text-indent: 0in;">2&nbsp; </span></sup><span style="text-indent: 0in;"><sup>3</sup>[and, save as                otherwise provided in this Act, it applies also to any offence or contravention thereunder committed                outside India by any person.]    </span><br>   </p><p><span>     (3) It shall come into force on such date    </span><sup>     <span>      4     </span></sup><span>    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     as the Central Government may, by                notification in the Official Gazette, appoint.    </span></p><div><div class="footnotes"><div><div>       1. Extended to Sikkim w.e.f. 1-10-1979 vide Notification No. 185/79-Cus., dated 1-9-1979.      </div><div><br>      </div><div>       2.       <span style="text-indent: 0in;">        The Customs Act, 1962 and Customs Tariff Act, 1975 has been                  <a href="content-page/explore-act/1000540" target="_blank">  </a></span>extended<span style="text-indent: 0in;"> to the whole of the Exclusive Economic Zone and Continental               Shelf of India for certain purposes by Ministry of External Affairs                    Notification SO No. 189(E), dated 7-2-2002.              </span></div><div><br>      </div><div>       3. Inserted (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) by s. 57 of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018).       <br>      </div><div><br>      </div><div>       4.       <span style="text-indent: 0in;">        Brought into force w.e.f. 1st February, 1963 vide Notification G.S.R.                    155, dated 23-1-1963.       </span></div></div></div></div></div></span>



 Section 2

Data from Section 2:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="edit"><strong>    Section 2.&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong><strong>Definitions   </strong>   -</div><div id="edit"><br></div><div id="edit"><p><strong>     <span>     </span></strong><span>     In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      1     </span></sup>    [(1) "adjudicating authority" means any authority competent to pass any      order or decision under this Act, but does not include the    <span style="font-size: 13.3333px;">    </span>    Board,    <sup>     2    </sup>    [Commissioner (Appeals)] or Appellate Tribunal;   </p><p><span>     (1A) "aircraft" has the same meaning as in the Aircraft Act, 1934 (22 of 1934);    </span></p><p><span>     (1B) "Appellate Tribunal" means the Customs, Excise and     <sup>      3     </sup>     [Service Tax] Appellate Tribunal        constituted under    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     <a href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/content-page/explore-act/1000203/1000002" alt="section 129" target="_blank">section 129</a>;]    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      4     </span></sup><span>     [(2) "assessment" means determination of the dutiability of any goods and the        amount of duty, tax, cess or any other sum so payable, if any, under this Act or under the Customs Tariff Act,        1975    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     (51 of 1975)    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     (hereinafter referred to as the Customs Tariff Act) or under any other law for        the time being in force, with reference to-    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     <br>     (a) the tariff classification of such goods as determined in accordance with the provisions of the Customs        Tariff Act;     <br>     <br>     (b) the value of such goods as determined in accordance with the provisions of this Act and the Customs Tariff        Act;     <br>     <br>     (c) exemption or concession of duty, tax, cess or any other sum, consequent upon any notification issued        therefor under this Act or under the Customs Tariff Act or under any other law for the time being in force;     <br>     <br>     (d) the quantity, weight, volume, measurement or other specifics where such duty, tax, cess or any other sum is        leviable on the basis of the quantity, weight, volume, measurement or other specifics of such goods;     <br>     <br>     (e) the origin of such goods determined in accordance with the provisions of the Customs Tariff Act or the rules        made thereunder, if the amount of duty, tax, cess or any other sum is affected by the origin of such goods;     <br>     <br>     (f) any other specific factor which affects the duty, tax, cess or any other sum payable on such goods, and        includes provisional    </span><span>     assessment, self-assessment, re-assessment and any assessment in which the duty assessed is nil    </span>    ;]    <br>   </p><p><span>     (3) "baggage" includes unaccompanied baggage but does not include motor vehicles;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      5     </span></sup><span>     [(3A) "beneficial owner" means any person on whose behalf the goods are        being imported or exported or who exercises effective control over the goods being imported or exported;]    </span></p><p><span>     (4) "bill of entry" means a bill of entry referred to in<a href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000086/1000002" alt=" section 46"> section 46</a>;    </span></p><p><span>     (5) "bill of export" means a bill of export referred to in<a href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000090/1000002" alt=" section 50"> section 50</a>;    </span></p><p><span>     (6)&nbsp; "Board" means the     <sup>      6     </sup>     [     <sup>      7     </sup></span><span>     Central Board of Indirect Taxes        and Customs]    </span><span>     constituted under the Central Boards of Revenue Act, 1963 (54 of 1963)];    </span></p><p><span>     (7) "coastal goods" means goods, other than imported goods, transported in a vessel from one port in India to        another;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      8     </span></sup><span>     [(7A) "Commissioner (Appeals)" means a person appointed to be a Commissioner of        Customs (Appeals) under sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000004/1000002" alt="section 4">section 4</a>;]    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      9     </span></sup><span>     (7B) "common portal" means the Common Customs Electronic Portal referred to        in section 154C;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      10     </span></sup>    [(8)    <sup>     11</sup>[Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs], except for the purposes of Chapter XV,        includes an Additional Commissioner of Customs;]   </p><p><span>     (9) "conveyance" includes a vessel, an aircraft and a vehicle;    </span></p><p><span>     (10) "customs airport" means any airport appointed under clause (a) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7 ">section 7 </a>to be a customs airport     <sup>      12     </sup>     [and includes a place appointed under clause (aa) of that section to be an air freight station];    </span></p><p><span>     (11) "customs area" means the area of a customs station     <sup>      13     </sup>     [or a warehouse] and includes any area in which imported goods or export goods are ordinarily kept        before clearance by Customs Authorities;    </span></p><p><span>     (12) "customs port" means any port appointed under clause (a) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7">section 7</a> to be a customs port     <sup>      14     </sup>     [and includes a place appointed under clause (aa) of that section to be an inland container depot];    </span></p><p><span>     (13) "customs station" means any customs port, customs airport    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     <sup>      15     </sup>     [,    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     international        courier terminal, foreign post office] or land customs station;    </span></p><p><span>     (14) "dutiable goods" means any goods which are chargeable to duty and on which duty has not been paid;    </span></p><p><span>     (15) "duty" means a duty of customs leviable under this Act;    </span></p><p><span>     (16) "entry" in relation to goods means an entry made in a bill of entry, shipping bill or bill of export and        includes     <sup>      16     </sup>     [* * *] the entry made under the regulations made under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000131/1000002" alt="section 84">section 84</a>;    </span></p><p><span>     (17) "examination", in relation to any goods, includes measurement and weighment thereof;    </span></p><p><span>     (18) "export", with its grammatical variations and cognate expressions, means taking out of India to a place        outside India;    </span></p><p><span>     (19) "export goods" means any goods which are to be taken out of India to a place outside India;    </span></p><p><span>     (20) "exporter", in relation to any goods at any time between their entry for export and the time when they are        exported, includes     <sup>      17     </sup>     [any owner, beneficial owner] or any person holding himself out to be the exporter;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      18     </span></sup><span>     [(20A) "foreign post office" means any post office appointed under clause (e) of        sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7">section 7</a> to be a foreign post office;]    </span></p><p><span>     (21) "foreign-going vessel or aircraft" means any vessel or aircraft for the time being engaged in the carriage        of goods or passengers between any port or airport in India and any port or airport outside India, whether        touching any intermediate port or airport in India or not, and includes -    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (i) any naval vessel of a foreign Government taking part in any naval        exercises;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (ii) any vessel engaged in fishing or any other operations outside the territorial        waters of India;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (iii) any vessel or aircraft proceeding to a place outside India for any purpose whatsoever;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      19     </span></sup><span>     [(21A)"Fund" means the Consumer Welfare Fund established under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000489/1000003" alt="section 12C">section 12C</a> of        the Central Excises and Salt Act    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     <sup>      20     </sup></span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     , 1944 (1 of 1944);]    </span></p><p><span>     (22) "goods" includes -    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (a) vessels, aircrafts and vehicles;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (b) stores;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (c) baggage;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (d) currency and negotiable instruments; and    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (e) any other kind of movable property;    </span></p><p><span>     (23) "import", with its grammatical variations and cognate expressions, means bringing into India from a place        outside India;    </span></p><p>    (24)    <sup>     21    </sup>    ["arrival manifest or import manifest"]      or"import report" means the manifest or report required to be delivered under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000068/1000002" alt="section 30">section 30</a>;   </p><p><span>     (25) "imported goods" means any goods brought into India from a place outside India but does not include goods        which have been cleared for home consumption;    </span></p><p><span>     (26) "importer", in relation to any goods at any time between their importation and the time when they are        cleared for home consumption, includes     <sup>      22     </sup>     [any owner, beneficial owner] or any person holding himself out to be the importer;    </span></p><p><span>     (27) "India" includes the territorial waters of India;    </span></p><p><span>     (28) "Indian Customs Waters" means the     <sup>      23     </sup>     [waters extending into the sea up to the limit of     <sup>      24     </sup>     [Exclusive Economic Zone under section 7] of the Territorial Waters, Continental Shelf, Exclusive        Economic Zone and other Maritime Zones Act, 1976, (80 of 1976)] and includes any bay, gulf, harbour, creek or        tidal river;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      25     </span></sup><span>     [(28A) "international courier terminal" means any place appointed under clause (f) of        sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7">section 7</a> to be an international courier terminal;]    </span></p><p><span>     (29) "land customs station" means any place appointed under clause (b) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7">section 7</a> to be a land customs        station;    </span></p><p><span>     (30) "market price", in relation to any goods, means the wholesale price of the goods in the ordinary course of        trade in India;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      26     </span></sup><span>     [(30A) "National Tax Tribunal" means the National Tax Tribunal established under section        3 of the National Tax Tribunal Act, 2005 (49 0f 2005);]    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      27     </span></sup><span>     [(30AA)    </span><span>     "notification" means notification published in the Official Gazette and the expression"notify" with its cognate        meaning and grammatical variation shall be construed accordingly;]    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      28     </span></sup><span>     [(30B) "passenger name record information" means the records prepared by an operator of        any aircraft or vessel or vehicle or his authorised agent for each journey booked by or on behalf of any        passenger;]    </span></p><p><span>     (31) "person-in-charge" means, -    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (a) in relation to a vessel, the master of the vessel;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (b) in relation to an aircraft, the commander or pilot-in-charge of the aircraft;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (c) in relation to a railway train, the conductor, guard or other person having the chief direction of the        train;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (d) in relation to any other conveyance, the driver or other person-in-charge of the conveyance;    </span></p><p><span>     (32) "prescribed" means prescribed by regulations made under this Act;    </span></p><p><span>     (33) "prohibited goods" means any goods the import or export of which is subject to any prohibition under this        Act or any other law for the time being in force but does not include any such goods in respect of which the        conditions subject to which the goods are permitted to be imported or exported have been complied with;    </span></p><p><span>     (34) "proper officer", in relation to any functions to be performed under this Act, means the officer of customs        who is assigned those functions by the Board or the     <sup>      29     </sup>     [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs] <br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </span><sup><span>30</span></sup><span>[under section 5];</span><br></p><p><span>     (35) "regulations" means the regulations made by the Board under any provision of this Act;    </span></p><p><span>     (36) "rules" means the rules made by the Central Government under any provision of this Act;    </span></p><p><span>     (37) "shipping bill" means a shipping bill referred to in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000090/1000002" alt="section 50">section 50</a>;    </span></p><p><span>     (38) "stores" means goods for use in a vessel or aircraft and includes fuel and spare parts and other articles        of equipment, whether or not for immediate fitting;    </span></p><p><span>     (39) "smuggling", in relation to any goods, means any act or omission which will render such goods liable to        confiscation under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000166/1000002" alt="section 111">section 111</a> or <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000168/1000002" alt="section 113">section 113</a>;    </span></p><p><span>     (40) "tariff value", in relation to any goods, means the tariff value fixed in respect thereof under sub-section        (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000028/1000002" alt="section 14">section 14</a>;    </span></p><p>    (41) "value", in relation to any goods, means the value thereof determined in accordance with the provisions      of    <sup style="">     31&nbsp;</sup>[sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000028/1000002" alt="Section 14">Section 14</a>];   </p><p><span>     (42) "vehicle" means conveyance of any kind used on land and includes a railway vehicle;    </span></p><p><sup style="">     32&nbsp;</sup><span>[(43) "warehouse" means a public warehouse licensed under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000099/1000002" alt="section 57">section 57</a> or a private        warehouse licensed under section 58 or a special warehouse licensed under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000101/1000002" alt="section 58A">section 58A</a>;]    </span></p><p><span>     (44) "warehoused goods" means goods deposited in a warehouse;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      33&nbsp;</span></sup><span>[***]    </span></p><div class="footnotes"><span>     1.    </span>    Substituted (w.e.f.11-10-1982) by s. 50 and Fifth Schedule of the Finance (No.2) Act, 1980 (44 of    1980).    <div><br>     <div><span>       2.      </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">       Substituted (w.e.f.26-05-1995) by s. 51(i) of the Finance Act, 1995 (22 of          1995)      </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">       for"Collector(Appeals)"      </span></div><div><span style="text-indent: 0in;">       <br>      </span></div><div><span>       3.Substituted (w.e.f. 14-5-2003) by s. 104 of the Finance Act, 2003 (32 of 2003). for         "Gold(Control)"      </span></div><div><span>       <br>      </span></div><div><span>       4. Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="edit"><strong>    Section 2.&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong><strong>Definitions   </strong>   -</div><div id="edit"><br></div><div id="edit"><p><strong>     <span>     </span></strong><span>     In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      1     </span></sup>    [(1) "adjudicating authority" means any authority competent to pass any      order or decision under this Act, but does not include the    <span style="font-size: 13.3333px;">    </span>    Board,    <sup>     2    </sup>    [Commissioner (Appeals)] or Appellate Tribunal;   </p><p><span>     (1A) "aircraft" has the same meaning as in the Aircraft Act, 1934 (22 of 1934);    </span></p><p><span>     (1B) "Appellate Tribunal" means the Customs, Excise and     <sup>      3     </sup>     [Service Tax] Appellate Tribunal        constituted under    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     <a href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/content-page/explore-act/1000203/1000002" alt="section 129" target="_blank">section 129</a>;]    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      4     </span></sup><span>     [(2) "assessment" means determination of the dutiability of any goods and the        amount of duty, tax, cess or any other sum so payable, if any, under this Act or under the Customs Tariff Act,        1975    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     (51 of 1975)    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     (hereinafter referred to as the Customs Tariff Act) or under any other law for        the time being in force, with reference to-    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     <br>     (a) the tariff classification of such goods as determined in accordance with the provisions of the Customs        Tariff Act;     <br>     <br>     (b) the value of such goods as determined in accordance with the provisions of this Act and the Customs Tariff        Act;     <br>     <br>     (c) exemption or concession of duty, tax, cess or any other sum, consequent upon any notification issued        therefor under this Act or under the Customs Tariff Act or under any other law for the time being in force;     <br>     <br>     (d) the quantity, weight, volume, measurement or other specifics where such duty, tax, cess or any other sum is        leviable on the basis of the quantity, weight, volume, measurement or other specifics of such goods;     <br>     <br>     (e) the origin of such goods determined in accordance with the provisions of the Customs Tariff Act or the rules        made thereunder, if the amount of duty, tax, cess or any other sum is affected by the origin of such goods;     <br>     <br>     (f) any other specific factor which affects the duty, tax, cess or any other sum payable on such goods, and        includes provisional    </span><span>     assessment, self-assessment, re-assessment and any assessment in which the duty assessed is nil    </span>    ;]    <br>   </p><p><span>     (3) "baggage" includes unaccompanied baggage but does not include motor vehicles;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      5     </span></sup><span>     [(3A) "beneficial owner" means any person on whose behalf the goods are        being imported or exported or who exercises effective control over the goods being imported or exported;]    </span></p><p><span>     (4) "bill of entry" means a bill of entry referred to in<a href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000086/1000002" alt=" section 46"> section 46</a>;    </span></p><p><span>     (5) "bill of export" means a bill of export referred to in<a href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000090/1000002" alt=" section 50"> section 50</a>;    </span></p><p><span>     (6)&nbsp; "Board" means the     <sup>      6     </sup>     [     <sup>      7     </sup></span><span>     Central Board of Indirect Taxes        and Customs]    </span><span>     constituted under the Central Boards of Revenue Act, 1963 (54 of 1963)];    </span></p><p><span>     (7) "coastal goods" means goods, other than imported goods, transported in a vessel from one port in India to        another;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      8     </span></sup><span>     [(7A) "Commissioner (Appeals)" means a person appointed to be a Commissioner of        Customs (Appeals) under sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000004/1000002" alt="section 4">section 4</a>;]    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      9     </span></sup><span>     (7B) "common portal" means the Common Customs Electronic Portal referred to        in section 154C;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      10     </span></sup>    [(8)    <sup>     11</sup>[Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs], except for the purposes of Chapter XV,        includes an Additional Commissioner of Customs;]   </p><p><span>     (9) "conveyance" includes a vessel, an aircraft and a vehicle;    </span></p><p><span>     (10) "customs airport" means any airport appointed under clause (a) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7 ">section 7 </a>to be a customs airport     <sup>      12     </sup>     [and includes a place appointed under clause (aa) of that section to be an air freight station];    </span></p><p><span>     (11) "customs area" means the area of a customs station     <sup>      13     </sup>     [or a warehouse] and includes any area in which imported goods or export goods are ordinarily kept        before clearance by Customs Authorities;    </span></p><p><span>     (12) "customs port" means any port appointed under clause (a) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7">section 7</a> to be a customs port     <sup>      14     </sup>     [and includes a place appointed under clause (aa) of that section to be an inland container depot];    </span></p><p><span>     (13) "customs station" means any customs port, customs airport    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     <sup>      15     </sup>     [,    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     international        courier terminal, foreign post office] or land customs station;    </span></p><p><span>     (14) "dutiable goods" means any goods which are chargeable to duty and on which duty has not been paid;    </span></p><p><span>     (15) "duty" means a duty of customs leviable under this Act;    </span></p><p><span>     (16) "entry" in relation to goods means an entry made in a bill of entry, shipping bill or bill of export and        includes     <sup>      16     </sup>     [* * *] the entry made under the regulations made under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000131/1000002" alt="section 84">section 84</a>;    </span></p><p><span>     (17) "examination", in relation to any goods, includes measurement and weighment thereof;    </span></p><p><span>     (18) "export", with its grammatical variations and cognate expressions, means taking out of India to a place        outside India;    </span></p><p><span>     (19) "export goods" means any goods which are to be taken out of India to a place outside India;    </span></p><p><span>     (20) "exporter", in relation to any goods at any time between their entry for export and the time when they are        exported, includes     <sup>      17     </sup>     [any owner, beneficial owner] or any person holding himself out to be the exporter;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      18     </span></sup><span>     [(20A) "foreign post office" means any post office appointed under clause (e) of        sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7">section 7</a> to be a foreign post office;]    </span></p><p><span>     (21) "foreign-going vessel or aircraft" means any vessel or aircraft for the time being engaged in the carriage        of goods or passengers between any port or airport in India and any port or airport outside India, whether        touching any intermediate port or airport in India or not, and includes -    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (i) any naval vessel of a foreign Government taking part in any naval        exercises;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (ii) any vessel engaged in fishing or any other operations outside the territorial        waters of India;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (iii) any vessel or aircraft proceeding to a place outside India for any purpose whatsoever;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      19     </span></sup><span>     [(21A)"Fund" means the Consumer Welfare Fund established under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000489/1000003" alt="section 12C">section 12C</a> of        the Central Excises and Salt Act    </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     <sup>      20     </sup></span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">     , 1944 (1 of 1944);]    </span></p><p><span>     (22) "goods" includes -    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (a) vessels, aircrafts and vehicles;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (b) stores;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (c) baggage;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (d) currency and negotiable instruments; and    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (e) any other kind of movable property;    </span></p><p><span>     (23) "import", with its grammatical variations and cognate expressions, means bringing into India from a place        outside India;    </span></p><p>    (24)    <sup>     21    </sup>    ["arrival manifest or import manifest"]      or"import report" means the manifest or report required to be delivered under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000068/1000002" alt="section 30">section 30</a>;   </p><p><span>     (25) "imported goods" means any goods brought into India from a place outside India but does not include goods        which have been cleared for home consumption;    </span></p><p><span>     (26) "importer", in relation to any goods at any time between their importation and the time when they are        cleared for home consumption, includes     <sup>      22     </sup>     [any owner, beneficial owner] or any person holding himself out to be the importer;    </span></p><p><span>     (27) "India" includes the territorial waters of India;    </span></p><p><span>     (28) "Indian Customs Waters" means the     <sup>      23     </sup>     [waters extending into the sea up to the limit of     <sup>      24     </sup>     [Exclusive Economic Zone under section 7] of the Territorial Waters, Continental Shelf, Exclusive        Economic Zone and other Maritime Zones Act, 1976, (80 of 1976)] and includes any bay, gulf, harbour, creek or        tidal river;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      25     </span></sup><span>     [(28A) "international courier terminal" means any place appointed under clause (f) of        sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7">section 7</a> to be an international courier terminal;]    </span></p><p><span>     (29) "land customs station" means any place appointed under clause (b) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7">section 7</a> to be a land customs        station;    </span></p><p><span>     (30) "market price", in relation to any goods, means the wholesale price of the goods in the ordinary course of        trade in India;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      26     </span></sup><span>     [(30A) "National Tax Tribunal" means the National Tax Tribunal established under section        3 of the National Tax Tribunal Act, 2005 (49 0f 2005);]    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      27     </span></sup><span>     [(30AA)    </span><span>     "notification" means notification published in the Official Gazette and the expression"notify" with its cognate        meaning and grammatical variation shall be construed accordingly;]    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      28     </span></sup><span>     [(30B) "passenger name record information" means the records prepared by an operator of        any aircraft or vessel or vehicle or his authorised agent for each journey booked by or on behalf of any        passenger;]    </span></p><p><span>     (31) "person-in-charge" means, -    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (a) in relation to a vessel, the master of the vessel;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (b) in relation to an aircraft, the commander or pilot-in-charge of the aircraft;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (c) in relation to a railway train, the conductor, guard or other person having the chief direction of the        train;    </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>     (d) in relation to any other conveyance, the driver or other person-in-charge of the conveyance;    </span></p><p><span>     (32) "prescribed" means prescribed by regulations made under this Act;    </span></p><p><span>     (33) "prohibited goods" means any goods the import or export of which is subject to any prohibition under this        Act or any other law for the time being in force but does not include any such goods in respect of which the        conditions subject to which the goods are permitted to be imported or exported have been complied with;    </span></p><p><span>     (34) "proper officer", in relation to any functions to be performed under this Act, means the officer of customs        who is assigned those functions by the Board or the     <sup>      29     </sup>     [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs] <br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </span><sup><span>30</span></sup><span>[under section 5];</span><br></p><p><span>     (35) "regulations" means the regulations made by the Board under any provision of this Act;    </span></p><p><span>     (36) "rules" means the rules made by the Central Government under any provision of this Act;    </span></p><p><span>     (37) "shipping bill" means a shipping bill referred to in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000090/1000002" alt="section 50">section 50</a>;    </span></p><p><span>     (38) "stores" means goods for use in a vessel or aircraft and includes fuel and spare parts and other articles        of equipment, whether or not for immediate fitting;    </span></p><p><span>     (39) "smuggling", in relation to any goods, means any act or omission which will render such goods liable to        confiscation under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000166/1000002" alt="section 111">section 111</a> or <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000168/1000002" alt="section 113">section 113</a>;    </span></p><p><span>     (40) "tariff value", in relation to any goods, means the tariff value fixed in respect thereof under sub-section        (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000028/1000002" alt="section 14">section 14</a>;    </span></p><p>    (41) "value", in relation to any goods, means the value thereof determined in accordance with the provisions      of    <sup style="">     31&nbsp;</sup>[sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000028/1000002" alt="Section 14">Section 14</a>];   </p><p><span>     (42) "vehicle" means conveyance of any kind used on land and includes a railway vehicle;    </span></p><p><sup style="">     32&nbsp;</sup><span>[(43) "warehouse" means a public warehouse licensed under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000099/1000002" alt="section 57">section 57</a> or a private        warehouse licensed under section 58 or a special warehouse licensed under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000002/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000101/1000002" alt="section 58A">section 58A</a>;]    </span></p><p><span>     (44) "warehoused goods" means goods deposited in a warehouse;    </span></p><p><sup>     <span>      33&nbsp;</span></sup><span>[***]    </span></p><div class="footnotes"><span>     1.    </span>    Substituted (w.e.f.11-10-1982) by s. 50 and Fifth Schedule of the Finance (No.2) Act, 1980 (44 of    1980).    <div><br>     <div><span>       2.      </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">       Substituted (w.e.f.26-05-1995) by s. 51(i) of the Finance Act, 1995 (22 of          1995)      </span><span style="text-indent: 0in;">       for"Collector(Appeals)"      </span></div><div><span style="text-indent: 0in;">       <br>      </span></div><div><span>       3.Substituted (w.e.f. 14-5-2003) by s. 104 of the Finance Act, 2003 (32 of 2003). for         "Gold(Control)"      </span></div><div><span>       <br>      </span></div><div><span>       4.  Section 5

Data from Section 5:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><strong>    Section 5. Powers of officers of customs. -   </strong><p></p><p>    (1) Subject to such conditions and limitations as the Board may        impose, an officer of customs may exercise the powers and discharge the        duties conferred or imposed on him under this Act.</p><p><sup>1</sup>[(1A) Without prejudice to the provisions contained in sub-section (1), the Board may, by notification, assign such functions as it may deem fit, to an officer of customs, who shall be the proper officer in relation to such functions.<br></p><p>(1B) Within their jurisdiction assigned by the Board, the Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs, as the case may be, may, by order, assign such functions, as he may deem fit, to an officer of customs,<br>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;who shall be the proper officer in relation to such functions.]<br></p><p>    (2) An officer of customs may exercise the        powers and discharge the duties conferred or imposed under this Act on        any other officer of customs who is subordinate to him.   </p><p>    (3) Notwithstanding anything contained in this section, <sup>2</sup>[a <sup>3</sup>[Commissioner (Appeals)]] shall not exercise the powers and        discharge the duties conferred or imposed on an officer of customs other        than those specified in <sup><font size="1">4</font></sup>[Chapter XV, section 108 and        sub-section (1D) of section 110].   </p><p><sup>5</sup>[(4) In specifying the conditions and limitations referred to in sub-section (1), and in assigning functions under sub-section (1A), the Board may consider any one or more of the following criteria, including, but not limited to</p><p>(a) territorial jurisdiction;</p><p>(b) persons or class of persons;</p><p>(c) goods or class of goods;</p><p>(d) cases or class of cases;</p><p>(e) computer assigned random assignment;</p><p>(f) any other criterion as the Board may, by notification, specify.</p><p>(5) The Board may, by notification, wherever necessary or appropriate, require two or more officers of customs (whether or not of the same class) to have concurrent powers and functions to be performed under this Act.]</p><p><br>   </p><div class="footnotes"><p>1. Inserted by s. 88&nbsp; of Finance Act 2022 (6 of 2022).</p><p>2. Substituted by Act 22 of 1995, section 50, for"Collector          (Appeals)" (w.e.f. 26-5-1995)    </p><p>4. Substituted (w.e.f. 28-03-2021) section 90 of Finance Act 2021 (13          of 2021)    </p><p>5.&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); font-family: &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; display: inline !important; float: none;">Inserted by s. 88&nbsp; of Finance Act 2022 (6 of 2022).</span><br></p></div></span>

 Section 6

Data from Section 6:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">

 
  <meta content="text/html; charset=utf-8" http-equiv="Content-Type">
 
 
  <div id="edit">
   <b>
    Section 6
   </b>
   .
   <strong>
    Entrustment of functions of Board and customs officers on certain other officers
   </strong>
   . -
   <p>
   </p>
   <p>
    The Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, entrust either conditionally or
            unconditionally to any officer of the Central or the State Government or a local authority any functions of
            the Board or any officer of customs under this Act.
   </p>
  </div>
 
</span>

 Section 7

Data from Section 7:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">

 
  <meta content="text/html; charset=utf-8" http-equiv="Content-Type">
 
 
  <div id="edit">
   <b>
    Section 7.  Appointment of customs ports, airports, etc.

            -
   </b>
   <p>
   </p>
   <p>
    <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [(1)] The
    <sup>
     2
    </sup>
    [Board] may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint -
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (a) the ports and airports which alone shall be customs ports or customs airports for the unloading of
            imported goods and the loading of export goods or any class of such goods;
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    <sup>
     3
    </sup>
    [(aa) the places which alone shall be inland
    <sup>
     <span>
      4
     </span>
    </sup>
    [container depots or air freight stations] for the unloading of imported goods and the
            loading of export goods or any class of such goods;]
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (b) the places which alone shall be land customs stations for the clearance of goods imported or to be
            exported by land or inland water or any class of such goods;
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (c) the routes by which alone goods or any class of goods specified in the notification may pass
            by land or inland water into or out of India, or to or from any land customs station from or to
            any  land frontier;
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (d) the ports which alone shall be coastal ports for the carrying on of trade in coastal goods or any class
            of such goods with all or any specified ports in India.
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    <sup>
     <span>
      5
     </span>
    </sup>
    [(e) the post offices which alone shall be foreign post offices for the clearance of
            imported goods or export goods or any class of such goods;
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (f) the places which alone shall be international courier terminals for the clearance of imported goods or
            export goods or any class of such goods.]
   </p>
   <p>
    <sup>
     6
    </sup>
    [(2) Every notification issued under this section and in force immediately before the
            commencement of the Finance Act, 2003 shall, on such commencement, be deemed to have been issued under the
            provisions of this section as amended by section 105 of the Finance Act, 2003 and shall continue to have the
            same force and effect after such commencement until it is amended, rescinded or superseded under the
            provisions of this section.]
   </p>
   <div class="footnotes">
    <p>
     1. Section 7 renumbered as sub-section(1) thereof  by s. 105 of the Finance Act, 2003 (32 of 2003)
            (w.e.f. 14-5-2003).
    </p>
    <p>
     2. Substituted (w.e.f. 14-5-2003) by s. 105(a) of the Finance Act, 2003 (32 of 2003) for Central Government.
    </p>
    <p>
     3.
     <span style="text-indent: 0in;">
      Inserted (w.e.f. 13-5-1983) by s. 47 of the Finance Act, 1983 (11 of
                1983).
     </span>
    </p>
    <p>
     4. Substituted (w.e.f. 28-5-2012) by s. 121 of the Finance Act, 2012 (23 of 2012) for container depots.
    </p>
    <p>
     5.
     <span style="text-indent: 0in;">
      Inserted (w.e.f. 31-3-2017) by s. 90 of the Finance Act, 2017 (7 of
                2017).
     </span>
    </p>
    <p>
     6. Inserted (w.e.f. 14-5-2003) by s. 105(b) of the Finance Act, 2003 (32 of 2003).

  <div id="edit">
   <b>
    Section 7.  Appointment of customs ports, airports, etc.

            -
   </b>
   <p>
   </p>
   <p>
    <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [(1)] The
    <sup>
     2
    </sup>
    [Board] may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint -
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (a) the ports and airports which alone shall be customs ports or customs airports for the unloading of
            imported goods and the loading of export goods or any class of such goods;
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    <sup>
     3
    </sup>
    [(aa) the places which alone shall be inland
    <sup>
     <span>
      4
     </span>
    </sup>
    [container depots or air freight stations] for the unloading of imported goods and the
            loading of export goods or any class of such goods;]
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (b) the places which alone shall be land customs stations for the clearance of goods imported or to be
            exported by land or inland water or any class of such goods;
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (c) the routes by which alone goods or any class of goods specified in the notification may pass
            by land or inland water into or out of India, or to or from any land customs station from or to
            any  land frontier;
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (d) the ports which alone shall be coastal ports for the carrying on of trade in coastal goods or any class
            of such goods with all or any specified ports in India.
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    <sup>
     <span>
      5
     </span>
    </sup>
    [(e) the post offices which alone shall be foreign post offices for the clearance of
            imported goods or export goods or any class of such goods;
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (f) the places which alone shall be international courier terminals for the clearance of imported goods or
            export goods or any class of such goods.]
   </p>
   <p>
    <sup>
     6
    </sup>
    [(2) Every notification issued under this section and in force immediately before the
            commencement of the Finance Act, 2003 shall, on such commencement, be deemed to have been issued under the
            provisions of this section as amended by section 105 of the Finance Act, 2003 and shall continue to have the
            same force and effect after such commencement until it is amended, rescinded or superseded under the
            provisions of this section.]
   </p>
   <div class="footnotes">

     1. Section 7 renumbered as sub-section(1) thereof  by s. 105 of the Finance Act, 2003 (32 of 2003)
            (w.e.f. 14-5-2003).

 Section 11

Data from Section 11:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>   Section 11.  Power to prohibit importation or exportation of goods.-  </strong></p><p></p><p>   (1) If the Central Government is satisfied that it is necessary so to do for any of the purposes specified in sub-section (2), it may, by notification in the Official Gazette, prohibit either absolutely or subject to such conditions (to be fulfilled before or after clearance) as may be specified in the notification, the import or export of goods of any specified description.  </p><p>   (2) The purposes referred to in sub-section (1) are the following :-  </p><div style="padding-left: 40px;"><p>    (a)   the maintenance of the security of India;   </p><p>    (b)   the maintenance of public order and standards of decency or morality;   </p><p>    (c) the prevention of smuggling;   </p><p>    (d) the prevention of shortage of goods of any description;   </p><p>    (e) the conservation of foreign exchange and the safeguarding of balance of payments;   </p><p>    (f) the prevention of injury to the economy of the country by the uncontrolled import or export of    <sup>     1    </sup>    [                        gold or silver or any other goods];   </p><p>    (g)   the prevention of surplus of any agricultural product or the product of fisheries;   </p><p>    (h)   the maintenance of standards for the classification, grading or marketing of goods in international trade;   </p><p>    (i)   the establishment of any industry;   </p><p>    (j)   the prevention of serious injury to domestic production of goods of any description;   </p><p>    (k)   the protection of human, animal or plant life or health;   </p><p>    (l)   the protection of national treasures of artistic, historic or archaeological value;   </p><p>    (m)   the conservation of exhaustible natural resources;   </p><p>    (n)   the protection of patents, trademarks,&nbsp;<sup>&nbsp;2    </sup>    [copyrights, designs and geographical indications];   </p><p>    (o)   the prevention of deceptive practices;   </p><p>    (p)   the carrying on of foreign trade in any goods by the State, or by a Corporation owned or controlled by the State to the exclusion, complete or partial, of citizens of India;   </p><p>    (q)   the fulfilment of obligations under the Charter of the United Nations for the maintenance of international peace and security;   </p><p>    (r)   the implementation of any treaty, agreement or convention with any country;   </p><p>    (s)   the compliance of imported goods with any laws which are applicable to similar goods produced or manufactured in India;   </p><p>    (t)   the prevention of dissemination of documents containing any matter which is likely to prejudicially affect friendly relations with any foreign State or is derogatory to national prestige;   </p><p>    (u)   the prevention of the contravention of any law for the time being in force; and   </p><p>    (v)   any other purpose conducive to the interests of the general public.   </p></div><p><sup>    3   </sup>   [(3) Any prohibition or restriction or obligation relating to import or export of any goods or class of goods or clearance thereof provided in any other law for the time being in force, or any rule or regulation made or any order or notification issued thereunder, shall be executed under the provisions of that Act only if such prohibition or restriction or obligation is notified under the provisions of this Act, subject to such exceptions, modifications or adaptations as the Central Government deems fit.]  </p><div class="footnotes"><p>    1. Substituted (w.e.f. 27-3-2020) for the words"gold or silver" by s. 107 of the Finance Act, 2020 (12 of 2020).   </p><p>    2 .Substituted (w.e.f. 10-5-2013) by s. 64 of the Finance Act, 2013 (17 of 2013) for "copyrights"   </p><p>    3. Inserted by s. 59 of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018) from a date to be notified.   </p></div></span>



Component 2:

  </p><p>    (b)   the maintenance of public order and standards of decency or morality;   </p><p>    (c) the prevention of smuggling;   </p><p>    (d) the prevention of shortage of goods of any description;   </p><p>    (e) the conservation of foreign exchange and the safeguarding of balance of payments;   </p><p>    (f) the prevention of injury to the economy of the country by the uncontrolled import or export of    <sup>     1    </sup>    [                        gold or silver or any other goods];   </p><p>    (g)   the prevention of surplus of any agricultural product or the product of fisheries;   </p><p>    (h)   the maintenance of standards for the classification, grading or marketing of goods in international trade;   </p><p>    (i)   the establishment of any industry;   </p><p>    (j)   the prevention of serious injury to domestic production of goods of any description;   </p><p>    (k)   the protection of human, animal or plant life or health;   </p><p>    (l)   the protection of national treasures of artistic, historic or archaeological value;   </p><p>    (m)   the conservation of exhaustible natural resources;   </p><p>    (n)   the protection of patents, trademarks,&nbsp;<sup>&nbsp;2    </sup>    [copyrights, designs and geographical indications];   </p><p>    (o)   the prevention of deceptive practices;   </p><p>    (p)   the carrying on of foreign trade in any goods by the State, or by a Corporation owned or controlled by the State to the exclusion, complete or partial, of citizens of India;   </p><p>    (q)   the fulfilment of obligations under the Charter of the United Nations for the maintenance of international peace and security;   </p><p>    (r)   the implementation of any treaty, agreement or convention with any country;   </p><p>    (u)   the prevention of the contravention of any law for the time being in force; and   </p><p>    (v)   any other purpose conducive to the interests of the general public.   </p></div><p><sup>    3   </sup>   [(3) Any prohibition or restriction or obligation relating to import or export of any goods or class of goods or clearance thereof provided in any other law for the time being in force, or any rule or regulation made or any order or notification issued thereunder, shall be executed under the provisions of that Act only if such prohibition or restriction or obligation is notified under the provisions of this Act, subject to such exceptions, modifications or adaptations as the Central Government deems fit.]  </p><div class="footnotes"><p>    1.  Section 11A

Data from Section 11A:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 11A Definitions                        . -   </strong></p><p>   In this Chapter, unless the context otherwise requires,-  </p><p>   (a) "illegal import" means the import of any goods in contravention of the provisions of this Act or any other law for the time being in force;  </p><p>   (b) "intimated place" means a place intimated under sub-section (1), sub-section (2) or sub-section (3), as the case may be, of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000012/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000014/1000002" alt="section 11C">section 11C</a>;  </p><p>   (c) "notified date", in relation to goods of any description, means the date on which the notification in relation to such goods is issued under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000012/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000013/1000002" alt="section 11B">section 11B</a>;  </p><p>   (d) "notified goods" means goods specified in the notification issued under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000012/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000013/1000002" alt="section 11B">section 11B</a>.  </p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 11A Definitions                        . -   </strong></p><p>   In this Chapter, unless the context otherwise requires,-  </p><p>   (a) "illegal import" means the import of any goods in contravention of the provisions of this Act or any other law for the time being in force;  </p><p>   (b) "intimated place" means a place intimated under sub-section (1), sub-section (2) or sub-section (3), as the case may be, of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000012/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000014/1000002" alt="section 11C">section 11C</a>;  </p><p>   (c) "notified date", in relation to goods of any description, means the date on which the notification in relation to such goods is issued under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000012/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000013/1000002" alt="section 11B">section 11B</a>;  </p><p>   (d) "notified goods" means goods specified in the notification issued under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000012/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000013/1000002" alt="section 11B">section 11B</a>.  </p></span>



 Section 11B

Data from Section 11B:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <strong>
    Section 11B. Power of Central Government to notify goods.
   </strong>
   -
  </p>
  <p>
   If, having regard to the magnitude of the illegal import of goods of any class or description, the Central Government is satisfied that it is expedient in the public interest to take special measures for the purpose of checking the illegal import, circulation or disposal of such goods, or facilitating the detection of such goods, it may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify goods of such class or description.
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <strong>
    Section 11B. Power of Central Government to notify goods.
   </strong>
   -
  </p>
  <p>
   If, having regard to the magnitude of the illegal import of goods of any class or description, the Central Government is satisfied that it is expedient in the public interest to take special measures for the purpose of checking the illegal import, circulation or disposal of such goods, or facilitating the detection of such goods, it may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify goods of such class or description.
  </p>
 
</span>



 Section 11C

Data from Section 11C:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 11C. Persons possessing notified goods to intimate the place of storage, etc. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) Every person who owns, possesses or controls, on the notified date, any notified goods, shall, within seven days from that date, deliver to the proper officer a statement (in such form, in such manner and containing such particulars <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000014/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000433/1000002" alt="as may be specified by rules">as may be specified by rules</a> made in this behalf) in relation to the notified goods owned, possessed or controlled by him and the place where such goods are kept or stored.  </p><p>   (2) Every person who acquires, after the notified date, any notified goods, shall, before making such acquisition, deliver to the proper officer an intimation containing the particulars of the place where such goods are proposed to be kept or stored after such acquisition and shall, immediately on such acquisition, deliver to the proper officer a statement (in such form, in such manner and containing such particulars <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000014/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000433/1000002" alt="as may be specified by rules">as may be specified by rules</a> made in this behalf) in relation to the notified goods acquired by him :  </p><p><strong>    Provided   </strong>   that a person who has delivered a statement, whether under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2), in relation to any notified goods, owned, possessed, controlled or acquired by him, shall not be required to deliver any further statement in relation to any notified goods acquired by him, after the date of delivery of the said statement, so long as the notified goods so acquired are kept or stored at the intimated place.  </p><p>   (3) If any person intends to shift any notified goods to any place other than the intimated place, he shall, before taking out such goods from the intimated place, deliver to the proper officer an intimation containing the particulars of the place to which such goods are proposed to be shifted.  </p><p>   (4) No person shall, after the expiry of seven days from the notified date, keep or store any notified goods at any place other than the intimated place.  </p><p>   (5) Where any notified goods have been sold or transferred, such goods shall not be taken from one place to another unless they are accompanied by the voucher referred to in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000014/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000017/1000002" alt="section 11F">section 11F</a>.  </p><p>   (6) No notified goods (other than those which have been sold or transferred) shall be taken from one place to another unless they are accompanied by a transport voucher (in such form and containing such particulars <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000014/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000433/1000002" alt="as may be specified by rules">as may be specified by rules</a> made in this behalf) prepared by the persons owning, possessing or controlling such goods.  </p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 11C. Persons possessing notified goods to intimate the place of storage, etc. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) Every person who owns, possesses or controls, on the notified date, any notified goods, shall, within seven days from that date, deliver to the proper officer a statement (in such form, in such manner and containing such particulars <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000014/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000433/1000002" alt="as may be specified by rules">as may be specified by rules</a> made in this behalf) in relation to the notified goods owned, possessed or controlled by him and the place where such goods are kept or stored.  </p><p>   (2) Every person who acquires, after the notified date, any notified goods, shall, before making such acquisition, deliver to the proper officer an intimation containing the particulars of the place where such goods are proposed to be kept or stored after such acquisition and shall, immediately on such acquisition, deliver to the proper officer a statement (in such form, in such manner and containing such particulars <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000014/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000433/1000002" alt="as may be specified by rules">as may be specified by rules</a> made in this behalf) in relation to the notified goods acquired by him :  </p><p><strong>    Provided   </strong>   that a person who has delivered a statement, whether under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2), in relation to any notified goods, owned, possessed, controlled or acquired by him, shall not be required to deliver any further statement in relation to any notified goods acquired by him, after the date of delivery of the said statement, so long as the notified goods so acquired are kept or stored at the intimated place.  </p><p>   (3) If any person intends to shift any notified goods to any place other than the intimated place, he shall, before taking out such goods from the intimated place, deliver to the proper officer an intimation containing the particulars of the place to which such goods are proposed to be shifted.  </p><p>   (4) No person shall, after the expiry of seven days from the notified date, keep or store any notified goods at any place other than the intimated place.  </p><p>   (5) Where any notified goods have been sold or transferred, such goods shall not be taken from one place to another unless they are accompanied by the voucher referred to in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000014/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000017/1000002" alt="section 11F">section 11F</a>.  </p><p>   (6) No notified goods (other than those which have been sold or transferred) shall be taken from one place to another unless they are accompanied by a transport voucher (in such form and containing such particulars <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000014/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000433/1000002" alt="as may be specified by rules">as may be specified by rules</a> made in this behalf) prepared by the persons owning, possessing or controlling such goods.  </p></span>



 Section 11D

Data from Section 11D:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 11D   </strong>   .   <strong>    Precautions to be taken by persons acquiring notified goods   </strong>   . -  </p><p>   No person shall acquire (except by gift or succession, from any other individual in India), after the notified date, any notified goods -  </p><p>   (i) unless such goods are accompanied by, -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) the voucher referred to in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000015/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000017/1000002" alt="section 11F">section 11F</a> or the memorandum referred to in sub-section (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000015/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000018/1000002" alt="section 11G">section 11G</a>, as the case may be, or  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) in the case of a person who has himself imported any goods, any evidence showing clearance of such goods by the Customs Authorities; and  </p><p>   (ii) unless he has taken, before acquiring such goods from a person other than a dealer having a fixed place of business, such reasonable steps <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000015/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000433/1000002" alt="as may be specified by rules">as may be specified by rules</a> made in this behalf, to ensure that the goods so acquired by him are not goods which have been illegally imported.  </p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 11D   </strong>   .   <strong>    Precautions to be taken by persons acquiring notified goods   </strong>   . -  </p><p>   No person shall acquire (except by gift or succession, from any other individual in India), after the notified date, any notified goods -  </p><p>   (i) unless such goods are accompanied by, -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) the voucher referred to in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000015/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000017/1000002" alt="section 11F">section 11F</a> or the memorandum referred to in sub-section (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000015/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000018/1000002" alt="section 11G">section 11G</a>, as the case may be, or  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) in the case of a person who has himself imported any goods, any evidence showing clearance of such goods by the Customs Authorities; and  </p><p>   (ii) unless he has taken, before acquiring such goods from a person other than a dealer having a fixed place of business, such reasonable steps <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000015/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000433/1000002" alt="as may be specified by rules">as may be specified by rules</a> made in this behalf, to ensure that the goods so acquired by him are not goods which have been illegally imported.  </p></span>



 Section 11E

Data from Section 11E:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 11E   </strong>   .   <strong>    Persons possessing notified goods to maintain accounts   </strong>   . -  </p><p>   (1) Every person who, on or after the notified date, owns, possesses, controls or acquires any notified goods shall maintain (in such form and in such manner <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000016/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000433/1000002" alt="as may be specified by rules">as may be specified by rules</a> made in this behalf) a true and complete account of such goods and shall, as often as he acquires or parts with any notified goods, make an entry in the said account in relation to such acquisition or parting with, and shall also state therein the particulars of the person from whom such goods have been acquired or in whose favour such goods have been parted with, as the case may be, and such account shall be kept, along with the goods, at the place of storage of the notified goods to which such accounts relate :  </p><p><strong>    Provided   </strong>   that it shall not be necessary to maintain separately accounts in the form and manner specified by rules made in this behalf in the case of a person who is already maintaining accounts which contain the particulars specified by the said rules.  </p><p>   (2) Every person who owns, possesses or controls any notified goods and who uses any such goods for the manufacture of any other goods, shall maintain (in such form, in such manner and containing such particulars as may be specified by rules made in this behalf) a true and complete account of the notified goods so used by him and shall keep such account at the intimated place.  </p><p></p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 11E   </strong>   .   <strong>    Persons possessing notified goods to maintain accounts   </strong>   . -  </p><p>   (1) Every person who, on or after the notified date, owns, possesses, controls or acquires any notified goods shall maintain (in such form and in such manner <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000016/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000433/1000002" alt="as may be specified by rules">as may be specified by rules</a> made in this behalf) a true and complete account of such goods and shall, as often as he acquires or parts with any notified goods, make an entry in the said account in relation to such acquisition or parting with, and shall also state therein the particulars of the person from whom such goods have been acquired or in whose favour such goods have been parted with, as the case may be, and such account shall be kept, along with the goods, at the place of storage of the notified goods to which such accounts relate :  </p><p><strong>    Provided   </strong>   that it shall not be necessary to maintain separately accounts in the form and manner specified by rules made in this behalf in the case of a person who is already maintaining accounts which contain the particulars specified by the said rules.  </p><p>   (2) Every person who owns, possesses or controls any notified goods and who uses any such goods for the manufacture of any other goods, shall maintain (in such form, in such manner and containing such particulars as may be specified by rules made in this behalf) a true and complete account of the notified goods so used by him and shall keep such account at the intimated place.  </p><p></p></span>

 Section 11G

Data from Section 11G:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 11G   </strong>   .   <strong>    Sections 11C, 11E and 11F not to apply to goods in personal use   </strong>   . -  </p><p>   (1) Nothing in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000018/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000014/1000002" alt="sections 11C">sections 11C</a>, <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000018/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000016/1000002" alt="11E">11E</a> and <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000018/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000017/1000002" alt="11F">11F</a> shall apply to any notified goods which are -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) in personal use of the person by whom they are owned, possessed or controlled, or  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) kept in the residential premises of a person for his personal use.  </p><div><p>    (2) If any person, who is in possession of any notified goods referred to in sub-section (1), sells, or otherwise transfers for a valuable consideration, any such goods, he shall issue to the purchaser or transferee, as the case may be, a memorandum containing such particulars <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000018/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000433/1000002" alt="as may be specified by rules">as may be specified by rules</a> made in this behalf and no such goods shall be taken from one place to another unless they are accompanied by the said memorandum.]   </p></div><p><span>   </span></p></span>



Component 2:
