 Section 19

Data from Section 19:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
   <b>
    Section 19. Determination of duty where goods consist of articles
        liable to different rates of duty.-
   </b>
   <br>
  </p>
  <p>
   <span>
    <b>
    </b>
    Except as otherwise provided in any law
        for the time being in force, where goods consist of a set of articles, duty
        shall be calculated as follows :-
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (a)
    <span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <span>
    articles liable to duty
        with reference to quantity shall be chargeable to that duty;
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (b)
    <span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <span>
    articles liable to duty
        with reference to value shall, if they are liable to duty at the same rate, be
        chargeable to duty at that rate, and if they are liable to duty at different rates,
        be chargeable to duty at the highest of such rates;
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (c)
    <span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <span>
    articles not liable to
        duty shall be chargeable to duty at the rate at which articles liable to duty
        with reference to value are liable under clause (b):
   </span>
  </p>
  <p>
   <span>
    <b>
     Provided
    </b>
    that, -
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (a) accessories of, and
        spare parts or maintenance and repairing implements for, any article which
        satisfy the conditions specified in the rules made in this behalf shall be
        chargeable at the same rate of duty as that article;
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (b) if the importer
        produces evidence to the satisfaction of the proper officer
    <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [or
        the evidence is available] regarding the value of any of the articles liable to
        different rates of duty, such article shall be chargeable to duty separately at
        the rate applicable to it.
   </span>
  </p>
  <div class="footnotes">
   <div>
    <p>
     <span>
      1. Inserted by Act 8 of 2011, section 40(w.e.f. 08-4-2011)
     </span>
    </p>
   </div>
  </div>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
   <b>
    Section 19. Determination of duty where goods consist of articles
        liable to different rates of duty.-
   </b>
   <br>
  </p>
  <p>
   <span>
    <b>
    </b>
    Except as otherwise provided in any law
        for the time being in force, where goods consist of a set of articles, duty
        shall be calculated as follows :-
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (a)
    <span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <span>
    articles liable to duty
        with reference to quantity shall be chargeable to that duty;
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (b)
    <span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <span>
    articles liable to duty
        with reference to value shall, if they are liable to duty at the same rate, be
        chargeable to duty at that rate, and if they are liable to duty at different rates,
        be chargeable to duty at the highest of such rates;
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (c)
    <span>
    </span>
   </span>
   <span>
    articles not liable to
        duty shall be chargeable to duty at the rate at which articles liable to duty
        with reference to value are liable under clause (b):
   </span>
  </p>
  <p>
   <span>
    <b>
     Provided
    </b>
    that, -
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (a) accessories of, and
        spare parts or maintenance and repairing implements for, any article which
        satisfy the conditions specified in the rules made in this behalf shall be
        chargeable at the same rate of duty as that article;
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (b) if the importer
        produces evidence to the satisfaction of the proper officer
    <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [or
        the evidence is available] regarding the value of any of the articles liable to
        different rates of duty, such article shall be chargeable to duty separately at
        the rate applicable to it.
   </span>

    <p>

     </span>

 Section 20

   <span>
    <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [
    <b>
     Section 20. Re-importation of goods. -
    </b>
   </span>
  </p>
  <p>
   <span>
    <b>
    </b>
    If goods are
        imported into India after exportation therefrom, such goods shall be liable to
        duty and be subject to all the conditions and restrictions, if any, to which
        goods of the like kind and value are liable or subject, on the importation
        thereof;
   </span>
  </p>
  <p>

                section 2(w.e.f. 27-12-1985).

 Section 21

Data from Section 21:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <span>
    <b>
     Section 21. Goods derelict, wreck, etc.-
    </b>
   </span>
  </p>
  <p>
   <span>
    <b>
    </b>
    All goods, derelict, jetsam,
flotsam and wreck brought or coming into India, shall be dealt with as if they
were imported into India, unless it be shown to the satisfaction of the proper
officer that they are entitled to be admitted duty-free under this Act.
   </span>
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <span>
    <b>
     Section 21. Goods derelict, wreck, etc.-
    </b>

   <span>

    </b>
    All goods, derelict, jetsam,
flotsam and wreck brought or coming into India, shall be dealt with as if they
were imported into India, unless it be shown to the satisfaction of the proper
officer that they are entitled to be admitted duty-free under this Act.

 Section 22

Data from Section 22:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <strong>     Section 22. Abatement of duty on damaged or deteriorated goods. -    </strong></span></p><p><span>    (1) Where        it is shown to the satisfaction of the    <sup>     1    </sup>    [Assistant Commissioner of        Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs] -   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (a) that any imported goods        had been damaged or had deteriorated at any time before or during the unloading        of the goods in India; or   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (b) that any imported        goods, other than warehoused goods, had been damaged at any time after the        unloading thereof in India but before their examination under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000036/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000031/1000002" alt="section 17">section 17</a>, on        account of any accident not due to any wilful act, negligence or default of the        importer, his employee or agent; or   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (c) that any warehoused        goods had been damaged at any time before clearance for home consumption on        account of any accident not due to any wilful act, negligence or default of the        owner, his employee or agent,   </span></p><p><span>    such goods shall be chargeable        to duty in accordance with the provisions of sub-section (2).   </span></p><p><span>    (2)         The duty to be charged on the goods referred to in sub-section (1) shall bear        the same proportion to the duty chargeable on the goods before the damage or        deterioration which the value of the damaged or deteriorated goods bears to the        value of the goods before the damage or deterioration.   </span></p><p><span>    (3) For the purposes of this section, the value of damaged or deteriorated        goods may be ascertained by either of the following methods at the option of        the owner:   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (a) the value of such goods        may be ascertained by the proper officer, or   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (b) such goods may be sold        by the proper officer by public auction or by tender, or with the consent of        the owner in any other manner, and the gross sale proceeds shall be deemed to        be the value of such goods.    <br>   </span></p><div class="footnotes"><div><p><span>      1. Substituted by Act 27 of 1999, section 100, for "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" (w.e.f.                11-5-1999). Earlier the words "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" were substituted by Act 22 of 1995,                section 50, for the words "Assistant Collector of Customs (w.e.f. 26-5-1995).     </span></p></div></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <strong>     Section 22. Abatement of duty on damaged or deteriorated goods. -    </strong></span></p><p><span>    (1) Where        it is shown to the satisfaction of the    <sup>     1    </sup>    [Assistant Commissioner of        Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs] -   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (a) that any imported goods        had been damaged or had deteriorated at any time before or during the unloading        of the goods in India;  Section 24

Data from Section 24:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <br>    <strong>     Section 24. Power to make rules for denaturing or mutilation of goods.-    </strong></span></p><p><span>    <strong>    </strong>    The Central Government <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000038/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000066/1000002" alt="may make rules">may make rules</a> for permitting at the request ofthe owner the denaturing or mutilation of imported goods which are ordinarilyused for more than one purpose so as to render them unfit for one or more ofsuch purposes; and where any goods are so denatured or mutilated they shall bechargeable to duty at such rate as would be applicable if the goods had beenimported in the denatured or mutilated form.   </span></p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <br>    <strong>     Section 24. Power to make rules for denaturing or mutilation of goods.-    </strong></span></p><p><span>    <strong>    </strong>    The Central Government <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000038/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000066/1000002" alt="may make rules">may make rules</a> for permitting at the request ofthe owner the denaturing or mutilation of imported goods which are ordinarilyused for more than one purpose so as to render them unfit for one or more ofsuch purposes; and where any goods are so denatured or mutilated they shall bechargeable to duty at such rate as would be applicable if the goods had beenimported in the denatured or mutilated form.   </span></p></span>



 Section 25

Data from Section 25:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">

  
    <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">
    <title>Section 110A</title>
  
  
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><strong style="box-sizing: border-box; font-weight: bolder;">Section
          25. Power to grant exemption from duty. -</strong></span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">(1) If the Central Government is
        satisfied that it is necessary in the public interest so to do, it may,
        by notification in the Official Gazette, exempt generally either
        absolutely or subject to such conditions (to be fulfilled before or
        after clearance) as may be specified in the notification goods of any
        specified description from the whole or any part of duty of customs
        leviable thereon.</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">1<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(2)
        If the Central Government is satisfied that it is necessary in the
        public interest so to do, it may, by special order in each case, exempt
        from the payment of duty, under circumstances of an exceptional nature
        to be stated in such order, any goods on which duty is leviable.</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">2<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(2A)
        The Central Government may, if it considers it necessary or expedient so
        to do for the purpose of clarifying the scope or applicability of any
        notification issued under sub-section (1) or order issued under
        sub-section (2), insert an explanation in such notification or order, as
        the case may be, by notification in the Official Gazette, at any time
        within one year of issue of the notification under sub-section (1) or
        order under sub-section (2), and every such explanation shall have
        effect as if it had always been the part of the first such notification
        or order, as the case may be.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">3<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(3)
        An exemption under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) in respect of any
        goods from any part of the duty of customs leviable thereon (the duty of
        customs leviable thereon being hereinafter referred to as the statutory
        duty) may be granted by providing for the levy of a duty on such goods
        at a rate expressed in a form or method different from the form or
        method in which the statutory duty is leviable and any exemption granted
        in relation to any goods in the manner provided in this sub-section
        shall have effect subject to the condition that the duty of customs
        chargeable on such goods shall in no case exceed the statutory duty.</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><strong style="box-sizing: border-box; font-weight: bolder;">Explanation.<span>&nbsp;</span></strong>-"Form
        or method", in relation to a rate of duty of customs, means the basis,
        namely, valuation, weight, number, length, area, volume or other measure
        with reference to which the duty is leviable.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">4<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(4)
        Every notification issued under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2A)
        shall, unless otherwise provided, come into force on the date of its
        issue by the Central Government for publication in the Official
        Gazette.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">5<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(4A)
        Where any exemption is granted subject to any condition under
        sub-section (1), such exemption shall, unless otherwise specified or
        varied or rescinded, be valid upto 31st day of March falling immediately
        after two years from the date of such grant or variation:</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">Provided that in respect of any such
        exemption in force as on the date on which the Finance Bill, 2021
        receives the assent of the President, the said period of two years shall
        be reckoned from the 1st day February, 2021.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">9</span></sup>[</span>Provided
      further that nothing contained in this sub-section shall apply to any such
      exemption granted to, or in relation to, </p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(a)
      any multilateral or bilateral trade agreement;</p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(b)
      obligations under international agreements, treaties, conventions or such
      other obligations including with respect to United Nations agencies,
      diplomats and international organisations;</p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(c)
      privileges of constitutional authorities;</p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(d)
      schemes under the Foreign Trade Policy;</p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(e)
      the Central Government schemes having validity of more than two years; </p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(f)
      re-imports, temporary imports, goods imported as gifts or personal
      baggage;</p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(g)
      any duty of customs under any law for the time being in force, including
      integrated tax leviable under sub-section (7) of section 3 of the Customs
      Tariff Act, 1975, other than duty of customs leviable under section 12.<span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"></span>]<br>
      </span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">6<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[***]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">7<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(6)
        Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, no duty shall be
        collected if the amount of duty leviable is equal to, or less than, one
        hundred rupees.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">8<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(7)
        The mineral oils (including petroleum and natural gas) extracted or
        produced in the continental shelf of India or exclusive economic zone of
        India as referred to in<span>&nbsp;</span><a target="_blank" href="http://undefined/content-page/explore-act/1000006/1000002" alt="section 6" style="box-sizing: border-box; text-decoration: none; color: rgb(62, 138, 204); cursor: pointer;">section
          6</a><span>&nbsp;</span>and<span>&nbsp;</span><a target="_blank" href="http://undefined/content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7" style="box-sizing: border-box; text-decoration: none; color: rgb(62, 138, 204); cursor: pointer;">section
          7</a>, respectively, of the Territorial Waters, Continental Shelf,
        Exclusive Economic Zone and Other Maritime Zones Act, 1976 (80 of 1976),
        and imported prior to the 7th day of February, 2002 shall be deemed to
        be and shall always be deemed to have been exempted from the whole of
        the duties of customs leviable on such mineral oils and accordingly,
        notwithstanding anything contained in any judgement, decree or order of
        any court, tribunal or other authority, no suit or other proceedings in
        respect of such mineral oils shall be maintained or continued in any
        court, tribunal or other authority.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">8<span>&nbsp;</span></sup></span><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">[(8) Notwithstanding the exemption
        provided under sub-section (7), no refund of duties of customs paid in
        respect of the mineral oils specified therein shall be made.]</span></p>
    <div class="footnotes" style="box-sizing: border-box; border-top: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2); font-weight: 400; padding-top: 15px; color: blue; font-size: 12px !important; font-family: Poppins; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">

          into force on the date of its issue by the Central Government for
          publication in the Official Gazette;</span></p>
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; padding-left: 40px;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">(b) also be published and offered for

          contained in sub-section (4), where a notification comes into force on

Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">

  
    <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">
    <title>Section 110A</title>
  
  
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><strong style="box-sizing: border-box; font-weight: bolder;">Section
          25. Power to grant exemption from duty. -</strong></span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">(1) If the Central Government is
        satisfied that it is necessary in the public interest so to do, it may,
        by notification in the Official Gazette, exempt generally either
        absolutely or subject to such conditions (to be fulfilled before or
        after clearance) as may be specified in the notification goods of any
        specified description from the whole or any part of duty of customs
        leviable thereon.</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">1<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(2)
        If the Central Government is satisfied that it is necessary in the
        public interest so to do, it may, by special order in each case, exempt
        from the payment of duty, under circumstances of an exceptional nature
        to be stated in such order, any goods on which duty is leviable.</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">2<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(2A)
        The Central Government may, if it considers it necessary or expedient so
        to do for the purpose of clarifying the scope or applicability of any
        notification issued under sub-section (1) or order issued under
        sub-section (2), insert an explanation in such notification or order, as
        the case may be, by notification in the Official Gazette, at any time
        within one year of issue of the notification under sub-section (1) or
        order under sub-section (2), and every such explanation shall have
        effect as if it had always been the part of the first such notification
        or order, as the case may be.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">3<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(3)
        An exemption under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) in respect of any
        goods from any part of the duty of customs leviable thereon (the duty of
        customs leviable thereon being hereinafter referred to as the statutory
        duty) may be granted by providing for the levy of a duty on such goods
        at a rate expressed in a form or method different from the form or
        method in which the statutory duty is leviable and any exemption granted
        in relation to any goods in the manner provided in this sub-section
        shall have effect subject to the condition that the duty of customs
        chargeable on such goods shall in no case exceed the statutory duty.</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><strong style="box-sizing: border-box; font-weight: bolder;">Explanation.<span>&nbsp;</span></strong>-"Form
        or method", in relation to a rate of duty of customs, means the basis,
        namely, valuation, weight, number, length, area, volume or other measure
        with reference to which the duty is leviable.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">4<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(4)
        Every notification issued under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2A)
        shall, unless otherwise provided, come into force on the date of its
        issue by the Central Government for publication in the Official
        Gazette.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">5<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(4A)
        Where any exemption is granted subject to any condition under
        sub-section (1), such exemption shall, unless otherwise specified or
        varied or rescinded, be valid upto 31st day of March falling immediately
        after two years from the date of such grant or variation:</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">Provided that in respect of any such
        exemption in force as on the date on which the Finance Bill, 2021
        receives the assent of the President, the said period of two years shall
        be reckoned from the 1st day February, 2021.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">9</span></sup>[</span>Provided
      further that nothing contained in this sub-section shall apply to any such
      exemption granted to, or in relation to, </p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(a)
      any multilateral or bilateral trade agreement;</p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(b)
      obligations under international agreements, treaties, conventions or such
      other obligations including with respect to United Nations agencies,
      diplomats and international organisations;</p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(c)
      privileges of constitutional authorities;</p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(d)
      schemes under the Foreign Trade Policy;</p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(e)
      the Central Government schemes having validity of more than two years; </p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(f)
      re-imports, temporary imports, goods imported as gifts or personal
      baggage;</p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">(g)
      any duty of customs under any law for the time being in force, including
      integrated tax leviable under sub-section (7) of section 3 of the Customs
      Tariff Act, 1975, other than duty of customs leviable under section 12.<span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"></span>]<br>
      </span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">6<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[***]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">7<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(6)
        Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, no duty shall be
        collected if the amount of duty leviable is equal to, or less than, one
        hundred rupees.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">8<span>&nbsp;</span></sup>[(7)
        The mineral oils (including petroleum and natural gas) extracted or
        produced in the continental shelf of India or exclusive economic zone of
        India as referred to in<span>&nbsp;</span><a target="_blank" href="http://undefined/content-page/explore-act/1000006/1000002" alt="section 6" style="box-sizing: border-box; text-decoration: none; color: rgb(62, 138, 204); cursor: pointer;">section
          6</a><span>&nbsp;</span>and<span>&nbsp;</span><a target="_blank" href="http://undefined/content-page/explore-act/1000007/1000002" alt="section 7" style="box-sizing: border-box; text-decoration: none; color: rgb(62, 138, 204); cursor: pointer;">section
          7</a>, respectively, of the Territorial Waters, Continental Shelf,
        Exclusive Economic Zone and Other Maritime Zones Act, 1976 (80 of 1976),
        and imported prior to the 7th day of February, 2002 shall be deemed to
        be and shall always be deemed to have been exempted from the whole of
        the duties of customs leviable on such mineral oils and accordingly,
        notwithstanding anything contained in any judgement, decree or order of
        any court, tribunal or other authority, no suit or other proceedings in
        respect of such mineral oils shall be maintained or continued in any
        court, tribunal or other authority.]</span></p>
    <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(33, 37, 41); font-family: Poppins; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;"><sup style="box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; font-size: 0.75em; line-height: 0; vertical-align: baseline; top: -0.5em;">8<span>&nbsp;</span></sup></span><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">[(8) Notwithstanding the exemption
        provided under sub-section (7), no refund of duties of customs paid in
        respect of the mineral oils specified therein shall be made.]</span></p>
    <div class="footnotes" style="box-sizing: border-box; border-top: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2); font-weight: 400; padding-top: 15px; color: blue; font-size: 12px !important; font-family: Poppins; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;">
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">1. Substituted by Act 32 of 2003,
          section 107(a), for sub-section(2)(w.e.f. 14-5-2003). Earlier
          sub-section(2) was substituted by Act 27 of 1999, section 102(w.e.f.
          11.5.1999)</span></p>
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">2. Inserted by Act 20 of 2002, section
          119(a) (w.e.f. 11-5-2002)</span></p>
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">3. Inserted by Act 11 of 1983, section
          49(w.e.f. 13-5-1983)</span></p>
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">4. Substituted by Finance Act, 2016
          (w.e.f. 14-5-2016), section 119(i), for-sub-section (4). Earlier
          sub-section (4) was inserted by Act 21 of 1988, section 99(w.e.f.
          1-8-1988) and was amended by Act 20 of 2002, section 119 (b) (w.e.f.
          11-5-2002). Sub-section (4), before substitution by the Finance Act,
          2016, stood as under:</span></p>
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; padding-left: 40px;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">"(4) Every notification issued under
          sub-section (1) or sub-section (2A) shall,-</span></p>
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; padding-left: 40px;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">(a) unless otherwise provided, come
          into force on the date of its issue by the Central Government for
          publication in the Official Gazette;</span></p>
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; padding-left: 40px;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">(b) also be published and offered for
          sale on the date of its issue by the Directorate of Publicity and
          Public Relations of the Board, New Delhi."</span></p>
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">5. Inserted (w.e.f. 28-03-2021) s. 91
          of Finance Act 2021 (13 of 2021)</span></p>
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">6. Sub-section(5) omitted by the
          Finance Act, 2016, section 119(ii). Sub-section(5), before omission
          stood as under:(w.e.f. 14-05-2016)</span></p>
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">"(5) Notwithstanding anything
          contained in sub-section (4), where a notification comes into force on
          a date later than the date of its issue, the same shall be published
          and offered for sale by the said Directorate of Publicity and Public
          relations on a date on or before the date on which the said
          notification comes into force."</span></p>
      <p style="box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem;"><span style="box-sizing: border-box;">7. Inserted by Act 32 of 2003, section

          by Act 08 of 2023, section 128(w.e.f. to be notified).</span></p>

</span>



 Section 25A

Data from Section 25A:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <span>
    <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [
    <b>
     Section 25A. Inward processing of goods.
    </b>
    -
   </span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </p>
  <p>
   <span>
    Where the
        Central Government is satisfied that it is necessary in the public interest so
        to do, it may, by notification, exempt such of the goods which are imported for
        the purposes of repair, further processing or manufacture, as may be specified
        therein, from the whole or any part of duty of customs leviable thereon,
        subject to the following conditions, namely:
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (a) the goods shall be
        re-exported after such repair, further processing or manufacture, as the case
        may be, within a period of one year from the date on which the order for
        clearance of the imported goods is made;
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (b) the imported goods are
        identifiable in the export goods; and
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (c) such other conditions
        as may be specified in that notification.
   </span>
  </p>
  <div class="footnotes">
   <p>
    <span>
     1. Inserted by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), section 62
            (w.e.f. 29.03.2018).
    </span>
   </p>
  </div>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <span>
    <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [
    <b>
     Section 25A. Inward processing of goods.
    </b>
    -
   </span>
   <span>
   </span>
  </p>
  <p>
   <span>
    Where the
        Central Government is satisfied that it is necessary in the public interest so
        to do, it may, by notification, exempt such of the goods which are imported for
        the purposes of repair, further processing or manufacture, as may be specified
        therein, from the whole or any part of duty of customs leviable thereon,
        subject to the following conditions, namely:
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (a) the goods shall be
        re-exported after such repair, further processing or manufacture, as the case
        may be, within a period of one year from the date on which the order for
        clearance of the imported goods is made;
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (b) the imported goods are
        identifiable in the export goods; and
   </span>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (c) such other conditions
        as may be specified in that notification.
   </span>
  </p>
  <div class="footnotes">
   <p>
    <span>
     1. Inserted by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), section 62
            (w.e.f. 29.03.2018).
    </span>
   </p>
  </div>
 
</span>



 Section 25B

Data from Section 25B:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><sup>    1   </sup><strong>   </strong><strong>    <span>     [Section            25B. Outward processing of goods. -    </span></strong></p><p><strong>    <span>    </span></strong><span>    Notwithstanding anything contained in        <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000041/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000034/1000002" alt="section 20">section 20</a>, where the Central Government is satisfied that it is necessary in        the public interest so to do, it may, by notification, exempt such of the goods        which are re-imported after being exported for the purposes of repair, further        processing or manufacture, as may be specified therein, from the whole or any        part of duty of customs leviable thereon, subject to the following conditions,        namely:   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (a)   </span><span>    the goods shall be        re-imported into India after such repair, further processing or manufacture, as        the case may be, within a period of one year from the date on which the order        permitting clearance for export is made;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (b)   </span><span>    the exported goods are        identifiable in the re-imported goods; and   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (c)   </span><span>    such other conditions        as may be specified in that notification.]   </span></p><div class="footnotes"><p><span>     1. Inserted by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), section 62 (w.e.f. 29.03.2018).    </span><br>   </p></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><sup>    1   </sup><strong>   </strong><strong>    <span>     [Section            25B.  Section 26A

Data from Section 26A:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <sup>     1</sup>[   </span><strong>    Section 26A.  Refund of import duty in certain cases. -   </strong></p><p><span>&nbsp; (1) Where on the importation of        any goods capable of being easily identified as        such imported goods, any duty has been paid on clearance of such goods for home        consumption, such duty shall be refunded to the person by whom or on whose&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; behalf it was paid, if -</span></p><p style="margin-left: 25px;">(a) the goods are found to be defective or otherwise not in conformity with the specifications agreed upon between the importer and the supplier of goods:</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;"><strong>Provided   </strong>   that the goods have not been worked, repaired or used after importation except where such use was indispensable to discover the defects or non-conformity with the specifications;</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;">(b) the goods are identified to the satisfaction of the Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs as the goods which were imported;</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;">(c) the importer does not claim drawback under any other provisions of this Act; and</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;">(d) (i)   the goods are exported; or</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;">(ii)  the importer relinquishes his title to the goods and abandons them to customs; or</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;">(iii) such goods are destroyed or rendered commercially valueless in the presence of the proper officer, in such manner as may be prescribed and within a period not exceeding thirty days from the date on which the proper officer makes&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;an order for the clearance of imported goods for home consumption under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000043/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000087/1000002" alt="section 47">section 47</a>:</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;"><strong>Provided   </strong>   that the period of thirty days may, on sufficient cause being shown, be extended by the   <sup>    2</sup>[Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs] for a period not exceeding three months:</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;"><strong>Provided   </strong>   further that nothing contained in this section shall apply to the goods regarding which an offence appears to have been committed under this Act or any other law for the time being in force.</p><p><span>(2) An        application for refund of duty shall be made before the expiry of six months        from the relevant date in such form and in such manner as may be        prescribed.   </span></p><p style="margin-left: 25px;"><strong style=""><span>Explanation    </span></strong><span>    .- For the purposes of        this sub-section, "relevant date" means,-</span></p><p style="margin-left: 25px;">(a) in cases where the        goods are exported out of India, the date on which the proper officer makes an        order permitting clearance and loading of goods for exportation under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000043/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000091/1000002" alt="section 51">section 51</a>;</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;">(b) in cases where the        title to the goods is relinquished, the date of such relinquishment;</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;">(c) in cases where the        goods are destroyed or rendered commercially valueless, the date of such        destruction or rendering of goods commercially valueless.</p><p><span><span>(3) No refund under sub-section (1) shall be allowed in respect of perishable goods and goods which have exceeded their shelf life or their recommended storage-before-use period.</span><br></span></p><p><span>(4) The Board may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify any other        condition subject to which the refund under sub-section (1) may be allowed.]   </span></p><div class="footnotes"><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 3.75pt; line-height: 11.25pt; text-align: justify;">    1. Inserted by Finance (No.2) Act, 2009 (33 of 2009),        section 85(w.e.f. 19-8-2009).   </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 3.75pt; line-height: 11.25pt; text-align: justify;"><br>    2. Substituted by Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014),        section 78, for "Commissioner of Customs"(w.e.f. 6-8-2014).   </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 3.75pt; line-height: 11.25pt; text-align: justify;"><span style="font-family:">     <br>    </span></p></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <sup>     1</sup>[   </span><strong>    Section 26A.  Refund of import duty in certain cases. -   </strong></p><p><span>&nbsp; (1) Where on the importation of        any goods capable of being easily identified as        such imported goods, any duty has been paid on clearance of such goods for home        consumption, such duty shall be refunded to the person by whom or on whose&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; behalf it was paid, if -</span></p><p style="margin-left: 25px;">(a) the goods are found to be defective or otherwise not in conformity with the specifications agreed upon between the importer and the supplier of goods:</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;"><strong>Provided   </strong>   that the goods have not been worked, repaired or used after importation except where such use was indispensable to discover the defects or non-conformity with the specifications;</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;">(b) the goods are identified to the satisfaction of the Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of makes an        order permitting clearance and loading of goods for exportation under <a target="_blank" condition subject to which the refund under sub-section (1) may be allowed.]   </span></p><div class="footnotes"><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 3.75pt; line-height: 11.25pt; text-align: justify;">    1. Inserted by Finance (No.2) Act, 2009 (33 of 2009),        section 85(w.e.f. 19-8-2009).   </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 3.75pt; line-height: 11.25pt; text-align: justify;"><br>    2. Substituted by Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014),        section 78, for "Commissioner of Customs"(w.e.f. 6-8-2014).   </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 3.75pt; line-height: 11.25pt; text-align: justify;"><span style="font-family:">     <br>    </span></p></div></span>



 Section 27

Data from Section 27:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p style="font-weight: 400;"><sup>    1   </sup>   [   <strong>    Section 27. Claim for refund of duty.   </strong>   -  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;"><sup>    2   </sup>   [(1) Any person claiming refund of any duty or interest,-  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) paid by him; or  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) borne by him,  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;">   may make an application in such form and manner <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000044/../../../content-page/explore-forms/1000013" alt="as may be prescribed">as may be prescribed</a> for such refund to the Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs, before the expiry of one year, from the date of payment of such duty or interest:  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>    Provided   </strong>   that where an application for refund has been made before the date on which the Finance Bill, 2011 receives the assent of the President, such application shall be deemed to have been made under sub-section (1), as it stood before the date on which the Finance Bill, 2011 receives the assent of the President and the same shall be dealt with in accordance with the provisions of sub-section (2):  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>    Provided   </strong>   further that the limitation of one year shall not apply where any duty or interest has been paid under protest.  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;"><sup>    3   </sup>   [   <strong>    Provided   </strong>   also that where the amount of refund claimed is less than rupees one hundred, the same shall not be refunded.]  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>    Explanation.   </strong>   - For the purposes of this sub-section,"the date of payment of duty or interest" in relation to a person, other than the importer, shall be construed as"the date of purchase of goods" by such person.   <br>   <br>   (1A) The application under sub-section (1) shall be accompanied by such documentary or other evidence (including the documents referred to in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000044/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000053/1000002" alt="section 28C">section 28C</a>) as the applicant may furnish to establish that the amount of duty or interest, in relation to which such refund is claimed was collected from, or paid by him and the incidence of such duty or interest, has not been passed on by him to any other person.  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;">   (1B) Save as otherwise provided in this section, the period of limitation of one year shall be computed in the following manner, namely-  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) in the case of goods which are exempt from payment of duty by a special order issued under sub-section (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000044/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000039/1000002" alt="section 25">section 25</a>, the limitation of one year shall be computed from the date of issue of such order;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) where the duty becomes refundable as a consequence of any judgment, decree, order or direction of the appellate authority, Appellate Tribunal or any court, the limitation of one year shall be computed from the date of such judgment, decree, order or direction;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c) where any duty is paid provisionally under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000044/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000032/1000002" alt="section 18">section 18</a>, the limitation of one year shall be computed from the date of adjustment of duty after the final assessment thereof or in case of re-assessment, from the date of such re-assessment.]  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;">   (2) If, on receipt of any such application, the   <sup>    4   </sup>   [Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs] is satisfied that the whole or any part of the   <sup>    5   </sup>   [duty and interest, if any, paid on such duty] paid by the applicant is refundable, he may make an order accordingly and the amount so determined shall be credited to the Fund:  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>    Provided   </strong>   that the amount of   <sup>    5   </sup>   [(duty and interest, if any, paid on such duty] as determined by the   <sup>    4   </sup>   [Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs] under the foregoing provisions of this sub-section shall, instead of being credited to the Fund, be paid to the applicant, if such amount is relatable to -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) the   <sup>    5   </sup>   [duty and interest, if any, paid on such duty paid] by the importer,   <sup>    6   </sup>   [or the exporter, as the case may be] if he had not passed on the incidence of such   <sup>    7   </sup>   [duty and interest, if any, paid on such duty] to any other person;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) the   <sup>    5   </sup>   [duty and interest, if any, paid on such duty] on imports made by an individual for his personal use;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c) the   <sup>    5   </sup>   [duty and interest, if any, paid on such duty] borne by the buyer, if he had not passed on the incidence of such   <sup>    5   </sup>   [duty and interest, if any, paid on such duty] to any other person;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (d) the export duty as specified in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000044/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000042/1000002" alt="section 26">section 26</a>;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (e) drawback of duty payable under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000044/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000120/1000002" alt="sections 74">sections 74</a> and <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000044/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000121/1000002" alt="75">75</a>;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (f) the   <sup>    5   </sup>   [duty and interest, if any, paid on such duty] borne by any other such class of applicants as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify:  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>    8   </sup>   [(g) the duty paid in excess by the importer before an order permitting clearance of goods for home consumption is made where-  </p><p style="padding-left: 80px;">   (i) such excess payment of duty is evident from the bill of entry in the case of self-assessed bill of entry; or  </p><p style="padding-left: 80px;">   (ii) the duty actually payable is reflected in the reassessed bill of entry in the case of reassessment.]  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;"><br>   <strong>    Provided   </strong>   further that no notification under clause (f) of the first proviso shall be issued unless in the opinion of the Central Government the incidence of   <sup>    5   </sup>   [duty and interest, if any, paid on such duty] has not been passed on by the persons concerned to any other person.  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;">   (3)  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any judgment, decree, order or direction of the Appellate Tribunal,   <sup>    9   </sup>   [National Tax Tribunal] or any Court or in any other provision of this Act or the regulations made thereunder or any other law for the time being in force, no refund shall be made except as provided in sub-section (2).  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;">   (4) Every notification under clause (f) of the first proviso to sub-section (2) shall be laid before each House of Parliament, if it is sitting, as soon as may be after the issue of the notification, and, if it is not sitting, within seven days of its re-assembly, and the Central Government shall seek the approval of Parliament to the notification by a resolution moved within a period of fifteen days beginning with the day on which the notification is so laid before the House of the People and if Parliament makes any modification in the notification or directs that the notification should cease to have effect, the notification shall thereafter have effect only in such modified form or be of no effect, as the case may be, but without prejudice to the validity of anything previously done thereunder.  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;">   5) For the removal of doubts, it is hereby declared that any notification issued under clause (f) of the first proviso to sub-section (2), including any such notification approved or modified under sub-section (4), may be rescinded by the Central Government at any time by notification in the Official Gazette.  </p><p><br></p><div class="footnotes">   1.  Section 27A

Data from Section 27A:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><sup>    1   </sup>   [   <strong>    Section 27A. Interest on delayed refunds. -   </strong></p><p>   If any duty ordered to be refunded under sub-section (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000045/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000044/1000002" alt="section 27">section 27</a> to an applicant is not refunded within three months from the date of receipt of application under sub-section (1) of that section, there shall be paid to that applicant interest at such rate,   <sup>    2   </sup>   [ not below five percent.] and not exceeding thirty percent per annum as is for the time being fixed   <sup>    3   </sup>   [by the Central Government by Notification in the Official Gazette], on such duty from the date immediately after the expiry of three months from the date of receipt of such application till the date of refund of such duty:  </p><p><strong>    Provided   </strong>   that where any duty, ordered to be refunded under sub-section (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000045/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000044/1000002" alt="section 27">section 27</a> in respect of an application under sub-section (1) of that section made before the date on which the Finance Bill, 1995 receives the assent of the President, is not refunded within three months from such date, there shall be paid to the applicant interest under this section from the date immediately after three months from such date, till the date of refund of such duty.  </p><p><strong>    Explanation   </strong><em>    .   </em>   - Where any order of refund is made by the Commissioner (Appeals), Appellate Tribunal,   <sup>    4   </sup>   [National Tax Tribunal] or any court against an order of the   <sup>    5   </sup>   [Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs] under sub-section (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000045/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000044/1000002" alt="section 27">section 27</a>, the order passed by the Commissioner (Appeals), Appellate Tribunal,   <sup>    4   </sup>   [National Tax Tribunal]  or as the case may be, by the court shall be deemed to be an order passed under that sub-section for the purposes of this section.   <br>   <br>  </p><div class="footnotes"><p>    1. Inserted by theFinance Act, 1995 (22 of 1995), section 55 (w.e.f. 26-5-1995)   </p><p>    2. Substituted by Finance Act, 2001 (14 of 2001), section 102, for "not below ten percent" (w.e.f. 11-5-2001)   </p><p>    3. Substituted by Finance Act, 2000 (Act 10 of 2000), section 78, for "by the Board" (w.e.f. 12-5-2000)   </p><p>    4. To be inserted (from a date to be notified) by s. 30 read with Schedule to the National Tax Tribunal Act, 2005 (49 of 2005).   </p><p>    5. Substituted by Finance Act, 1999 (27 of 1999), section 100, for "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" (w.e.f. 11-5-1999). Earlier the words "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" were substituted by Act 22 of 1995, section 50, for the words "Assistant Collector of Customs (w.e.f. 26-5-1995)   </p></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><sup>    1   </sup>   [   <strong>    Section 27A.
