 Section 28D

Data from Section 28D:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <b>
    Section 28D. Presumption that incidence of duty has been passed on to the buyer.
           
           -
   </b>
  </p>
  <p>
   Every person who has paid the duty on any goods under this Act shall, unless the contrary is proved by him, be deemed to have passed on the full incidence of such duty to the buyer of such goods.
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>

  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
 
</span>

 Section 28DA

Data from Section 28DA:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 28DA. Procedure regarding claim of preferential rate of duty. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) An importer making claim for preferential rate of duty, in terms of any trade agreement, shall -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (i) make a declaration that goods qualify as originating goods for preferential rate of duty under such agreement;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (ii) possess sufficient information as regards the manner in which country of origin criteria, including the regional value content and product specific criteria, specified in the rules of origin in the trade agreement, are satisfied;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (iii) furnish such information in such manner <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000055/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000816/1000002" alt="as may be provided by rules">as may be provided by rules</a>;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (iv) exercise reasonable care as to the accuracy and truthfulness of the information furnished.  </p><p>   (2) The fact that the importer has submitted a certificate of origin issued by an Issuing Authority shall not absolve the importer of the responsibility to exercise reasonable care.  </p><p>   (3) Where the proper officer has reasons to believe that country of origin criteria has not been met, he may require the importer to furnish further information, consistent with the trade agreement, in such manner<a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000055/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000816/1000002" alt=" as may be provided by rules"> as may be provided by rules</a>.  </p><p>   (4) Where importer fails to provide the requisite information for any reason, the proper officer may,-  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (i) cause further verification consistent with the trade agreement in such manner <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000055/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000816/1000002" alt="as may be provided by rules">as may be provided by rules</a>;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (ii) pending verification, temporarily suspend the preferential tariff treatment to such goods:  </p><p>   Provided that on the basis of the information furnished by the importer or the information available with him or on the relinquishment of the claim for preferential rate of duty by the importer, the Principal Commissioner of Customs or the Commissioner of Customs may, for reasons to be recorded in writing, disallow the claim for preferential rate of duty, without further verification.  </p><p>   (5) Where the preferential rate of duty is suspended under sub-section (4), the proper officer may, on the request of the importer, release the goods subject to furnishing by the importer a security amount equal to the difference between the duty provisionally assessed under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000055/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000032/1000002" alt="section 18">section 18</a> and the preferential duty claimed:  </p><p>   Provided                     that the Principal Commissioner of Customs or the Commissioner of Customs may, instead of security, require the importer to deposit the differential duty amount in the ledger maintained under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000055/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000092/1000002" alt="section 51A">section 51A</a>.  </p><p>   (6) Upon temporary suspension of preferential tariff treatment, the proper officer shall inform the Issuing Authority of reasons for suspension of preferential tariff treatment, and seek specific information as may be necessary to determine the origin of goods within such time and in such manner <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000055/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000816/1000002" alt="as may be provided by rules">as may be provided by rules</a>.  </p><p>   (7) Where, subsequently, the Issuing Authority or exporter or producer, as the case may be, furnishes the specific information within the specified time, the proper officer may, on being satisfied with the information furnished, restore the preferential tariff treatment.  </p><p>   (8) Where the Issuing Authority or exporter or producer, as the case may be, does not furnish information within the specified time or the information furnished by him is not found satisfactory, the proper officer shall disallow the preferential tariff treatment for reasons to be recorded in writing:  </p><p>   <strong>Provided</strong>                      that in case of receipt of incomplete or non-specific information, the proper officer may send another request to the Issuing Authority stating specifically the shortcoming in the information furnished by such authority, in such circumstances and in such manner <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000055/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000816/1000002" alt="as may be provided by rules">as may be provided by rules</a>.  </p><p>   (9) Unless otherwise specified in the trade agreement, any request for verification shall be sent within a period of five years from the date of claim of preferential rate of duty by an importer.  </p><p>   (10) Notwithstanding anything contained in this section, the preferential tariff treatment may be refused without verification in the following circumstances, namely:-  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (i)	the tariff item is not eligible for preferential tariff treatment;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (ii)	complete description of goods is not contained in the certificate of origin;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (iii)	any alteration in the certificate of origin is not authenticated by the Issuing Authority;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (iv)	the certificate of origin is produced after the period of its expiry, and in all such cases, the certificate of origin shall be marked as "INAPPLICABLE".  </p><p>   (11) Where the verification under this section establishes non-compliance of the imported goods with the country of origin criteria, the proper officer may reject the preferential tariff treatment to the imports of identical goods from the same producer or exporter, unless sufficient information is furnished to show that identical goods meet the country of origin criteria.  </p><p>   Explanation-For the purposes of this Chapter,-  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)"certificate of origin" means a certificate issued in accordance with a trade agreement certifying that the goods fulfil the country of origin criteria and other requirements specified in the said agreement;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)"identical goods" means goods that are same in all respects with reference to the country of origin criteria under the trade agreement;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)"Issuing Authority" means any authority designated for the purposes of issuing certificate of origin under a trade agreement;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (d)"trade agreement" means an agreement for trade in goods between the Government of India and the Government of a foreign country or territory or economic union.  </p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 28DA. Procedure regarding claim of preferential rate of duty. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) An importer making claim for preferential rate of duty, in terms of any trade agreement, shall -  </p><p sufficient information as regards the manner in which country of origin criteria, including the regional value content and product specific criteria, specified in the rules of origin in the trade agreement, are satisfied;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (iii) furnish such information in such manner <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000055/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000816/1000002" alt="as may be provided by rules">as may be provided by rules</a>;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (iv) exercise reasonable care as to the accuracy and truthfulness of the information furnished.  </p><p>   (2) The fact that the importer has submitted a certificate of origin issued by an Issuing Authority shall not absolve the importer of the responsibility to exercise reasonable care.  </p><p>   (3) Where the proper officer has reasons to believe that country of origin criteria has not been met, he may require the importer to furnish further information, consistent with the trade agreement, in such manner<a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000055/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000816/1000002" alt=" as may be provided by rules"> as may be provided by rules</a>.  </p><p>   (4) Where importer fails to provide the requisite information for any reason, the proper officer may,-  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (i) cause further verification consistent with the trade alt="section 18">section 18</a> and the preferential duty claimed:  </p><p>   Provided                     that the Principal Commissioner of Customs or the Commissioner of Customs may, instead of preferential tariff treatment, the proper officer shall inform the Issuing Authority of reasons for suspension of preferential tariff treatment, and seek specific information as may be necessary to determine the origin of goods within such time and in such manner <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000055/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000816/1000002" alt="as may be provided by rules">as may be provided by rules</a>.  </p><p>   (7) Where, subsequently, the Issuing Authority or exporter or producer, as the case may be, furnishes the specific information within the specified time, the proper officer may, on being satisfied with the information furnished, restore the preferential tariff treatment.  </p><p>   (8) Where the Issuing Authority or exporter or producer, as the case may be, does not furnish information within the specified time or the information furnished by him is not found satisfactory, the proper officer shall disallow the preferential tariff treatment for reasons to be recorded in writing:  </p><p>   <strong>Provided</strong>                      that in case of receipt of incomplete or non-specific information, the proper officer may send another request to the Issuing Authority stating specifically the shortcoming in the information furnished by such authority, in such circumstances and in such manner <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000055/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000816/1000002" alt="as may be provided by rules">as may be provided by rules</a>.  </p><p>   (9) Unless otherwise specified in the trade agreement, any request for verification shall be sent within a period of five years from the date of claim of preferential rate of duty by an importer.  </p><p>   (10) Notwithstanding anything contained in this section, the preferential tariff treatment may be refused without verification in the following circumstances, namely:-  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (i)	the tariff item is not eligible for preferential tariff treatment;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (ii)	complete description of goods is not contained in the (iv)	the certificate of origin is produced after the period of its expiry, and in all such cases, the certificate of origin shall be marked as "INAPPLICABLE".  </p><p>   (11) Where the verification under this section establishes non-compliance of the imported goods with the country of origin criteria, the proper officer may reject the preferential tariff treatment to the imports of identical goods from the same producer or exporter, unless sufficient information is furnished to show that identical goods meet the country of origin criteria.  </p><p>   Explanation-For the purposes of this criteria and other requirements specified in the said agreement;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)"identical goods" means goods that are same in all respects with reference to the country of origin criteria under the trade agreement;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)"Issuing Authority" means any authority designated for the purposes of issuing certificate of origin under a trade agreement;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (d)"trade agreement" means an agreement for trade in goods between the Government of India and the Government of a foreign country or territory or economic union.  </p></span>

 Section 28E

Data from Section 28E:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>    Section 28E. Definitions. -    <br>   </strong><br>   In this Chapter, unless the context otherwise requires, -   <br>   <br>   <sup>    1   </sup>   [***]  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;"><sup>    2   </sup>   [(b) "advance ruling" means a written decision on any of the questions referred to in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000056/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000060/1000002" alt="section 28H">section 28H</a> raised by the applicant in his application in respect of any goods prior to its importation or exportation;]  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;"><sup>    3   </sup>   [(ba) [***]  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;"><sup>    4   </sup>   [(c) "applicant" means any person,-  </p><p style="font-weight: 400; padding-left: 40px;">   (i) holding a valid Importer-exporter Code Number granted under section 7 of the Foreign Trade (Development and Regulation) Act, 1992; or  </p><p style="font-weight: 400; padding-left: 40px;">   (ii) exporting any goods to India; or  </p><p style="font-weight: 400; padding-left: 40px;">   (iii) with a justifiable cause to the satisfaction of the Authority,  </p><p style="font-weight: 400; padding-left: 40px;">   who makes an application for advance ruling under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000056/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000060/1000002" alt="section 28H">section 28H</a>; ]  </p><p style="font-weight: 400; padding-left: 40px;"><sup>5</sup>[***]</p><p style="font-weight: 400;">   (d)"application" means an application made to the Authority under sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000056/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000060/1000002" alt="section 28H">section 28H</a>;   <br>   <br><sup><font size="1">6</font></sup>[(e) "Authority" means the Customs Authority for Advance Rulings appointed under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000056/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000057/1000002" alt="section 28EA">section 28EA</a>;]  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;">   (f) <sup><font size="1">7</font></sup>[***];   <br>   <br>   (g) <sup>7</sup>[***]  </p><p style="font-weight: 400;">(h) <sup>8</sup>[***]  <br></p><div class="footnotes"><p>    1. Omitted by section 64 of the Finance Act, 2018( 13 of 2018). Before omission clause (a) of section 28E stood as under:   </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">    (a) "activity" means import or export and includes any new business of import or export proposed to be undertaken by the existing importer or exporter, as the case may be; as substituted by section 68 of    <br>    Act 17 of 2013, for clause (a) (w.e.f. 10-5-2013). Clause (a), before substitution, stood as under:    <br>    '(a) "activity" means import or export:'   </p><p>    2. Substituted by Finance Act, 2018( 13 of 2018), section 64 (w.e.f. 29.03.2018). Clause (b), before substitution by Act 13 of 2018, stood as under:   </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">    (b) "advance ruling" means the determination, by the Authority, of a question of law or fact specified in the application regarding the liability to pay duty in relation to an activity which is proposed to be undertaken, by the applicant;"   </p><p>    3. Omitted (w.e.f. 4-4-2021) s. 5 (a) of The Tribunals Reforms (Rationalization and Conditions of Service) Ordinance, 2021 (2 of 2021)   </p><p>    4. Substituted by Finance Act, 2018( 13 of 2018), section 64 (w.e.f. 29.03.2018). Earlier clause (c) as substituted by section 65(a) of Act 18 of 2005, (w.e.f. 13-5.2005) stood as under:   </p>   (c) "applicant" means -      (i)   (a)  a non-resident setting up a joint venture in India in collaboration with a non-resident or resident; or   <br>   (b)  a resident setting up a joint venture in India in collaboration with a non-resident; or   <br>   (c)  a wholly owned subsidiary Indian company, of which the holding company is a foreign company,   <br>   who or which, as the case may be, proposes to undertake any business activity in India;   <br>   (ii)   a joint venture in India; or   <br>   (iii)  a resident falling within any such class or category of persons, as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify in this behalf,   <br>   and which or who, as the case may be, makes application for advance ruling under sub-section (1) of section 28H;   <br>   Explanation. - For the purposes of this clause,"joint venture in India" means a contractual arrangement whereby two or more persons undertake an economic activity which is subject to joint control and one or more of the participants or partners or equity holders is a non-resident having substantial interest in such arrangement.'   <br>   Prior to this, clause (c) was substituted by Act 32 of 2003, section 110(a) (w.e.f. 14-5-2003).  Clause (c), before substitution by Act 18 of 2005, stood as under:   <br>   '(c) "applicant" means-   <br>   (i) a non-resident setting up a joint venture in India in collaboration with a non-resident or a resident; or   <br>   (ii) a resident setting up a joint venture in India in collaboration with a non-resident; or   <br>   (iii) a wholly owned subsidiary Indian company, of which the holding company is a foreign company ,   <br>   who proposes to undertake any business activity in India and makes application for advance ruling under sub-section (1) of section 28H:'   <p><br></p><p>5. Omitted by s. 90 of Finance Act 2022 (6 of 2022).</p><p>6. Substituted by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), section 64( w.e.f. 29.03.2018). Earlier clause (e) stood as under:   </p><p>    (e) "Authority" means the Authority for Advance Rulings constituted under section 245-O of the Income-tax Act, 1961   </p>   as substituted by section 93 of the Finance Act, 2017,  for clause (e).  Earlier clause   <br>   (e) was amended by Act 18 of 2005, sec. 65(b) (w.e.f. 13-5-2005).  Section 28EA

Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    1[Section 28EA. Customs Authority for Advance Rulings. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) The Board may, for the purposes of giving advance rulings under this Act, by notification, appoint an officer of the rank of Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs to function as a Customs Authority for Advance Rulings:  </p><p>   2[* * * *]  </p><p>   (2) The offices of the Authority may be established in New Delhi and at such other places, as the Board may deem fit.  </p><p>   (3) Subject to the provisions of this Act, the Authority shall exercise the powers and authority conferred on it by or under this Act.]  </p><div class="footnotes">   1. Inserted (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) by s. 65 of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018).   <br>   <br>   2. Omitted vide S. 5, The Tribunals Reforms (Rationalisation And Conditions of Service) Ordinance, 2021 dated 04-04-2021 before it was read as"Provided that till the date of appointment of the Customs Authority for Advance Rulings, the existing Authority for Advance Rulings constituted under section 245-O of the Income-tax Act, 1961 (43 of 1961) shall continue to be the Authority for giving advance rulings for the purposes of this Act."  </div></span>

 Section 28H

Data from Section 28H:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>   Section 28H. Application for advance ruling. -</strong></p><p>(1) An applicant desirous of obtaining an advance ruling under this Chapter may make an application in such form and in such manner <sup>1</sup>[and accompanied by such fee]&nbsp;<a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000060/../../../content-page/explore-regulations/1000152" alt="as may be prescribed">as may be prescribed</a>, stating the question on which the advance ruling is sought.<br></p><p>   (2)  The question on which the advance ruling is sought shall be in respect of, -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)  classification of goods under the Customs Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975);  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)  applicability of a notification issued under sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000060/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000039/1000002" alt="section 25">section 25</a>, having a bearing on the rate of duty;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)  the principles to be adopted for the purposes of determination of value of the goods under the provisions of this Act.  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>2</sup>[(d) applicability of notifications issued in respect of tax or duties under this Act or the Customs Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975) or any tax or duty chargeable under any other law for the time being in force in the same manner as duty of customs leviable under this Act or the Customs Tariff Act;]  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>3</sup>[(e)  determination of origin of the goods in terms of the rules notified under the Customs Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975) and matters relating thereto.]  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>4</sup>[(f) any other matter as the Central Government may, by notification, specify.]  </p><p>(3) <sup>5</sup>[***].</p><p>(4) An applicant may withdraw his application [at any time before an advance ruling is pronounced]<br></p><p><sup>6</sup>[(5) The applicant may be represented by any person resident in India who is authorised in this behalf.</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;"><strong>Explanation</strong>.-For the purposes of this sub-section "resident" shall have the same meaning as assigned to it in clause (42) of section 2 of the Income-tax Act, 1961.]</p><p><br></p><div class="footnotes"><span style="color: blue; font-size: 12px;">1. Inserted by s. 91 of Finance Act 2022 (6 of 2022).</span><br><br>2. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), section 67( w.e.f. 29.03.2018) for clause (d). Earlier to substitution clause (d) stood as under as inserted (w.e.f. 14-5-2003) by section 111 of Act 32 of 2003:   <br>   '(d) applicability of notifications issued in respect of duties under this Act, the Customs Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975) and any duty chargeable under any other law for the time being in force in the same manner as duty of customs leviable under this Act.'   <br>   <br>3. Inserted (w.e.f. 13-5-2005) by section 67 of the Finance Act, 2005 (18 of 2005).   <br>   <br>4. Inserted by the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), section 67( w.e.f. 29.03.2018).   <br><br>5. Omitted by <span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); font-family: ">s. 91 of Finance Act 2022 (6 of 2022).</span><br><br>6. Inserted by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), section 67( w.e.f. 29.03.2018).  </div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>   Section 28H. Application for advance ruling. -</strong></p><p>(1) An applicant desirous of obtaining an advance ruling under this Chapter may make an application in such form and in such manner <sup>1</sup>[and accompanied by such fee]&nbsp;<a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000060/../../../content-page/explore-regulations/1000152" alt="as may be prescribed">as may be prescribed</a>, stating the question on which the advance ruling is sought.<br></p><p>   (2)  The question on which the advance ruling is sought shall be in respect of, -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)  classification of goods under the Customs Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975);  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)  applicability of a notification issued under sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000060/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000039/1000002" alt="section 25">section 25</a>, having a bearing on the rate of duty;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)  the principles to be adopted for the purposes of determination of value of the goods under the provisions of this Act.  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>2</sup>[(d) applicability of notifications issued in respect of tax or duties under this Act or the Customs Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975) or any tax or duty chargeable under any other law for the time being in force in the same manner as duty of customs leviable under this Act or the Customs Tariff Act;]  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>3</sup>[(e)  determination of origin of the goods in terms of the rules notified under the Customs Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975) and matters relating thereto.]  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>4</sup>[(f) any other matter as the Central Government may, by notification, specify.]  </p><p>(3) <sup>5</sup>[***].</p><p>(4) An applicant may withdraw his application [at any time before an advance ruling is pronounced]<br></p><p><sup>6</sup>[(5) The applicant may be represented by any person resident in India who is authorised in this behalf.</p><p style="margin-left: 25px;"><strong>Explanation</strong>.-For the purposes of this sub-section "resident" shall have the same meaning as assigned to it in clause (42) of section 2 of the Income-tax Act, 1961.]</p><p><br></p><div class="footnotes"><span style="color: blue; font-size: 12px;">1. Inserted by s. 91 of Finance Act 2022 (6 of 2022).</span><br><br>2. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), section 67( w.e.f. 29.03.2018) for clause (d). Earlier to substitution clause (d) stood as under as inserted (w.e.f. 14-5-2003) by section 111 of Act 32 of 2003:   <br>   '(d) applicability of notifications issued in respect of duties under this Act, the Customs Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975) and any duty chargeable under any other law for the time being in force in the same manner as duty of customs leviable under this Act.'   <br>   <br>3. Inserted (w.e.f. 13-5-2005) by section 67 of the Finance Act, 2005 (18 of 2005).   <br>   <br>4. Inserted by the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), section 67( w.e.f. 29.03.2018).   <br><br>5. Omitted by <span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 255); font-family: ">s. 91 of Finance Act 2022 (6 of 2022).</span><br><br>6. Inserted by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), section 67( w.e.f. 29.03.2018).  </div></span>



 Section 28I

Data from Section 28I:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 28I.    <span>    </span>    Procedure on receipt of application. -   </strong></p><p>   (1)  On receipt of an application, the Authority shall cause a copy thereof to be forwarded to the   <sup>    1   </sup>   [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs] and, if necessary, call upon him to furnish the relevant records :  </p><p>   Provided             that where any records have been called for by the Authority in any case, such records shall, as soon as possible, be returned to the   <sup>    2   </sup>   [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs].  </p><p>   (2)       The Authority may, after examining the application and the records called for, by order, either allow or reject the application :  </p><p>   Provided              that the Authority shall not allow the application   <sup>    3   </sup>   [***] where the question raised in the application is -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)            already pending in the applicant's case before any officer of customs, the Appellate Tribunal or any Court;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)             the same as in a matter already decided by the Appellate Tribunal or any Court :  </p><p>   Provided              further that no application shall be rejected under this sub-section unless an opportunity has been given to the applicant of being heard:  </p><p>   Provided              also that where the application is rejected, reasons for such rejection shall be given in the order.  </p><p>   (3)              A copy of every order made under sub-section (2) shall be sent to the applicant and to the   <sup>    4   </sup>   [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs].  </p><p>   (4)             Where an application is allowed under sub-section (2), the Authority shall, after examining such further material as may be placed before it by the applicant or obtained by the Authority, pronounce its advance ruling on the question specified in the application.  </p><p>   (5)              On a request received from the applicant, the Authority shall, before pronouncing its advance ruling, provide an opportunity to the applicant of being heard, either in person or through a duly authorised representative.  </p><p><strong>    Explanation   </strong>   . - For the purposes of this sub-section,"authorised representative" shall have the meaning assigned to it in sub-section (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000061/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000247/1000002" alt="section 146A">section 146A</a>.  </p><p>   (6)              The Authority shall pronounce its advance ruling in writing within   <sup>    5   </sup>   [three months] of the receipt of application.  </p><p>   (7) A copy of the advance ruling pronounced by the Authority, duly signed <sup>6</sup>[***] and certified in the prescribed manner shall be sent to the applicant and to the <sup>7&nbsp;</sup>[Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs], as soon as may be, after such pronouncement.  </p><div class="footnotes">   1. Substituted (w.e.f. 6-8-2014) by section 78 of the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), for "Commissioner of Customs".   <br>   <br>   2. Substituted (w.e.f. 6-8-2014) by section 78 of the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), for "Commissioner of Customs".   <br>   <br>   3. The words "except in the case of a resident applicant" omitted (w.e.f. 11-5-2002) by section 122 of the Finance Act, 2002 (20 of 2002).   <br>   <br>   4. Substituted (w.e.f. 6-8-2014) by section 78 of the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), for "Commissioner of Customs".   <br>   <br>   5. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), section 68( w.e.f. 29.03.2018) for "six months". Earlier this was substituted by section 97 of the Finance Act, 2017, for "ninety days".   <br>   <br>6. Omitted by s. 92 of Finance Act 2022 (6 of 2022).<br><br><p>7. Substituted (w.e.f. 6-8-2014) by section 78 of the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014)., for "Commissioner of Customs"</p></div></span>

 Section 28J

Data from Section 28J:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>   Section 28J.  Applicability of advance ruling. -</strong></p><p>   (1)  The advance ruling pronounced by the Authority under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000062/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000061/1000002" alt="section 28-I">section 28-I</a> shall be binding only -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) on the applicant who had sought it;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) in respect of any matter referred to in sub-section (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000062/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000060/1000002" alt="section 28H">section 28H</a>;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c) on the   <sup>    1   </sup>   [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs], and the customs authorities subordinate to him, in respect of the applicant.  </p><p>(2) <sup>2</sup>[The advance ruling referred to in sub-section (1) shall remain valid for three years or till there is a change in law or facts on the basis of which the advance ruling has been pronounced, whichever is earlier:</p><p><strong>Provided</strong> that in respect of any advance ruling in force on the date on which the Finance Bill, 2022 receives the assent of the President, the said period of three years&nbsp;shall be reckoned from the date on which the said Finance Bill receives the assent of<br>the President].<br></p><div class="footnotes">   1. Substituted (w.e.f. 6-8-2014) by section 78 of the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), for "Commissioner of Customs".  <br><br>2. Substituted by s. 93 of Finance Act 2022 (6 of 2022).</div></span>

 Section 28K

Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>   Section 28K. Advance ruling to be void in certain circumstances. -   <br>  </strong></p><p>(1) Where the Authority finds, on a representation made to it by the<br></p><p><sup>   1</sup>[Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs] or otherwise, that an advance ruling pronounced by it under sub-section (6) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000063/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000061/1000002" alt="section 28-I">section 28-I</a> has been obtained by the applicant by fraud or misrepresentation of facts, it may, by order, declare such ruling to be void ab initio and thereupon all the provisions of this Act shall apply</p><p><sup>   2</sup>[***] to the applicant as if such advance ruling had never been made.</p><p><sup>3   </sup>   [               Provided              that in computing the period of two years referred to in clause (a) of sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000063/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000046/1000002" alt="section 28">section 28</a>, or five years referred to in sub-section (4) thereof, for service of notice for recovery of any duty not levied, short-levied, not paid or short-paid on account of the advance ruling, the period beginning with the date of such advance ruling and ending with the date of the order under this sub-section shall be excluded.]<br></p><p>   (2)       A copy of the order made under sub-section (1) shall be sent to the applicant and the   <sup>    4   </sup>   [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs].  </p><div class="footnotes">   1.  Section 28KA

Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>   <sup>    1   </sup>   [Section 28KA. Appeal.-</strong></p><p>(1) Any officer authorised by the Board, by notification, or the applicant may file an appeal to the&nbsp;<sup>2</sup>[High Court]  against any ruling or order passed by the Authority, within sixty days from the date of the communication of such ruling or order, in such form and manner <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000064/../../../content-page/explore-regulations/1000152" alt="as may be prescribed">as may be prescribed</a>:</p><p>   <strong>Provided</strong>              that where the   <sup>    2   </sup>   [High Court]  is satisfied that the appellant was prevented by sufficient cause from presenting the appeal within the period so specified, it may allow a further period of thirty days for filing such appeal.  </p><p>(2)&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">3</span>[***]]</p><p><br></p><div class="footnotes">   1. Omitted (w.e.f. 4-4-2021) s. 5 (f) (ii) of The Tribunals Reforms (Rationalization and Conditions of Service) Ordinance, 2021 (2 of 2021)  </div></span>



 Section 29

Data from Section 29:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <span style="">     <strong>      Section 29. Arrival of vessels and aircrafts in India     </strong></span></span><span>    <span style="">     . -    </span></span>
</p>
<p><span>    <span style="">     (1) The person-in-charge of a vessel or an aircraft entering India from any place outside India shall not cause or permit the vessel or aircraft to call or land-</span></span>
</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;">(a) for the first time after arrival in India; or</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;">(b) at any time while it is carrying passengers or cargo brought in that vessel or aircraft; at any place other than a customs port or a customs airport, as the case may be <sup>               1     </sup> [, unless permitted by the Board].</p>
<p><span>    <span style="">     (2) The provisions of sub-section (1) shall not apply in relation to any vessel or aircraft which is compelled by accident, stress of weather or other unavoidable cause to call or land at a place other than a customs port or customs airport but the person-in-charge of any such vessel or aircraft-</span></span>
</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;">(a) shall immediately report the arrival of the vessel or the landing of the aircraft to the nearest customs officer or the officer-in-charge of a police station and shall on demand produce to him the log book belonging to the vessel or the aircraft;</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;">(b) shall not without the consent of any such officer permit any goods carried in the vessel or the aircraft to be unloaded from or any of the crew or passengers to depart from the vicinity of, the vessel or the aircraft; and</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;">(c) shall comply with any directions given by any such officer with respect to any such goods, and no passenger or member of the crew shall, without the consent of any such officer, leave the immediate vicinity of the vessel or the aircraft:</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;"><span>    <span style="">     <strong>      Provided     </strong></span></span><span>    <span style="">     that nothing in this section shall prohibit the departure of any crew or passengers from the vicinity of, or the removal of goods from, the vessel or aircraft where the departure or removal is necessary for reasons of health, safety or the preservation of life or property.</span></span>
</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;"><span><span style=""><br></span></span>
</p>
<div class="footnotes">
	<p> 1. Inserted (w.e.f. 10-5-2013) by s. 69 of the Finance Act, 2013 (17 of 2013). </p>
</div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <span style="">     <strong>      Section 29. Arrival of vessels and aircrafts in India     </strong></span></span><span>    <span style="">     . -    </span></span>
</p>
<p><span>    <span style="">     (1) The person-in-charge of a vessel or an aircraft entering India from any place outside India shall not cause or permit the vessel or aircraft to call or land-</span></span>
</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;">(a) for the first time after arrival in India; or</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;">(b) at any time while it is carrying passengers or cargo brought in that vessel or aircraft; at any place other than a customs port or a customs airport, as the case may be <sup>               1     </sup> [, unless permitted by the Board].</p>
<p><span>    <span style="">     (2) The provisions of sub-section (1) shall not apply in relation to any vessel or aircraft which is compelled by accident, stress of weather or other unavoidable cause to call or land at a place other than a customs port or customs airport but the person-in-charge of any such vessel or aircraft-</span></span>
</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;">(a) shall immediately report the arrival of the vessel or the landing of the aircraft to the nearest customs officer or the officer-in-charge of a police station and shall on demand produce to him the log book belonging to the vessel or the aircraft;</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;">(b) shall not without the consent of any such officer permit any goods carried in the vessel or the aircraft to be unloaded from or any of the crew or passengers to depart from the vicinity of, the vessel or the aircraft; and</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;">(c) shall comply with any directions given by any such officer with respect to any such goods, and no passenger or member of the crew shall, without the consent of any such officer, leave the immediate vicinity of the vessel or the aircraft:</p>
<p style="margin-left: 25px;"><span>    <span style="">     <strong>      Provided     </strong></span></span><span>    <span style="">     that nothing in this section shall prohibit the departure of any crew or passengers from the vicinity of, or the removal of goods from, the vessel or aircraft where the departure or removal is necessary for reasons of health, safety or the preservation of life or property.</span></span>
</p>

 Section 30

Data from Section 30:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p>   <strong>Section 30. Delivery of   <sup>    1   </sup>   [arrival manifest, import manifest] or import report .-</strong>  </p><p><sup>    2   </sup>   [(1) The person-in-charge of-  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (i) a vessel; or  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (ii) an aircraft; or  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (iii) a vehicle,  </p><p>   carrying imported goods   <sup>    3   </sup>   [or export goods] or any other person as may be specified by the Central Government, by notification in the Official Gazette, in this behalf shall, in the case of a vessel or an aircraft, deliver to the proper officer   <sup>    4   </sup>   [an   <sup>    1   </sup>   [arrival manifest or import manifest] by presenting electronically prior to the arrival] of the vessel or the aircraft, as the case <sup>    1   </sup>   [arrival manifest, import manifest] or the import report or any part thereof, is not delivered to the proper officer within the time specified in this sub-section and if the proper officer is satisfied that there was no sufficient cause for such delay, the person-in-charge or any other person referred to in this sub-section, who caused such delay, shall be liable to a penalty not exceeding fifty thousand rupees:]  </p><p><sup>    6   </sup>   [ Provided that the   <sup>    7   </sup>   [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs] may, in cases person delivering the   <sup>    1   </sup>   [arrival manifest, import manifest] or import report shall at the foot thereof make and subscribe to a declaration as to the truth of its contents.     <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [30A. Passenger and crew arrival manifest and passenger name record information.
   </strong>

  </p>

   (1) The person-in-charge of a conveyance that enters India from any place outside India or any other person as may be specified by the Central Government by notification in the Official Gazette, shall deliver to the proper officer-

 Section 31

Data from Section 31:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <span>
    <strong>
     Section 31. Imported goods not to be unloaded from vessel until entry inwards granted
    </strong>
    . -
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   (1) The master of a vessel shall not permit the unloading of any imported goods until an order has been given by the proper officer granting entry inwards to such vessel.
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   (2) No order under sub-section (1) shall be given until an
   <sup>
    1
   </sup>
   [arrival manifest or import manifest] has been delivered or the proper officer is satisfied that there was sufficient cause for not delivering it.
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   (3) Nothing in this section shall apply to the unloading of baggage accompanying a passenger or a member of the crew, mail bags, animals, perishable goods and hazardous goods.
  </p>
  <div>
   <div class="footnotes">
    <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
     1. Substituted (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) by s. 56 of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018).
    </p>
   </div>
  </div>
 
</span>

 Section 33

<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 33. Unloading and loading of goods at approved places only. -   </strong></p><p>   Except with the permission of the proper officer, no imported goods shall be unloaded, and no export goods shall be loaded, at any place other than a place approved under clause (a) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000072/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000008/1000002" alt="section 8">section 8</a> for the unloading or loading of such goods.  </p></span>

 Section 34

Data from Section 34:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 34. Goods not to be unloaded or loaded except under supervision of customs officer. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   Imported goods shall not be unloaded from, and export goods shall not be loaded on, any conveyance except under the supervision of the proper officer:
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   Provided that the Board may, by notification in the Official Gazette, give general permission and the proper officer may in any particular case give special permission, for any goods or class of goods to be unloaded or loaded without the supervision of the proper officer.
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 34. Goods not to be unloaded or loaded except under supervision of customs officer. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">

  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   Provided that the Board may, by notification in the Official Gazette, give general permission and the proper officer may in any particular case give special permission, for any goods or class of goods to be unloaded or loaded without the supervision of the proper officer.
  </p>

 Section 35

Data from Section 35:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 35. Restrictions on goods being water-borne. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   No imported goods shall be water-borne for being landed from any vessel, and no export goods which are not accompanied by a shipping bill, shall be water-borne for being shipped, unless the goods are accompanied by a boat-note in the prescribed form:
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Provided
   </strong>
   that the Board may, by notification in the Official Gazette, give general permission, and the proper officer may in any particular case give special permission, for any goods or any class of goods to be waterborne without being accompanied by a boat-note.
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 35. Restrictions on goods being water-borne. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   No imported goods shall be water-borne for being landed from any vessel, and no export goods which are not accompanied by a shipping bill, shall be water-borne for being shipped, unless the goods are accompanied by a boat-note in the prescribed form:
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Provided
   </strong>
   that the Board may, by notification in the Official Gazette, give general permission, and the proper officer may in any particular case give special permission, for any goods or any class of goods to be waterborne without being accompanied by a boat-note.
  </p>
 
</span>



 Section 36

Data from Section 36:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 36. Restrictions on unloading and loading of goods on holidays, etc. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   No imported goods shall be unloaded from, and no export goods shall be loaded on, any conveyance on any Sunday or on any holiday observed by the Customs Department or on any other day after the working hours, except after giving the prescribed notice and on payment of the prescribed fees, if any:
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Provided
   </strong>
   that no fees shall be levied for the unloading and loading of baggage accompanying a passenger or a member of the crew, and mail bags.
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 36. Restrictions on unloading and loading of goods on holidays, etc. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   No imported goods shall be unloaded from, and no export goods shall be loaded on, any conveyance on any Sunday or on any holiday observed by the Customs Department or on any other day after the working hours, except after giving the prescribed notice and on payment of the prescribed fees, if any:
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Provided
   </strong>
   that no fees shall be levied for the unloading and loading of baggage accompanying a passenger or a member of the crew, and mail bags.
  </p>
 
</span>



 Section 37

Data from Section 37:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 37. Power to board conveyances. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   The proper officer may, at any time, board any conveyance carrying imported goods or export goods and may remain on such conveyance for such period as he considers necessary.
  </p>
 
</span>

 Section 38

   <strong>
    Section 38. Power to require production of documents and ask questions. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   For the purposes of carrying out the provisions of this Act, the proper officer may require the person-in-charge of any conveyance or animal carrying imported goods or export goods to produce any document and to answer any questions and thereupon such person shall produce such documents and answer such questions.
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 38. Power to require production of documents and ask questions. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   For the purposes of carrying out the provisions of this Act, the proper officer may require the person-in-charge of any conveyance or animal carrying imported goods or export goods to produce any document and to answer any questions and thereupon such person shall produce such documents and answer such questions.
  </p>
 
</span>



 Section 39

Data from Section 39:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 39. Export goods not to be loaded on vessel until entry-outwards granted. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   The master of a vessel shall not permit the loading of any export goods, other than baggage and mail bags, until an order has been given by the proper officer granting entry-outwards to such vessel.
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 39. Export goods not to be loaded on vessel until entry-outwards granted. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   The master of a vessel shall not permit the loading of any export goods, other than baggage and mail bags, until an order has been given by the proper officer granting entry-outwards to such vessel.
  </p>
 
</span>



 Section 40

Data from Section 40:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 40. Export goods not to be loaded unless duly passed by proper officer. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   The person-in-charge of a conveyance shall not permit the loading at a customs station-
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   (a) of export goods, other than baggage and mail bags, unless a shipping bill or bill of export or a bill of transhipment, as the case may be, duly passed by the proper officer, has been handed over to him by the exporter;
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   (b) of baggage and mail bags, unless their export has been duly permitted by the proper officer.
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <strong>
    Section 40. Export goods not to be loaded unless duly passed by proper officer. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   The person-in-charge of a conveyance shall not permit the loading at a customs station-
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   (a) of export goods, other than baggage and mail bags, unless a shipping bill or bill of export or a bill of transhipment, as the case may be, duly passed by the proper officer, has been handed over to him by the exporter;
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   (b) of baggage and mail bags, unless their export has been duly permitted by the proper officer.
  </p>
 
</span>



 Section 41

Data from Section 41:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <span>
    <strong>
     Section 41. Delivery of
    </strong>
    <sup>
     <strong>
      1
     </strong>
    </sup>
    <strong>
     [departure manifest, export manifest] or export report.-
    </strong>
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <span>
    (1)
    <sup>
     2
    </sup>
    [The person-in-charge of a conveyance carrying export goods or imported goods or any other person as may be specified by the Central Government, by notification, shall, before departure of the conveyance from a customs station, deliver to the proper officer in the case of a vessel or aircraft, a departure manifest or an export manifest by presenting electronically, and in the case of a vehicle, an export report, in such form and manner as may be prescribed and in case, such person-in-charge or other person fails to deliver the departure manifest or export manifest or the export report or any part thereof within such time, and the proper officer is satisfied that there is no sufficient cause for such delay, such person-in-charge or other person shall be liable to pay penalty not exceeding fifty thousand rupees].
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <span>
    <sup>
     3
    </sup>
    [ * * * * * ]
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <span>
    <sup>
     4
    </sup>
    [
    <strong>
     Provided
    </strong>
    that the
    <sup>
     5
    </sup>
    [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs] may, in cases where it is not feasible to deliver the
    <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [departure manifest or export manifest] by presenting electronically, allow the same to be delivered in any other manner.]
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <span>
    (2) The person delivering the
    <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [departure manifest, export manifest] or export report shall at the foot thereof make and subscribe to a declaration as to the truth of its contents.
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <span>
    (3) If the proper officer is satisfied that the
    <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [departure manifest, export manifest] or export report is in any way incorrect or incomplete and that there was no fraudulent intention, he may permit such manifest or report to be amended or supplemented.
   </span>
  </p>

 Section 41A

Data from Section 41A:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <span>
    <strong>
     Section
    </strong>
    <sup>
     <strong>
      1
     </strong>
    </sup>
    <strong>
     [41A. Passenger and crew departure manifest and passenger name record information
    </strong>
    . -
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <span>
    (1) The person-in-charge of a conveyance that departs from India to a place outside India or any other person as may be specified by the Central Government by notification in the Official Gazette, shall deliver to the proper officer-
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (i) the passenger and crew departure manifest; and
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <span>
    (ii) the passenger name record information of departing passengers,
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <span>
    in such form, containing such particulars, in such manner and within such time, as may be prescribed.
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">
   <span>
    (2) Where the passenger and crew departure manifest or the passenger name record information or any part thereof is not delivered to the proper officer within the prescribed time and if the proper officer is satisfied that there was no sufficient cause for such delay, the person-in-charge or the other person referred to in sub-section (1) shall be liable to such penalty, not exceeding fifty thousand rupees, as may be prescribed.]
   </span>
  </p>
  <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US">

 Section 42

Data from Section 42:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <strong>     Section 42. No conveyance to leave without written order. -    </strong></span></p><p><span>    (1) The person-in-charge of a conveyance which has brought any imported goods or has loaded any export goods at a customs station shall not cause or permit the conveyance to depart from that customs station until a written order to that effect has been given by the proper officer.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>    (2) No such order shall be given until-   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (a) the person-in-charge of the conveyance has answered the questions put to him under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000082/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000077/1000002" alt="section 38">section 38</a>;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (b) the provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000082/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000080/1000002" alt="section 41">section 41</a> have been complied with;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (c) the shipping bills or bills of export, the bills of transhipment, if any, and such other documents as the proper officer may require have been delivered to him;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (d) all duties leviable on any stores consumed in such conveyance, and all charges and penalties due in respect of such conveyance or from the person-in-charge thereof have been paid or the payment secured by such guarantee or deposit of such amount as the proper officer may direct;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (e) the person-in-charge of the conveyance has satisfied the proper officer that no penalty is leviable on him under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000082/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000175/1000002" alt="section 116 ">section 116 </a>or the payment of any penalty that may be levied upon him under that section has been secured by such guarantee or deposit of such amount as the proper officer may direct;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (f) in any case where any export goods have been loaded without payment of export duty or in contravention of any provision of this Act or any other law for the time being in force relating to export of goods, -   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 80px;"><span>    (i) such goods have been unloaded, or   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 80px;"><span>    (ii) where the    <sup>     1    </sup>    [Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs] is satisfied that it is not practicable to unload such goods, the person-in-charge of the conveyance has given an undertaking, secured by such guarantee or deposit of such amount as the proper officer may direct, for bringing back the goods to India.   </span></p><div class="footnotes"><p><span>     1. Substituted by s. 100 of the Finance Act, 1999 (27 of 1999). (w.e.f. 11-5-1999)    </span></p></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <strong>     Section 42. No conveyance to leave without written order. -    </strong></span></p><p><span>    (1) The person-in-charge of a conveyance which has brought any imported goods or has loaded any export goods at a customs station shall not cause or permit the conveyance to depart from that customs station until a written order to that effect has been given by the proper officer.&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>    (2) No such order shall be given until-   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (a) the person-in-charge of the conveyance has answered the questions put to him under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000082/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000077/1000002" alt="section 38">section 38</a>;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (b) the provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000082/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000080/1000002" alt="section 41">section 41</a> have been complied with;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (c) the shipping bills or bills of export, the bills of transhipment, if any, and such other documents as the proper officer may require have been delivered to him;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (d) all duties leviable on any stores consumed in such conveyance, and all charges and penalties due in respect of such conveyance or from the person-in-charge thereof have been paid or the payment secured by such guarantee or deposit of such amount as the proper officer may direct;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (e) the person-in-charge of the conveyance has satisfied the proper officer that no penalty is leviable on him under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000082/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000175/1000002" alt="section 116 ">section 116 </a>or the payment of any penalty that may be levied upon him under that section has been secured by such guarantee or deposit of such amount as the proper officer may direct;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (f) in any case where any export goods have been loaded without payment of export duty or in contravention of any provision of this Act or any other law for the time being in force relating to export of goods, -   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 80px;"><span>    (i) such goods have been unloaded, or   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 80px;"><span>    (ii) where the    <sup>     1    </sup>    [Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs] is satisfied that it is not practicable to unload such goods, the person-in-charge of the conveyance has given an undertaking, secured by such guarantee or deposit of such amount as the proper officer may direct, for bringing back the goods to India.   </span></p><div class="footnotes"><p><span>     1. Substituted by s. 100 of the Finance Act, 1999 (27 of 1999). (w.e.f. 11-5-1999)    </span></p></div></span>



 Section 43

Data from Section 43:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <strong>     Section 43. Exemption of certain classes of conveyances from certain provisions of this Chapter. -    </strong></span></p><p><span>    (1) The provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000083/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000068/1000002" alt="sections 30">sections 30</a>,<a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000083/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000080/1000002" alt=" 41"> 41</a> and <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000083/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000082/1000002" alt="42 ">42 </a>shall not apply to a vehicle which carries no goods other than the luggage of its occupants.   </span></p><p><span>    (2) The Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, exempt the following classes of conveyances from all or any of the provisions of this Chapter-   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (a) conveyances belonging to the Government or any foreign Government;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (b) vessels and aircraft which temporarily enter India by reason of any emergency.   </span></p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><span>    <strong>     Section 43. Exemption of certain classes of conveyances from certain provisions of this Chapter. -    </strong></span></p><p><span>    (1) The provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000083/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000068/1000002" alt="sections 30">sections 30</a>,<a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000083/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000080/1000002" alt=" 41"> 41</a> and <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000083/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000082/1000002" alt="42 ">42 </a>shall not apply to a vehicle which carries no goods other than the luggage of its occupants.   </span></p><p><span>    (2) The Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, exempt the following classes of conveyances from all or any of the provisions of this Chapter-   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (a) conveyances belonging to the Government or any foreign Government;   </span></p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><span>    (b) vessels and aircraft which temporarily enter India by reason of any emergency.   </span></p></span>



 Section 44

Data from Section 44:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <b>
   Section 44. Chapter not to apply to baggage and postal articles. -
  </b>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
   The provisions of this Chapter shall not apply to (a) baggage, and (b) goods imported or to be exported by post.
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <b>
   Section 44. Chapter not to apply to baggage and postal articles. -
  </b>
  <p>
  </p>
  <p>
   The provisions of this Chapter shall not apply to (a) baggage, and (b) goods imported or to be exported by post.
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
 
</span>



 Section 45

Data from Section 45:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    <em>     Clearance of Imported goods    </em>    :   </strong></p><p><strong>    Section 45.   </strong><strong>    Restrictions on custody and removal of imported goods. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) Save as otherwise provided in any law for the time being in force, all imported goods unloaded in a customs area shall remain in the custody of such person as may be approved by the   <sup>    1   </sup>   [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs] until they are cleared for home consumption or are warehoused or are transhipped in accordance with the provisions of Chapter VIII.  </p><p>   (2)  The person having custody of any imported goods in a customs area, whether under the provisions of sub-section (1) or under any law for the time being in force, -   <br>  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)   shall keep a record of such goods and send a copy thereof to the proper officer;   <br>  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)   shall not permit such goods to be removed from the customs area or otherwise dealt with, except under and in accordance with the permission in writing of the proper officer   <sup>    2   </sup>   [or in such manner as may be prescribed] .   <br>  </p><p><sup>    3   </sup>   [(3)   Notwithstanding anything contained in any law for the time being in force, if any imported goods are pilferred after unloading thereof in a customs area while in the custody of a person referred to in sub-section (1), that person shall be liable to pay duty on such goods at the rate prevailing on the date of delivery of an   <sup>    4   </sup>   [arrival manifest or import manifest] or, as the case may be, an import report to the proper officer under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000085/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000068/1000002" alt="section 30">section 30</a> for the arrival of the conveyance in which the said goods were carried.]  </p><p></p><div class="footnotes"><p>    1. Substituted (w.e.f. 6-8-2014)by section 78 of the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014),  for "Commissioner of Customs". Earlier words "Commissioner of Customs" were substituted (w.e.f. 26-5-1995) by section 50 of Act 22 of 1995, for the words "Collector of Customs".    <br>   </p><p>    2. Inserted by section 75 (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018).   </p><p>    3. Inserted by section 58 (w.e.f. 26-5-1995) of the Finance Act, 1995 (22 of 1995).   </p><p>    4. Substituted by section 56 (w.e.f.29.03.2018),  by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), for "import manifest".    <br>   </p><p></p></div><p></p><p></p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    <em>     Clearance of Imported goods    </em>    :   </strong></p><p><strong>    Section 45.   </strong><strong>    Restrictions on custody and removal of imported goods. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) Save as otherwise provided in any law for the time being in force, all imported goods unloaded in a customs area shall remain in the custody of such person as may be approved by the   <sup>    1   </sup>   [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs] until they are cleared for home consumption or are warehoused or are transhipped in accordance with the provisions of Chapter VIII.  </p><p>   (2)  The person having custody of any imported goods in a customs area, whether under the provisions of sub-section (1) or under any law for the time being in force, -   <br>  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)   shall keep a record of such goods and send a copy thereof to the proper officer;   <br>  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)   shall not permit such goods to be removed from the customs area or otherwise dealt with, except under and in accordance with the permission in writing of the proper officer   <sup>    2   </sup>   [or in such manner as may be prescribed] .   <br>  </p><p><sup>    3   </sup>   [(3)   Notwithstanding anything contained in any law for the time being in force, if any imported goods are pilferred after unloading thereof in a customs area while in the custody of a person referred to in sub-section (1), that person shall be liable to pay duty on such goods at the rate prevailing on the date of delivery of an   <sup>    4   </sup>   [arrival manifest or import manifest] or, as the case may be, an import report to the proper officer under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000085/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000068/1000002" alt="section 30">section 30</a> for the arrival of the conveyance in which the said goods were carried.]  </p><p></p><div class="footnotes"><p>    1. Substituted (w.e.f. 6-8-2014)by section 78 of the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014),  for "Commissioner of Customs". Earlier words "Commissioner of Customs" were substituted (w.e.f. 26-5-1995) by section 50 of Act 22 of 1995, for the words "Collector of Customs".    <br>   </p><p>    2. Inserted by section 75 (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018).   </p><p>    3. Inserted by section 58 (w.e.f. 26-5-1995) of the Finance Act, 1995 (22 of 1995).   </p><p>    4. Substituted by section 56 (w.e.f.29.03.2018),  by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), for "import manifest".    <br>   </p><p></p></div><p></p><p></p></span>



 Section 46

Data from Section 46:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    <em>     Clearance of Imported goods    </em>    :   </strong></p><p><strong>    Section 46.   </strong><strong>    Entry of goods on importation. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) The importer of any goods, other than goods intended for transit or transhipment, shall make entry thereof by presenting   <sup>    1   </sup>   [electronically]   <sup>    2   </sup>   [on the customs automated system]  to the proper officer a bill of entry for home consumption or warehousing   <sup>    3   </sup>   [in such form and manner as may be prescribed] :  </p><p><sup>    4   </sup>   [   <strong>    Provided   </strong>   that the   <sup>    5   </sup>   [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs] may, in cases where it is not feasible to make entry by presenting electronically   <sup>    6   </sup>   [on the customs automated system] , allow an entry to be presented in any other manner:  </p><p><strong>    Provided   </strong>   further that if the importer makes and subscribes to a declaration before the proper officer, to the effect that he is unable for want of full information to furnish all the particulars of the goods required under this sub-section, the proper officer may, pending the production of such information, permit him, previous to the entry thereof (a) to examine the goods in the presence of an officer of customs, or (b) to deposit the goods in a public warehouse appointed under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000086/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000099/1000002" alt="section 57">section 57</a> without warehousing the same.  </p><p>   (2)   Save as otherwise permitted by the proper officer, a bill of entry shall include all the goods mentioned in the bill of lading or other receipt given by the carrier to the consignor.  </p><p><sup>    7   </sup>   [(3) The importer shall present the bill of entry under sub-section (1)   <sup>    8   </sup><sup>   </sup>   [before the end of the day (including holidays) preceding the day] on which the aircraft or vessel or vehicle carrying the goods arrives at a customs station at which such goods are to be cleared for home consumption or warehousing:  </p><p><sup>    9   </sup>   [   <strong>    Provided   </strong>   that the Board may, in such cases as it may deem fit, prescribe different time limits for presentation of the bill of entry, which shall not be later than the end of the day of such arrival:  </p><p><strong>    Provided   </strong>   further that] a bill of entry may be presented   <sup>    10   </sup>   [at any time not exceeding thirty days prior to] the expected arrival of the aircraft or vessel or vehicle by which the goods have been shipped for importation into India:  </p><p><sup>   </sup><sup>    11   </sup>   [   <strong>    Provided   </strong>   also that] where the bill of entry is not presented within the time so specified and the proper officer is satisfied that there was no sufficient cause for such delay, the importer shall pay such charges for late presentation of the bill of entry as may be prescribed.  </p><p>   (4)   The importer while presenting a bill of entry shall   <sup>    12   </sup>   [* * *] make and subscribe to a declaration as to the truth of the contents of such bill of entry and shall, in support of such declaration, produce to the proper officer the invoice, if any,   <sup>    13   </sup>   [and such other documents relating to the imported goods as may be prescribed].  </p><p><sup>    14   </sup>   [(4A) The importer who presents a bill of entry shall ensure the following, namely:-  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) the accuracy and completeness of the information given therein;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) the authenticity and validity of any document supporting it; and  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c) compliance with the restriction or prohibition, if any, relating to the goods under this Act or under any other law for the time being in force.]  </p><p>   (5)   If the proper officer is satisfied that the interests of revenue are not prejudicially affected and that there was no fraudulent intention, he may permit substitution of a bill of entry for home consumption for a bill of entry for warehousing or vice versa.  </p><div class="footnotes"><p style="line-height: 18.4px; margin: 0pt 0in 10pt; text-indent: 0in; direction: ltr; unicode-bidi: embed;
