Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <b>
   Section 68.Clearance of warehoused goods for home consumption. -
  </b>
  <br>
  <br>
  <p>
   <sup>
    1
   </sup>
   [Any warehoused goods may be cleared from the warehouse] for home consumption, if -
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (a) a bill of entry for home consumption in respect of such goods has been presented in the prescribed form;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <sup>
    2
   </sup>
   [(b)
           the import duty, interest, fine and penalties payable in respect of such goods have been paid; and]
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (c) an order for clearance of such goods for home consumption has been made by the proper officer :
  </p>
  <sup>
   3
  </sup>
  [
  <sup>
   4
  </sup>
  [
  <b>
   Provided
  </b>
  that the order referred to in clause (c) may also be made electronically through the customs automated system on the basis of risk evaluation through appropriate selection criteria:
  <br>
  <br>
  <b>
   Provided
  </b>
  further that] the owner of any warehoused goods may, at any time before an order for clearance of goods for home consumption has been made in respect of such goods, relinquish his title to the goods upon payment of
  <sup>
   5
  </sup>
  [*
  <span>
  </span>
  *
  <span>
  </span>
  *] penalties that may be payable in respect of the goods and upon such relinquishment, he shall not be liable to pay duty thereon:]
  <br>
  <br>
  <sup>
   6
  </sup>
  [
  <sup>
   7
  </sup>
  [
  <b>
   Provided
  </b>
  also that] the owner of any such warehoused goods shall not be allowed to relinquish his title to such goods regarding which an offence appears to have been committed under this Act or any other law for the time being in force.]
  <br>
  <br>
  <div class="footnotes">
   1. Substituted (w.e.f. 14-5-2016) by section 132(i) of the Finance Act, 2016 (28 of 2016), for"The importer of any warehoused goods may clear them".
   <br>
   <br>
   2. Substituted (w.e.f. 14-5-2016) by section 132(ii) of the Finance Act, 2016 (28 of 2016), for clause (b). Before substitution, Clause (b) stood as under:
   <br>
   "(b) the import duty leviable on such goods and all penalties, rent, interest and other charges payable in respect of such goods have been paid; and".
   <br>
   <br>
   3. Inserted (w.e.f. 14-5-2003)by section 114 of the Finance Act, 2003 (32 of 2003).
   <br>
   <br>
   4. Substituted by section 83 (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) of Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), for "Provided that".
   <br>
   <br>
   5. The words"rent, interest, other charges and" omitted (w.e.f. 14-5-2016) by section 132(iii) of the Finance Act, 2016 (28 of 2016).
   <br>
   <br>
   6. Inserted (w.e.f. 18-4-2006) by section 59 of the Finance Act, 2006 (21 of 2006)..
   <br>
   <br>
   7. Substituted by section 83 (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) of Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), for "Provided further that".

Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <b>
   Section 68.Clearance of warehoused goods for home consumption. -
  </b>
  <br>
  <br>
  <p>
   <sup>
    1
   </sup>
   [Any warehoused goods may be cleared from the warehouse] for home consumption, if -
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (a) a bill of entry for home consumption in respect of such goods has been presented in the prescribed form;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <sup>
    2
   </sup>
   [(b)
           the import duty, interest, fine and penalties payable in respect of such goods have been paid; and]
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (c) an order for clearance of such goods for home consumption has been made by the proper officer :
  </p>
  <sup>
   3
  </sup>
  [
  <sup>
   4
  </sup>
  [
  <b>
   Provided
  </b>
  that the order referred to in clause (c) may also be made electronically through the customs automated system on the basis of risk evaluation through appropriate selection criteria:
  <br>
  <br>
  <b>
   Provided
  </b>
  further that] the owner of any warehoused goods may, at any time before an order for clearance of goods for home consumption has been made in respect of such goods, relinquish his title to the goods upon payment of
  <sup>
   5
  </sup>
  [*
  <span>
  </span>
  *
  <span>
  </span>
  *] penalties that may be payable in respect of the goods and upon such relinquishment, he shall not be liable to pay duty thereon:]
  <br>
  <br>
  <sup>
   6
  </sup>
  [
  <sup>
   7
  </sup>
  [
  <b>
   Provided
  </b>
  also that] the owner of any such warehoused goods shall not be allowed to relinquish his title to such goods regarding which an offence appears to have been committed under this Act or any other law for the time being in force.]
  <br>
  <br>
  <div class="footnotes">

  <b>
   Section 70.  Allowance in case of volatile goods. -
  </b>
  <br>
  <br>
  (1) When any warehoused goods to which this section applies are at the time of delivery from a warehouse found to be deficient in quantity on account of natural loss, the
  <sup>
   1
  </sup>
  [Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs] may remit the duty on such deficiency.
  <br>
  <br>
  (2)This section applies to such warehoused goods as the Central Government, having regard to the volatility of the goods and the manner of their storage, may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify.
  <br>
  <br>
  <div class="footnotes">
   1. Substituted (w.e.f. 11-5-1999) by section 100 of the Finance Act, 1999 (27 of 1999),for"Assistant Commissioner of Customs".  Section 74

Data from Section 74:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>   Section 74.   Drawback allowable on re-export of duty-paid goods. -   <br>  </strong></p><p><br></p><p>   (1) When any goods capable of being easily identified which have been imported into India and upon which   <sup>    1   </sup>   [any duty has been paid on importation, -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (i) are entered for export and the proper officer makes an order permitting clearance and loading of the goods for exportation under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000091/1000002" alt="section 51">section 51</a>; or  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (ii) are to be exported as baggage and the owner of such baggage, for the purpose of clearing it, makes a declaration of its contents to the proper officer under <a href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000124/1000002" alt="section 77">section 77</a> (which declaration shall be deemed to be an entry for export for the purposes of this section) and such officer makes an order permitting clearance of the goods for exportation; or  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (iii) are entered for export by post under   <sup>    2   </sup>   [clause (a) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000131/1000002" alt="section 84">section 84</a>] and the proper officer makes an order permitting clearance of the goods for exportation,           ninety-eight per cent of such duty shall, except as otherwise hereinafter provided, be re-paid as drawback, if -]  </p><p>   (a) the goods are identified to the satisfaction of the   <sup>    3   </sup>   [Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs] as the goods which were imported; and  </p><p>   (b) the goods are entered for export within two years from the date of payment of duty on the importation thereof :  </p><p><strong>    Provided   </strong>   that in any particular case the aforesaid period of two years may, on sufficient cause being shown, be extended by the Board by such further period as it may deem fit.  </p><p>   (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), the rate of drawback in the case of goods which have been used after the importation thereof shall be such as the Central Government, having regard to the duration of use, depreciation in value and other relevant circumstances, may, by notification in the Official Gazette, fix.  </p><p><sup>    4   </sup>   [(3) The Central Government <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000443/1000002" alt="may make rules">may make rules</a> for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of this section and, in particular, such rules may -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) provide for the manner in which the identity of goods imported in different consignments which are ordinarily stored together in bulk, may be established;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) specify the goods which shall be deemed to be not capable of being easily identified; and  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c) provide for the manner and the time within which a claim for payment of drawback is to be filed.]  </p><p>   (4) For the purposes of this section -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)     goods shall be deemed to have been entered for export on the date with reference to which the rate of duty is calculated under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000030/1000002" alt="section 16">section 16</a>;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) in the case of goods assessed to duty provisionally under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000032/1000002" alt="section 18">section 18</a>, the date of payment of the provisional duty shall be deemed to be the date of payment of duty.  </p><div class="footnotes"><p><span style="text-align: start;">     1. Substituted by the Customs (Amendment) Act, 1985 (80 of 1985) , section 6, for certain words (w.e.f. 27.12.1985). Earlier those words were amended by Act 11 of 1983, section 51 (w.e.f. 13.05.1983).    </span></p><p>    2. Substituted by section 85 (w.e.f. 29.03.2018),  by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), for "section 82".   </p><p>    3. Substituted by the Finance Act, 1999 (27 of 1999), section 100, for "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" (w.e.f. 11.05.1999). Earlier the words "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" were substituted by Act 22 of 1995, section 50, for the words "Assistant Collector of Customs" (w.e.f. 26.05.1995).   </p><p>    4. Inserted by the Finance Act, 1995 (22 of 1995), section 60, for sub-section (3) (w.e.f. 26.05.1995).   </p></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>   Section 74.   Drawback allowable on re-export of duty-paid goods. -   <br>  </strong></p><p><br></p><p>   (1) When any goods capable of being easily identified which have been imported into India and upon which   <sup>    1   </sup>   [any duty has been paid on importation, -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (i) are entered for export and the proper officer makes an order permitting clearance and loading of the goods for exportation under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000091/1000002" alt="section 51">section 51</a>; or  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (ii) are to be exported as baggage and the owner of such baggage, for the purpose of clearing it, makes a declaration of its contents to the proper officer under <a href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000124/1000002" alt="section 77">section 77</a> (which declaration shall be deemed to be an entry for export for the purposes of this section) and such officer makes an order permitting clearance of the goods for exportation; or  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (iii) are entered for export by post under   <sup>    2   </sup>   [clause (a) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000131/1000002" alt="section 84">section 84</a>] and the proper officer makes an order permitting clearance of the goods for exportation,           ninety-eight per cent of such duty shall, except as otherwise hereinafter provided, be re-paid as drawback, if -]  </p><p>   (a) the goods are identified to the satisfaction of the   <sup>    3   </sup>   [Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs] as the goods which were imported; and  </p><p>   (b) the goods are entered for export within two years from the date of payment of duty on the importation thereof :  </p><p><strong>    Provided   </strong>   that in any particular case the aforesaid period of two years may, on sufficient cause being shown, be extended by the Board by such further period as it may deem fit.  </p><p>   (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), the rate of drawback in the case of goods which have been used after the importation thereof shall be such as the Central Government, having regard to the duration of use, depreciation in value and other relevant circumstances, may, by notification in the Official Gazette, fix.  </p><p><sup>    4   </sup>   [(3) The Central Government <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000443/1000002" alt="may make rules">may make rules</a> for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of this section and, in particular, such rules may -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) provide for the manner in which the identity of goods imported in different consignments which are ordinarily stored together in bulk, may be established;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) specify the goods which shall be deemed to be not capable of being easily identified; and  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c) provide for the manner and the time within which a claim for payment of drawback is to be filed.]  </p><p>   (4) For the purposes of this section -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)     goods shall be deemed to have been entered for export on the date with reference to which the rate of duty is calculated under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000030/1000002" alt="section 16">section 16</a>;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) in the case of goods assessed to duty provisionally under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000120/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000032/1000002" alt="section 18">section 18</a>, the date of payment of the provisional duty shall be deemed to be the date of payment of duty.  </p><div class="footnotes"><p><span style="text-align: start;">     1. Substituted by the Customs (Amendment) Act, 1985 (80 of 1985) , section 6, for certain words (w.e.f. 27.12.1985). Earlier those words were amended by Act 11 of 1983, section 51 (w.e.f. 13.05.1983).    </span></p><p>    2. Substituted by section 85 (w.e.f. 29.03.2018),  by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), for "section 82".   </p><p>    3. Substituted by the Finance Act, 1999 (27 of 1999), section 100, for "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" (w.e.f. 11.05.1999). Earlier the words "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" were substituted by Act 22 of 1995, section 50, for the words "Assistant Collector of Customs" (w.e.f. 26.05.1995).   </p><p>    4. Inserted by the Finance Act, 1995 (22 of 1995), section 60, for sub-section (3) (w.e.f. 26.05.1995).   </p></div></span>



 Section 75

Data from Section 75:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>   SECTION 75. Drawback on imported materials used in the manufacture of goods which are exported. -</strong></p><p>(1) Where it appears to the Central Government that in respect of goods of any class or description&nbsp;<sup>1</sup>[manufactured, processed or on which any operation has been carried out in India]&nbsp;<sup>2</sup>[, being goods which have been entered for export and in respect of which an order permitting the clearance and loading thereof for exportation has been made under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000121/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000091/1000002" alt="section 51">section 51</a> by the proper officer],&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">3</span>[or being goods entered for export by post under&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">4</span>[clause (a) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000121/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000131/1000002" alt="section 84">section 84</a>] and in respect of which an order permitting clearance for exportation has been made by the proper officer], a drawback should be allowed of duties of customs chargeable under this Act on any imported materials of a class or description used in the&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">5</span>[manufacture or processing of such goods or carrying out any operation on such goods], the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, direct that drawback shall be allowed in respect of such goods in accordance with, and subject to, the <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000121/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000161/1000002" alt="rules made under sub-section (2)">rules made under sub-section (2)</a>:&nbsp;</p><p><span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">6</span>[<strong>Provided&nbsp;</strong>that no drawback shall be allowed under this sub-section in respect of any of the aforesaid goods which the Central Government may, by <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000121/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000161/1000002" alt="rules made under sub-section (2)">rules made under sub-section (2)</a>, specify, if the export value of such goods or class of goods is less than the value of the imported materials used in the&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">7</span>[manufacture or processing of such goods or carrying out any operation on such goods or class of goods], or is not more than such percentage of the value of the imported materials used in the&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">7</span>[manufacture or processing of such goods or carrying out any operation on such goods or class of goods] as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify in this behalf :</p><p><strong>   Provided&nbsp;</strong>further that where any drawback has been allowed on any goods under this sub-section and the sale proceeds in respect of such goods are not received by or on behalf of the exporter in India within the time allowed under the&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">8</span>[Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 (42 of 1999)], such drawback shall&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">9</span>[except under such circumstances or such conditions as the Central Government may, by rule, specify,] be deemed never to have been allowed and the Central Government may, by <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000121/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000161/1000002" alt="rules made under sub-section (2)">rules made under sub-section (2)</a>, specify the procedure for the recovery or adjustment of the amount of such drawback.]</p><p><sup>   10</sup>[(1A) Where it appears to the Central Government that the quantity of a particular material imported into India is more than the total quantity of like material that has been used in the goods&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">11</span>[manufactured, processed or on which any operation has been carried out in India] and exported outside India, then, the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, declare that so much of the material as is contained in the goods exported shall, for the purpose of sub-section (1), be deemed to be imported material.]</p><p>   (2)  The Central Government <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000121/../../../content-page/explore-rules/1000161/1000002" alt="may make rules">may make rules</a> for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of sub-section (1) and, in particular, such rules may provide -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>    12   </sup>   [(a) for the payment of drawback equal to the amount of duty actually paid on the imported materials used in the manufacture or processing of the goods or carrying out any operation on the goods or as is specified in the rules as the average amount of duty paid on the materials of that class or description used in the manufacture or processing of export goods or carrying out any operation on export goods of that class or description either by manufacturers generally or by persons processing or carrying on any operation generally or by any particular manufacturer or particular person carrying on any process or other operation, and interest if any payable thereon;]  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>    13   </sup>   [(aa)  for specifying the goods in respect of which no drawback shall be allowed;]  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (ab) for specifying the procedure for recovery or adjustment of the amount of any drawback which had been allowed under sub-section (1)   <sup>    14   </sup>   [or interest chargeable thereon];  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) for the production of such certificates, documents and other evidence in support of each claim of drawback as may be necessary;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c) for requiring the   <sup>    15   </sup>   [manufacturer or the person carrying out any process or other operation] to give access to every part of his manufactory to any officer of customs specially authorised in this behalf by the   <sup>    16   </sup>   [Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs] to enable such authorised officer to inspect the processes of   <sup>    17   </sup>   [manufacture, process or any other operation carried out] and to verify by actual check or otherwise the statements made in support of the claim for drawback.  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>    18   </sup>   [(d) for the manner and the time within which the claim for payment of drawback may be filed;]  </p><p><sup>   19</sup>[(3) The power to make rules conferred by sub-section (2) shall include the power to give drawback with retrospective effect from a date not earlier than the date of changes in the rates of duty on inputs used in the export goods.]</p><p><br></p><div class="footnotes"><p>    1.  Section 75A

Data from Section 75A:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>   <sup>    1   </sup>   [Section 75A.  Interest on drawback. -   <br>  </strong></p><p>(1) Where any drawback payable to a claimant under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000122/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000120/1000002" alt="section 74">section 74</a> or <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000122/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000121/1000002" alt="section 75">section 75</a> is not paid within a<br></p><p><sup>   2</sup>[period of&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">3</span>[one month]] from the date of filing a claim for payment of such drawback, there shall be paid to that claimant in addition to the amount of drawback, interest at the rate fixed under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000122/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000045/1000002" alt="section 27A">section 27A</a> from the date after the expiry of the said&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">2</span>[period of&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">3</span>[one month]] till the date of payment of such drawback:&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">4</span>[***]&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">5</span></p><p>[(2) Where any drawback has been paid to the claimant erroneously or it becomes otherwise recoverable under this Act or the rules made thereunder, the claimant shall, within a period of two months from the date of demand, pay in addition to the said amount of drawback, interest at the rate fixed under&nbsp;<sup>6</sup>[<a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000122/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000048/1000002" alt="section 28AA">section 28AA</a>] and the amount of interest shall be calculated for the period beginning from the date of payment of such drawback to the claimant till the date of recovery of such drawback.]</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><div class="footnotes"><div>    1. Inserted by the Finance Act, 1995 (22 of 1995), section 62, (w.e.f. 26.05.1995).   </div><div><br>    2. Substituted by the Customs (Amendment) Act, 1998 (8 of 1999), section 2(a), for "period of three months" (w.e.f. 08.01.1999).   </div><div><br>    3. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2003 (32 of 2003), section 115(a), for "two months" (w.e.f. 14.05.2003).   </div><div><br>    4. Proviso omitted by the Finance Act, 2003 (32 of 2003)., section 115(b) (w.e.f. 14.05.2003).   </div><div><br>    5. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2007 (22 of 2007), section 98, for sub-section (2) (w.e.f. 11.05.2007). Earlier sub-section (2) was amended by Act 8 of 1999, section 2(b) (w.e.f. 08.01.1999). Sub-section (2), before substitution by Act 22 of 2007, stood as under:    <br>    "(2) Where any drawback has been paid to the claimant erroneously, the claimant shall, within a period of two months from the date of demand, pay in addition to the said amount of drawback, interest at the rate fixed under section 28AA from the date after the expiry of the said period of two months till the date of recovery of such drawback."   </div><div><br>    6. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2012 (23 of 2012), section 125, for "section 28AB" (w.e.f. 08.04.2011).    <br>   </div></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>   <sup>    1   </sup>   [Section 75A.  Interest on drawback. -   <br>  </strong></p><p>(1) Where any drawback payable to a claimant under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000122/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000120/1000002" alt="section 74">section 74</a> or <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000122/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000121/1000002" alt="section 75">section 75</a> is not paid within a<br></p><p><sup>   2</sup>[period of&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">3</span>[one month]] from the date of filing a claim for payment of such drawback, there shall be paid to that claimant in addition to the amount of drawback, interest at the rate fixed under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000122/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000045/1000002" alt="section 27A">section 27A</a> from the date after the expiry of the said&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">2</span>[period of&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">3</span>[one month]] till the date of payment of such drawback:&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">4</span>[***]&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 9.75px; vertical-align: super;">5</span></p><p>[(2) Where any drawback has been paid to the claimant erroneously or it becomes otherwise recoverable under this Act or the rules made thereunder, the claimant shall, within a period of two months from the date of demand, pay in addition to the said amount of drawback, interest at the rate fixed under&nbsp;<sup>6</sup>[<a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000122/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000048/1000002" alt="section 28AA">section 28AA</a>] and the amount of interest shall be calculated for the period beginning from the date of payment of such drawback to the claimant till the date of recovery of such drawback.]</p><p><br></p><p><br></p><div class="footnotes"><div>    1. Inserted by the Finance Act, 1995 (22 of 1995), section 62, (w.e.f. 26.05.1995).   </div><div><br>    2.  Section 76

Data from Section 76:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <b>
   Section 76.  Prohibition and regulation of drawback in certain cases. -
   <br>
  </b>
  <br>
  (1) Notwithstanding anything herein before contained, no drawback shall be allowed -
  <br>
  <br>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   <sup>
    1
   </sup>
   [***]
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (b)  in respect of any goods the market-price of which is less than the amount of drawback due thereon;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (c)  where the drawback due in respect of any goods is less than
   <sup>
    2
   </sup>
   [fifty rupees].
  </p>
  (2)  Without prejudice to the provisions of sub-section (1), if the Central Government is of opinion that goods of any specified description in respect of which drawback may be claimed under this Chapter are likely to be smuggled back into India, it may, by notification in the Official Gazette, direct that drawback shall not be allowed in respect of such goods or may be allowed subject to such restrictions and conditions as may be specified in the notification.
  <br>
  <br>
  <div class="footnotes">
   1. Clause (a) omitted by the Finance Act, 1983 (11 of 1983), section 53(a) (w.e.f. 13.05.1983).
   <br>
   <br>
   2. Substituted by the Finance Act, 1983 (11 of 1983), section 53(b), for "five rupees" (w.e.f. 13.05.1983).
  </div>
 
</span>

 Section 78

Determination of rate of duty and tariff valuation in respect of baggage. -   </strong></p><p>   The rate of duty and tariff valuation, if any, applicable to baggage shall be the rate and valuation in force on the date on which a declaration is made in respect of such baggage under<a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000125/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000124/1000002" alt=" section 77"> section 77</a>.   <br>  </p><p></p></span>

 Section 79

Data from Section 79:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <strong>
    <i>
     Baggage:
    </i>
   </strong>
   <b>
   </b>
  </p>
  <p>
   <strong>
    Section 79. Bona fide baggage exempted from duty. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p>
   (1) The proper officer may, subject to any rules made under sub-section (2), pass free of duty -
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (a)   any article in the baggage of a passenger or a member of the crew in respect of which the said officer is satisfied that it has been in his use for such minimum period as may be specified in the rules;
   <br>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (b)   any article in the baggage of a passenger in respect of which the said officer is satisfied that it is for the use of the passenger or his family or is a bona fide gift or souvenir; provided that the value of each such article and the total value of all such articles does not exceed such limits as may be specified in the rules.
  </p>
  <p>
   (2)   the Central Government may make rules for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of this section and, in particular, such rules may specify -
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (a)   the minimum period for which any article has been used by a passenger or a member of the crew for the purpose of clause (a) of sub-section (1);
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (b)   the maximum value of any individual article and the maximum total value of all the articles which may be passed free of duty under clause (b) of sub-section (1);
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (c)   the conditions (to be fulfilled before or after clearance) subject to which any baggage may be passed free of duty.
  </p>
  <p>
   (3)   Different rules may be made under sub-section (2) for different classes of persons.
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <strong>
    <i>
     Baggage:
    </i>
   </strong>
   <b>
   </b>
  </p>

  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">

   <br>
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (b)   any article in the baggage of a passenger in respect of which the said officer is satisfied that it is for the use of the passenger or his family or is a bona fide gift or souvenir; provided that the value of each such article and the total value of all such articles does not exceed such limits as may be specified in the rules.
  </p>
  <p>
   (2)   the Central Government may make rules for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of this section and, in particular, such rules may specify -
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">

  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">

  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">

 Section 80

Data from Section 80:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    <em>     Baggage:    </em></strong></p><p><strong>    Section 80. Temporary detention of baggage. -   </strong></p><p>   Where the baggage of a passenger contains any article which is dutiable or the import of which is prohibited and in respect of which a true declaration has been made under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000127/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000124/1000002" alt="section 77">section 77</a>, the proper officer may, at the request of the passenger, detain such article for the purpose of being returned to him on his leaving India   <sup>    1   </sup>   [and if for any reason, the passenger is not able to collect the article at the time of his leaving India, the article may be returned to him through any other passenger authorised by him and leaving India or as cargo consigned in his name].  </p><div class="footnotes"><p>    1.                     Inserted by the Finance Act, 1995 (22 of 1995), section 63 (w.e.f. 26.05.1995).   </p></div></span>

 Section 83

Data from Section 83:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <i>
    <b>
     Goods imported or exported by post:
    </b>
   </i>
   <b>
   </b>
   <br>
  </p>
  <p>
   <strong>
    Section 83.  Rate of duty and tariff valuation in respect of goods imported or exported by
    <sup>
     1
    </sup>
    [post or courier]. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p>
   (1) The rate of duty and tariff value, if any, applicable to any goods imported by
   <sup>
    1
   </sup>
   [post or courier] shall be the rate and valuation in force on the date on which the
   <sup>
    2
   </sup>
   [postal authorities or the courier authorities] present to the proper officer a list containing the particulars of such goods for the purpose of assessing the duty thereon :
  </p>
  <p>
   <b>
    Provided
   </b>
   that if such goods are imported by a vessel and the list of the goods containing the particulars was presented before the date of the arrival of the vessel, it shall be deemed to have been presented on the date of such arrival.
   <br>
  </p>
  <p>
   (2)   The rate of duty and tariff value, if any, applicable to any goods exported by
   <sup>
    1
   </sup>
   [post or courier] shall be the rate and valuation in force on the date on which the exporter delivers such goods to the
   <sup>
    2
   </sup>
   [postal authorities or the courier authorities] for exportation.
  </p>
  <div class="footnotes">
   <p>
    1.  Substituted by section 88 (w.e.f. 29.03.2018),  by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), for "post".
   </p>
   <p>
    2.  Substituted by section 88 (w.e.f. 29.03.2018),  by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), for "postal authorities".
   </p>
  </div>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <i>

Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><em>    <strong>     Goods imported or exported by post:    </strong></em></p><p><strong>    Section 84.  Regulations regarding goods imported or to be exported by    <sup>     1    </sup>    [post or courier]. -   </strong></p><p>   The Board <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000131/../../../content-page/explore-regulations/1000031" alt="may make regulations">may make regulations</a> providing for -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>    2   </sup>   [(a) the form and manner in which an entry may be made in respect of goods imported or to be exported by   <sup>    1   </sup>   [post or courier];]  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)   the examination, assessment to duty, and clearance of goods imported or to be exported by   <sup>    1   </sup>   [post or courier];  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)   the transit or transhipment of goods imported by   <sup>    1   </sup>   [post or courier], from one customs station to another or to a place outside India.  </p><div class="footnotes">   1. Substituted by section 89 (w.e.f. 29.03.2018),  by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), for "post".   <p></p><p>    2. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2017 (7 of 2017), section 105, for clause (a) (w.e.f. 31.3.2017). Clause (a), before substitution, stood as under:   </p><p>    "(a) the form and manner in which an entry may be made in respect of any specified class of goods imported or to be exported by post, other than goods which are accompanied by a label or declaration containing the description, quantity and value thereof;"   </p><p></p></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><em>    <strong>     Goods imported or exported by post:    </strong></em></p><p><strong>    Section 84.  Regulations regarding goods imported or to be exported by    <sup>     1    </sup>    [post or courier]. -   </strong></p><p>   The Board <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000131/../../../content-page/explore-regulations/1000031" alt="may make regulations">may make regulations</a> providing for -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><sup>    2   </sup>   [(a) the form and manner in which an entry may be made in respect of goods imported or to be exported by   <sup>    1   </sup>   [post or courier];]  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)   the examination, assessment to duty, and clearance of goods imported or to be exported by   <sup>    1   </sup>   [post or courier];  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)   the transit or transhipment of goods imported by   <sup>    1   </sup>   [post or courier], from one customs station to another or to a place outside India.  </p><div class="footnotes">   1. Substituted by section 89 (w.e.f. 29.03.2018),  by Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018), for "post".   <p></p><p>    2. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2017 (7 of 2017), section 105, for clause (a) (w.e.f. 31.3.2017). Clause (a), before substitution, stood as under:   </p><p>    "(a) the form and manner in which an entry may be made in respect of any specified class of goods imported or to be exported by post, other than goods which are accompanied by a label or declaration containing the description, quantity and value thereof;"   </p><p></p></div></span>



 Section 85

Data from Section 85:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <i>
    <b>
     Stores:
    </b>
   </i>
  </p>
  <p>
   <strong>
    Section 85.  Stores may be allowed to be warehoused without assessment to duty. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p>
   Where any imported goods are entered for warehousing and the importer makes and subscribes to a declaration that the goods are to be supplied as stores to vessels or aircrafts without payment of import duty under this Chapter, the proper officer may permit the goods to be warehoused without the goods being assessed to duty.
   <br>
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
 
</span>

<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">

    Section 85.  Stores may be allowed to be warehoused without assessment to duty. -

  </p>

 Section 86

Data from Section 86:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><em>    <strong>     Stores:    </strong></em></p><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    86.   Transit and transhipment of stores. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) Any stores imported in a vessel or aircraft may, without payment of duty, remain on board such vessel or aircraft while it is in India.  </p><p>   (2)  Any stores imported in a vessel or aircraft may, with the permission of the proper officer, be transferred to any vessel or aircraft as stores for consumption therein as provided in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000133/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000134/1000002" alt="section 87">section 87</a> or <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000133/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000137/1000002" alt="section 90">section 90</a>.  </p><p></p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><em>    <strong>     Stores:    </strong></em></p><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    86.   Transit and transhipment of stores. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) Any stores imported in a vessel or aircraft may, without payment of duty, remain on board such vessel or aircraft while it is in India.  </p><p>   (2)  Any stores imported in a vessel or aircraft may, with the permission of the proper officer, be transferred to any vessel or aircraft as stores for consumption therein as provided in <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000133/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000134/1000002" alt="section 87">section 87</a> or <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000133/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000137/1000002" alt="section 90">section 90</a>.  </p><p></p></span>

 Section 88

Data from Section 88:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><em>    <strong>     Stores:    </strong></em><br>  </p><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    88.  Application of section 69 and Chapter X to stores. -   </strong></p><p>   The provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000135/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000114/1000002" alt="section 69">section 69</a> and Chapter X shall apply to stores (other than those to which <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000135/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000137/1000002" alt="section 90">section 90</a> applies) as they apply to other goods, subject to the modifications that -  </p><p>   (a)   for the words "exported to any place outside India" or the word" exported", wherever they occur, the words "taken on board any foreign-going vessel or aircraft as stores" shall be substituted.  </p><p>   (b)   in the case of drawback on fuel and lubricating oil taken on board any foreign-going aircraft as stores, sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000135/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000120/1000002" alt="section 74">section 74</a> shall have effect as if for the words "ninety-eight per cent", the words "the whole" were substituted.  </p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><em>    <strong>     Stores:    </strong></em><br>  </p><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    88.  Application of section 69 and Chapter X to stores. -   </strong></p><p>   The provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000135/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000114/1000002" alt="section 69">section 69</a> and Chapter X shall apply to stores (other than those to which <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000135/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000137/1000002" alt="section 90">section 90</a> applies) as they apply to other goods, subject to the modifications that -  </p><p>   (a)   for the words "exported to any place outside India" or the word" exported", wherever they occur, the words "taken on board any foreign-going vessel or aircraft as stores" shall be substituted.  </p><p>   (b)   in the case of drawback on fuel and lubricating oil taken on board any foreign-going aircraft as stores, sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000135/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000120/1000002" alt="section 74">section 74</a> shall have effect as if for the words "ninety-eight per cent", the words "the whole" were substituted.  </p></span>



 Section 89

Data from Section 89:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <i>
    <b>
     Stores:
    </b>
   </i>
  </p>
  <p>
   <b>
    Section
   </b>
   <strong>
    89.  Stores to be free of export duty. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p>
   Goods produced or manufactured in India and required as stores on any foreign-going vessel or aircraft may be exported free of duty in such quantities as the proper officer may determine, having regard to the size of the vessel or aircraft, the number of passengers and crew and the length of the voyage or journey on which the vessel or aircraft is about to depart.
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <i>
    <b>
     Stores:
    </b>
   </i>
  </p>
  <p>
   <b>
    Section
   </b>
   <strong>
    89.  Stores to be free of export duty. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p>
   Goods produced or manufactured in India and required as stores on any foreign-going vessel or aircraft may be exported free of duty in such quantities as the proper officer may determine, having regard to the size of the vessel or aircraft, the number of passengers and crew and the length of the voyage or journey on which the vessel or aircraft is about to depart.
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>

 Section 90

Data from Section 90:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><em>    <strong>     Stores:    </strong></em></p><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    90. Concessions in respect of imported stores for the Navy. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) Imported stores specified in sub-section (3) may without payment of duty be consumed on board a ship of the Indian Navy.  </p><p>   (2)   The provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000137/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000114/1000002" alt="section 69">section 69</a> and Chapter X shall apply to stores specified in sub-section (3) as they apply to other goods, subject to the modifications that -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)   for the words "exported to any place outside India" or the word "exported" wherever they occur, the words "taken on board a ship of the Indian Navy" shall be substituted;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)   or the words "ninety-eight per cent" in sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000137/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000120/1000002" alt="section 74">section 74</a>, the words "the whole" shall be substituted.  </p><p>   (3)   The stores referred to in sub-sections (1) and (2) are the following : -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)   stores for the use of a ship of the Indian Navy;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)   stores supplied free by the Government for the use of the crew of a ship of the Indian Navy in accordance with their conditions of service.  </p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><em>    <strong>     Stores:    </strong></em></p><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    90. Concessions in respect of imported stores for the Navy. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) Imported stores specified in sub-section (3) may without payment of duty be consumed on board a ship of the Indian Navy.  </p><p>   (2)   The provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000137/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000114/1000002" alt="section 69">section 69</a> and Chapter X shall apply to stores specified in sub-section (3) as they apply to other goods, subject to the modifications that -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)   for the words "exported to any place outside India" or the word "exported" wherever they occur, the words "taken on board a ship of the Indian Navy" shall be substituted;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)   or the words "ninety-eight per cent" in sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000137/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000120/1000002" alt="section 74">section 74</a>, the words "the whole" shall be substituted.  </p><p>   (3)   The stores referred to in sub-sections (1) and (2) are the following : -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)   stores for the use of a ship of the Indian Navy;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)   stores supplied free by the Government for the use of the crew of a ship of the Indian Navy in accordance with their conditions of service.  </p></span>

 Section 92

   <b>
    Section
   </b>
   <strong>
    92. Entry of coastal goods.
   </strong>
   -
  </p>
  <p>
   (1) The consignor of any coastal goods shall make an entry thereof by presenting to the proper officer a bill of coastal goods in the prescribed form.
  </p>
  <p>
   (2)  Every such consignor while presenting a bill of coastal goods shall, at the foot thereof, make and subscribe to a declaration as to the truth of the contents of such bill.
  </p>

  </p>

 Section 94

Data from Section 94:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    94.  Clearance of coastal goods at destination.   </strong>   -  </p><p>   (1) The master of a vessel carrying any coastal goods shall carry on board the vessel all bills relating to such goods delivered to him under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000141/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000140/1000002" alt="section 93">section 93</a> and shall, immediately on arrival of the vessel at any customs or coastal port, deliver to the proper officer of that port all bills relating to the goods which are to be unloaded at that port.  </p><p>   (2) Where any coastal goods are unloaded at any port, the proper officer shall permit clearance thereof if he is satisfied that they are entered in a bill of coastal goods delivered to him under sub-section (1).  </p><p></p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    94.  Clearance of coastal goods at destination.   </strong>   -  </p><p>   (1) The master of a vessel carrying any coastal goods shall carry on board the vessel all bills relating to such goods delivered to him under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000141/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000140/1000002" alt="section 93">section 93</a> and shall, immediately on arrival of the vessel at any customs or coastal port, deliver to the proper officer of that port all bills relating to the goods which are to be unloaded at that port.  </p><p>   (2) Where any coastal goods are unloaded at any port, the proper officer shall permit clearance thereof if he is satisfied that they are entered in a bill of coastal goods delivered to him under sub-section (1).  </p><p></p></span>



 Section 95

Data from Section 95:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <b>
    Section
   </b>
   <strong>
    95.  Master of a coasting vessel to carry an advice book.
   </strong>
   -
  </p>
  <p>
   (1) The master of every vessel carrying coastal goods shall be supplied by the Customs authorities with a book to be called the"advice book".
  </p>
  <p>
   (2)The proper officer at each port of call by such vessel shall make such entries in the advice book as he deems fit, relating to the goods loaded on the vessel at that port.
  </p>
  <p>
   (3)The master of every such vessel shall carry the advice book on board the vessel and shall on arrival at each port of call deliver it to the proper officer at that port for his inspection.
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <b>
    Section
   </b>
   <strong>
    95.  Master of a coasting vessel to carry an advice book.
   </strong>
   -
  </p>
  <p>
   (1) The master of every vessel carrying coastal goods shall be supplied by the Customs authorities with a book to be called the"advice book".
  </p>
  <p>
   (2)The proper officer at each port of call by such vessel shall make such entries in the advice book as he deems fit, relating to the goods loaded on the vessel at that port.
  </p>
  <p>
   (3)The master of every such vessel shall carry the advice book on board the vessel and shall on arrival at each port of call deliver it to the proper officer at that port for his inspection.
  </p>
  <p>
  </p>
 
</span>



 Section 96

 Section 97

Data from Section 97:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    97. No coasting vessel to leave without written order.   </strong>   -  </p><p>   (1) The master of a vessel which has brought or loaded any coastal goods at a customs or coastal port shall not cause or permit the vessel to depart from such port until a written order to that effect has been given by the proper officer.  </p><p>   (2) No such order shall be given until -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) the master of the vessel has answered the questions put to him under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000144/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000077/1000002" alt="section 38">section 38</a>;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) all charges and penalties due in respect of that vessel or from the master thereof have been paid or the payment secured by such guarantee or deposit of such amount as the proper officer may direct;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c) the master of the vessel has satisfied the proper officer that no penalty is leviable on him under section 116 or the payment of any penalty that may be levied upon him under that section has been secured by such guarantee or deposit of such amount as the proper officer may direct;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (d) the provisions of this Chapter and any rules and regulations relating to coastal goods and vessels carrying coastal goods have been complied with.  </p><p></p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    97. No coasting vessel to leave without written order.   </strong>   -  </p><p>   (1) The master of a vessel which has brought or loaded any coastal goods at a customs or coastal port shall not cause or permit the vessel to depart from such port until a written order to that effect has been given by the proper officer.  </p><p>   (2) No such order shall be given until -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a) the master of the vessel has answered the questions put to him under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000144/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000077/1000002" alt="section 38">section 38</a>;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b) all charges and penalties due in respect of that vessel or from the master thereof have been paid or the payment secured by such guarantee or deposit of such amount as the proper officer may direct;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c) the master of the vessel has satisfied the proper officer that no penalty is leviable on him under section 116 or the payment of any penalty that may be levied upon him under that section has been secured by such guarantee or deposit of such amount as the proper officer may direct;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (d) the provisions of this Chapter and any rules and regulations relating to coastal goods and vessels carrying coastal goods have been complied with.  </p><p></p></span>



 Section 98

Data from Section 98:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    98.  Application of certain provisions of this Act to coastal goods, etc.   </strong>   -  </p><p>   (1) <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000072/1000002" alt="Sections 33">Sections 33</a>, <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000073/1000002" alt="34">34</a> and <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000075/1000002" alt="36">36</a> shall, so far as may be, apply to coastal goods as they apply to imported goods or export goods.  </p><p>   (2) <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000076/1000002" alt="Sections 37">Sections 37</a> and <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000077/1000002" alt="38">38</a> shall, so far as may be, apply to vessels carrying coastal goods as they apply to vessels carrying imported goods or export goods.  </p><p>   (3) The Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, direct that all or any of the other provisions of Chapter VI and the provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000085/1000002" alt="section 45">section 45</a> shall apply to coastal goods or vessels carrying coastal goods subject to such exceptions and modifications as may be specified in the notification.  </p><p></p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section   </strong><strong>    98.  Application of certain provisions of this Act to coastal goods, etc.   </strong>   -  </p><p>   (1) <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000072/1000002" alt="Sections 33">Sections 33</a>, <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000073/1000002" alt="34">34</a> and <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000075/1000002" alt="36">36</a> shall, so far as may be, apply to coastal goods as they apply to imported goods or export goods.  </p><p>   (2) <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000076/1000002" alt="Sections 37">Sections 37</a> and <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000077/1000002" alt="38">38</a> shall, so far as may be, apply to vessels carrying coastal goods as they apply to vessels carrying imported goods or export goods.  </p><p>   (3) The Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, direct that all or any of the other provisions of Chapter VI and the provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000145/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000085/1000002" alt="section 45">section 45</a> shall apply to coastal goods or vessels carrying coastal goods subject to such exceptions and modifications as may be specified in the notification.  </p><p></p></span>

 Section 99

Data from Section 99:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <b>
    Section
   </b>
   <strong>
    99.
   </strong>
   <strong>
    Power to make rules in respect of coastal goods and coasting vessels. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p>
   The Central Government may make rules for -
  </p>
  <p>
   (a) preventing the taking out of India of any coastal goods the export of which is dutiable or prohibited under this Act or any other law for the time being in force;
  </p>
  <div>
   <p>
    (b) preventing, in the case of a vessel carrying coastal goods as well as imported or export goods, the substitution of imported or export goods by coastal goods.
   </p>
  </div>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <b>
    Section
   </b>
   <strong>
    99.
   </strong>
   <strong>
    Power to make rules in respect of coastal goods and coasting vessels. -
   </strong>
  </p>
  <p>
   The Central Government may make rules for -
  </p>
  <p>
   (a) preventing the taking out of India of any coastal goods the export of which is dutiable or prohibited under this Act or any other law for the time being in force;
  </p>
  <div>
   <p>
    (b) preventing, in the case of a vessel carrying coastal goods as well as imported or export goods, the substitution of imported or export goods by coastal goods.
   </p>
  </div>
 
</span>

 Section 99A

 Section 99B

Data from Section 99B:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <div class="content">
   <p>
    <b>
     Section 99B
    </b>
    <b>
     . Verification of identity and compliance thereof. -
    </b>
   </p>
   <p>
    (1) The proper officer, authorised in this behalf by the Principal Commissioner of Customs or the Commissioner of Customs, as the case may be, may, for the purposes of ascertaining compliance of the provisions of this Act or any other law for the time being in force, require a person, whose verification he considers necessary for protecting the interest of revenue or for preventing smuggling, to do all or any of the following, namely:-
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (a) undergo authentication, or furnish proof of possession of Aadhaar number, in such manner and within such time as may be prescribed;
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (b) submit such other document or information, in such manner and within such time as may be prescribed:
   </p>
   <b>
    Provided
   </b>
   that where such person has not been assigned the Aadhaar number, or where so assigned, but authentication of such person has failed due to technical reasons or for reasons beyond his control, then, he shall be provided an opportunity to furnish such other alternative and viable means of identification in such form and manner and within such time as may be prescribed.
   <p>
    (2) The provisions of sub-section (1) shall not apply to such person or class of persons as may be prescribed.
   </p>
   <p>
    (3) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other provisions of this Act, where the Principal Commissioner of Customs or the Commissioner of Customs comes to the conclusion, based on reasons to be recorded in writing, that the person referred to in sub-section (1) has-
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (i) failed to comply with the requirements of the said sub-section or submitted incorrect documents or information under the said sub-section, he may, by order, suspend-
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 80px;">
    (a) clearance of imported goods or export goods;
   </p>
  </div>
  <p style="padding-left: 80px;">
   (b) sanction of refund;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 80px;">
   (c) sanction of drawback;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 80px;">
   (d) exemption from duty;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 80px;">
   (e) licence or registration granted under this Act; or
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 80px;">
   (f) any benefit, monetary or otherwise, arising out of import or export, relating to such person, subject to such conditions as may be prescribed;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (ii) failed authentication as required under the said sub-section, he may, by order, direct that such person shall not have the benefit of any of the items specified in sub-clauses (a) to (f) of clause (i).
  </p>
  <p>
   (4) The order of suspension under sub-section (3) shall remain in force until the person concerned complies with the requirements of sub-section (1) or furnishes correct document or information thereunder.
  </p>
  <b style="">
   Explanation
  </b>
  .- For the purposes of this section, the expression "Aadhaar number" shall have the same meaning as assigned to it in clause (a) of section 2 of the Aadhaar (Targeted Delivery of Financial and Other Subsidies, Benefits and Services) Act, 2016.]
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <div class="content">

   </p>

   </p>
   <b>
    Provided
   </b>
   that where such person has not been assigned the Aadhaar number, or where so assigned, but authentication of such person has failed due to technical reasons or for reasons beyond his control, then, he shall be provided an opportunity to furnish such other alternative and viable means of identification in such form and manner and within such time as may be prescribed.
   <p>
    (2) The provisions of sub-section (1) shall not apply to such person or class of persons as may be prescribed.
   </p>
   <p>
    (3) Notwithstanding anything contained in any other provisions of this Act, where the Principal Commissioner of Customs or the Commissioner of Customs comes to the conclusion, based on reasons to be recorded in writing, that the person referred to in sub-section (1) has-
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
    (i) failed to comply with the requirements of the said sub-section or submitted incorrect documents or information under the said sub-section, he may, by order, suspend-
   </p>
   <p style="padding-left: 80px;">
    (a) clearance of imported goods or export goods;
   </p>

  </p>

 Section 100

Data from Section 100:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <b>
    Section 100.  Power to search suspected persons entering or leaving India, etc. -
    <br>
   </b>
  </p>
  <p>
   (1) If the proper officer has reason to believe that any person to whom this section applies has secreted about his person, any goods liable to confiscation or any documents relating thereto, he may search that person.
  </p>
  <p>
   (2)This section applies to the following persons, namely: -
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (a) any person who has landed from or is about to board, or is on board any vessel within the Indian customs waters;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (b) any person who has landed from or is about to board, or is on board a foreign-going aircraft;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (c) any person who has got out of, or is about to get into, or is in, a vehicle, which has arrived from, or is to proceed to any place outside India;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (d) any person not included in clauses (a), (b) or (c) who has entered or is about to leave India;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (e) any person in a customs area.
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <b>
    Section 100.  Power to search suspected persons entering or leaving India, etc. -
    <br>
   </b>
  </p>
  <p>
   (1) If the proper officer has reason to believe that any person to whom this section applies has secreted about his person, any goods liable to confiscation or any documents relating thereto, he may search that person.
  </p>
  <p>
   (2)This section applies to the following persons, namely: -
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (a) any person who has landed from or is about to board, or is on board any vessel within the Indian customs waters;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (b) any person who has landed from or is about to board, or is on board a foreign-going aircraft;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (c) any person who has got out of, or is about to get into, or is in, a vehicle, which has arrived from, or is to proceed to any place outside India;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (d) any person not included in clauses (a), (b) or (c) who has entered or is about to leave India;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (e) any person in a customs area.
  </p>
 
</span>



 Section 101

Data from Section 101:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 101.  Power to search suspected persons in certain other cases. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) Without prejudice to the provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000151/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000150/1000002" alt="section 100">section 100</a>, if an officer of customs empowered in this behalf by general or special order of the   <sup>    1   </sup>   [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs], has reason to believe that any person has secreted about his person any goods of the description specified in sub-section (2) which are liable to confiscation, or documents relating thereto, he may search that person.  </p><p>   (2)  The goods referred to in sub-section (1) are the following : -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)  gold;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)  diamonds;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)  manufactures of gold or diamonds;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (d)  watches;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (e)  any other class of goods which the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify.  </p><div class="footnotes">   1. Substituted by the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), section 78, for "Commissioner of Customs" (w.e.f. 06.08.2014). Earlier the words "Commissioner of Customs" were substituted by Act 22 of 1995, section 50, for the words "Collector of Customs" (w.e.f. 26.05.1995).  </div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 101.  Power to search suspected persons in certain other cases. -   </strong></p><p>   (1) Without prejudice to the provisions of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000151/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000150/1000002" alt="section 100">section 100</a>, if an officer of customs empowered in this behalf by general or special order of the   <sup>    1   </sup>   [Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs], has reason to believe that any person has secreted about his person any goods of the description specified in sub-section (2) which are liable to confiscation, or documents relating thereto, he may search that person.  </p><p>   (2)  The goods referred to in sub-section (1) are the following : -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)  gold;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)  diamonds;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)  manufactures of gold or diamonds;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (d)  watches;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (e)  any other class of goods which the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, specify.  </p><div class="footnotes">   1. Substituted by the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), section 78, for "Commissioner of Customs" (w.e.f. 06.08.2014).
