 Section 114AC

Data from Section 114AC:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    <span style="font-size: 13.3333px;">     <sup>      1     </sup></span>    [Section 114AC. Penalty for fraudulent utilisation of input tax credit for claiming refund. -</strong></p><p>   Where any person has obtained any invoice by fraud, collusion, willful misstatement or suppression of facts to      utilise input tax credit on the basis of such invoice for discharging any duty or tax on goods that are entered      for exportation under claim of refund of such duty or tax, such person shall be liable for penalty not exceeding      five times the refund claimed.</p><p><strong>    Explanation   </strong>   .-For the purposes of this section, the expression"input tax credit" shall have the same      meaning as assigned to it in clause (63) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000173/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000271/1000001" alt="section 2">section 2</a> of the Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017 (12 of      2017).]  </p><p><br></p><div class="footnotes"><p>    1. Inserted (w.e.f. 28-03-2021) s. 96 of Finance Act 2021 (13 of 2021)   </p></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    <span style="font-size: 13.3333px;">     <sup>      1     </sup></span>    [Section 114AC. Penalty for fraudulent utilisation of input tax credit for claiming refund. -</strong></p><p>   Where any person has obtained any invoice by fraud, collusion, willful misstatement or suppression of facts to      utilise input tax credit on the basis of such invoice for discharging any duty or tax on goods that are entered      for exportation under claim of refund of such duty or tax, such person shall be liable for penalty not exceeding      five times the refund claimed.</p><p><strong>    Explanation   </strong>   .-For the purposes of this section, the expression"input tax credit" shall have the same      meaning as assigned to it in clause (63) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000173/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000271/1000001" alt="section 2">section 2</a> of the Central Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017 (12 of      2017).]  </p><p><br></p><div class="footnotes"><p>    1. Inserted (w.e.f. 28-03-2021) s. 96 of Finance Act 2021 (13 of 2021)   </p></div></span>



 Section 115

Data from Section 115:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 115.  Confiscation of conveyances.-    <br>   </strong></p><p>   (1) The following conveyances shall be liable to confiscation :-  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)  any vessel which is or has been within the Indian customs waters, any aircraft which is or has been in      India, or any vehicle which is or has been in a customs area, while constructed, adapted, altered or fitted in any      manner for the purpose of concealing goods;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)  any conveyance from which the whole or any part of the goods is thrown overboard, staved or destroyed so      as to prevent seizure by an officer of customs;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)  any conveyance which having been required to stop or land under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000174/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000156/1000002" alt="section 106">section 106</a> fails to do so, except for      good and sufficient cause;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (d)  any conveyance from which any warehoused goods cleared for exportation, or any other goods cleared for      exportation under a claim for drawback, are unloaded, without the permission of the proper officer;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><br>   (e)  any conveyance carrying imported goods which has entered India and is afterwards found with the whole or      substantial portion of such goods missing, unless the master of the vessel or aircraft is able to account for the      loss of, or deficiency in, the goods.  </p><p><br>   (2)  Any conveyance or animal used as a means of transport in the smuggling of any goods or in the carriage      of any smuggled goods shall be liable to confiscation, unless the owner of the conveyance or animal proves that it      was so used without the knowledge or connivance of the owner himself, his agent, if any, and the person in charge      of the conveyance or animal   <sup>    1   </sup>   [***]:  </p><p><br>   <strong>    Provided   </strong>   that where any such conveyance is used for the carriage of goods or passengers for hire, the owner      of any conveyance shall be given an option to pay in lieu of the confiscation of the conveyance a fine not      exceeding the market price of the goods which are sought to be smuggled or the smuggled goods, as the case may be.   <br>   <br>   <strong>    Explanation   </strong>   . - In this section,"market price" means market price at the date when the goods are seized.  </p><div class="footnotes"><br>   1. Certain words omitted by the Finance Act, 1988 (26 of 1988), section 79 (w.e.f.13.05.1988).  </div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 115.  Confiscation of conveyances.-    <br>   </strong></p><p>   (1) The following conveyances shall be liable to confiscation :-  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)  any vessel which is or has been within the Indian customs waters, any aircraft which is or has been in      India, or any vehicle which is or has been in a customs area, while constructed, adapted, altered or fitted in any      manner for the purpose of concealing goods;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)  any conveyance from which the whole or any part of the goods is thrown overboard, staved or destroyed so      as to prevent seizure by an officer of customs;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)  any conveyance which having been required to stop or land under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000174/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000156/1000002" alt="section 106">section 106</a> fails to do so, except for      good and sufficient cause;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (d)  any conveyance from which any warehoused goods cleared for exportation, or any other goods cleared for      exportation under a claim for drawback, are unloaded, without the permission of the proper officer;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;"><br>   (e)  any conveyance carrying imported goods which has entered India and is afterwards found with the whole or      substantial portion of such goods missing, unless the master of the vessel or aircraft is able to account for the      loss of, or deficiency in, the goods.  </p><p><br>   (2)  Any conveyance or animal used as a means of transport in the smuggling of any goods or in the carriage      of any smuggled goods shall be liable to confiscation, unless the owner of the conveyance or animal proves that it      was so used without the knowledge or connivance of the owner himself, his agent, if any, and the person in charge      of the conveyance or animal   <sup>    1   </sup>   [***]:  </p><p><br>   <strong>    Provided   </strong>   that where any such conveyance is used for the carriage of goods or passengers for hire, the owner      of any conveyance shall be given an option to pay in lieu of the confiscation of the conveyance a fine not      exceeding the market price of the goods which are sought to be smuggled or the smuggled goods, as the case may be.   <br>   <br>   <strong>    Explanation   </strong>   . - In this section,"market price" means market price at the date when the goods are seized.  </p><div class="footnotes"><br>   1. Certain words omitted by the Finance Act, 1988 (26 of 1988), section 79 (w.e.f.13.05.1988).  </div></span>



 Section 116

Data from Section 116:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="content"><strong>    Section 116.  Penalty for not accounting for goods.-    <br></strong><br></div><div id="content">If any goods loaded in a conveyance for importation into India, or any goods transhipped under the provisions of    this Act or coastal goods carried in a conveyance, are not unloaded at their place of destination in India, or if    the quantity unloaded is short of the quantity to be unloaded at that destination, and if the failure to unload or    the deficiency is not accounted for to the satisfaction of the   <sup>    1   </sup>   [Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs], the person-in-charge of the    conveyance shall be liable, -</div><div id="content"><br><p>    (a)  in the case of goods loaded in a conveyance for importation into India or goods transhipped under the      provisions of this Act, to a penalty not exceeding twice the amount of duty that would have been chargeable on the      goods not unloaded or the deficient goods, as the case may be, had such goods been imported;</p><p>    (b)  in the case of coastal goods, to a penalty not exceeding twice the amount of export duty that would have      been chargeable on the goods not unloaded or the deficient goods, as the case may be, had such goods been      exported.   </p><div class="footnotes">    1. Substituted by the Finance Act, 1999 (27 of 1999), section 100, for "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" (w.e.f.      11.05.1999). Earlier the words "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" were substituted by Act 22 of 1995, section 50,      for the words "Assistant Collector of Customs" (w.e.f. 26.05.1995).   </div></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="content"><strong>    Section 116.  Penalty for not accounting for goods.-    <br></strong><br></div><div id="content">If any goods loaded in a conveyance for importation into India, or any goods transhipped under the provisions of    this Act or coastal goods carried in a conveyance, are not unloaded at their place of destination in India, or if    the quantity unloaded is short of the quantity to be unloaded at that destination, and if the failure to unload or    the deficiency is not accounted for to the satisfaction of the   <sup>    1   </sup>   [Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs], the person-in-charge of the    conveyance shall be liable, -</div><div id="content"><br><p>    (a)  in the case of goods loaded in a conveyance for importation into India or goods transhipped under the      provisions of this Act, to a penalty not exceeding twice the amount of duty that would have been chargeable on the      goods not unloaded or the deficient goods, as the case may be, had such goods been imported;</p><p>    (b)  in the case of coastal goods, to a penalty not exceeding twice the amount of export duty that would have      been chargeable on the goods not unloaded or the deficient goods, as the case may be, had such goods been      exported.   </p><div class="footnotes">    1. Substituted by the Finance Act, 1999 (27 of 1999), section 100, for "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" (w.e.f.      11.05.1999). Earlier the words "Assistant Commissioner of Customs" were substituted by Act 22 of 1995, section 50,      for the words "Assistant Collector of Customs" (w.e.f. 26.05.1995).   </div></div></span>



 Section 117

 Section 118

Data from Section 118:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="content"><strong>    Section 118.  Confiscation of packages and their contents. -    <br></strong><br>   (a) Where any goods imported in a package are liable to confiscation, the package and any other goods imported in    that package shall also be liable to confiscation.   <p><br>    (b) Where any goods are brought in a package withinthe limits of a customs area for the purpose of exportation and      are liable to confiscation, the package and any other goods contained therein shall also be liable to      confiscation.    <br>    <br>   </p></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="content"><strong>    Section 118.  Confiscation of packages and their contents. -    <br></strong><br>   (a) Where any goods imported in a package are liable to confiscation, the package and any other goods imported in    that package shall also be liable to confiscation.   <p><br>    (b) Where any goods are brought in a package withinthe limits of a customs area for the purpose of exportation and      are liable to confiscation, the package and any other goods contained therein shall also be liable to      confiscation.    <br>    <br>   </p></div></span>

 Section 120

Data from Section 120:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="content"><strong>    Section 120. Confiscation of smuggled goods notwithstanding any change in form, etc. -   </strong><br><br>   (1)   Smuggled goods may be confiscated notwithstanding any change in their form.<p>    (2)   Where smuggled goods are mixed with other goods in such manner that the smuggled goods cannot be      separated from such other goods, the whole of the goods shall be liable to confiscation :</p></div><p>   <strong>    Provided   </strong>   that where the owner of such goods proves that he had no knowledge or reason to believe that they    included any smuggled goods, only such part of the goods the value of which is equal to the value of the smuggled    goods shall be liable to confiscation.<br>  </p></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="content"><strong>    Section 120. Confiscation of smuggled goods notwithstanding any change in form, etc. -   </strong><br><br>   (1)   Smuggled goods may be confiscated notwithstanding any change in their form.<p>    (2)   Where smuggled goods are mixed with other goods in such manner that the smuggled goods cannot be      separated from such other goods, the whole of the goods shall be liable to confiscation :</p></div><p>   <strong>    Provided   </strong>   that where the owner of such goods proves that he had no knowledge or reason to believe that they    included any smuggled goods, only such part of the goods the value of which is equal to the value of the smuggled    goods shall be liable to confiscation.<br>  </p></span>



 Section 121

Data from Section 121:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="content"><strong>    Section 121.  Confiscation of sale-proceeds of smuggled goods. -   </strong><br><br>   Where any smuggled goods are sold by a person having knowledge or reason to believe that the goods are smuggled    goods, the sale-proceeds thereof shall be liable to confiscation.   <br>   <br>  </div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="content"><strong>    Section 121.  Confiscation of sale-proceeds of smuggled goods. -   </strong><br><br>   Where any smuggled goods are sold by a person having knowledge or reason to believe that the goods are smuggled    goods, the sale-proceeds thereof shall be liable to confiscation.   <br>   <br>  </div></span>



 Section 122

Data from Section 122:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="content"><strong>    Section 122.  Adjudication of confiscations and penalties. -</strong></div><div id="content"><strong></strong><b><br></b>   <p>In every case under this Chapter in which anything is liable to confiscation or any person is liable to a penalty,      such confiscation or penalty may be adjudged, -   </p><p>    (a)  without limit, by a    <sup>     1</sup>[Principal Commissioner of Customs or Commissioner of Customs]or a    <sup>     2</sup>[Joint Commissioner of Customs];   </p><p><sup>     3    </sup>    [(b)  up to such limit, by such officers, as the Board may, by notification, specify.]    <br>    <br>   </p><div class="footnotes">    1. Substituted by the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), section 78, for "Commissioner of Customs"      (w.e.f. 06.08.2014). Substituted by the Finance Act, 1999 (27 of 1999), section 100 (w.e.f. 11.05.1999).    </p><p>     3. Substituted  by section 93 (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018). Prior to        substitution clause (b) and (c) stood as under:    </p><p>     "(b)  where the value of the goods liable to confiscation does not exceed five lakh rupees, by an Assistant        Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of Customs;    </p><p>     (c)  where the value of the goods liable to confiscation does not exceed, fifty thousand rupees, by a        Gazetted Officer of Customs lower in rank than an Assistant Commissioner of Customs or Deputy Commissioner of        Customs."    </p><br>   </div></div></span>

 Section 123

Data from Section 123:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <b>
    Section 123. Burden of proof in certain cases. -
   </b>
  </p>
  <p>
   <sup>
    1
   </sup>
   [(1) Where any goods to which this section applies are seized under this Act in the reasonable belief that
    they are smuggled goods, the burden of proving that they are not smuggled goods shall be -
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (a)  in a case where such seizure is made from the possession of any person, -
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 80px;">
   (i) on the person from whose possession the goods were seized; and
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 80px;">
   (ii) if any person, other than the person from whose possession the goods were seized, claims to be the owner
      thereof, also on such other person;
  </p>
  <p style="padding-left: 40px;">
   (b)  in any other case, on the person, if any, who claims to be the owner of the goods so seized.]
  </p>
  <p>
   <br>
   (2)  This section shall apply to gold,
   <sup>
    2
   </sup>
   [and manufactures thereof], watches, and any other class of goods which the Central Government may by
      notification in the Official Gazette specify.
   <br>
   <br>
  </p>
  <div class="footnotes">
   1. Substituted by the Customs, Gold (Control) and Central Excises and Salt (Amendment) Act, 1973 (36 of
      1973), section 4, for sub-section (1) (w.e.f. 01.09.1973).
   <p>
    2. Substituted by Customs (Amendment) Act, 1989 (40 of 1989), section 2, for ", diamonds, manufactures of
        gold or diamonds" (w.e.f. 26.10.1989).
   </p>
   <p>
   </p>
  </div>
 
</span>

 Section 124

Data from Section 124:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 124. Issue of show cause notice before confiscation of goods, etc. -   </strong></p><p>   No order confiscating any goods or imposing any penalty on any person shall be made under this Chapter unless the    owner of the goods or such person -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)  is given a notice in   <sup>    1</sup>[writing with the prior approval of the officer of Customs not below the rank      of   <sup>    2</sup>[an Assistant Commissioner of Customs], informing] him of the grounds on which it is      proposed to confiscate the goods or to impose a penalty;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)  is given an opportunity of making a representation in writing within such reasonable time as may be      specified in the notice against the grounds of confiscation or imposition of penalty mentioned therein; and  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)  is given a reasonable opportunity of being heard in the matter :</p><p><strong>    Provided   </strong>   that the notice referred to in clause (a) and the representation referred to in clause (b) may, at      the request of the person concerned be oral.</p><p><sup>    3</sup>[<strong>Provided   </strong>   further that notwithstanding issue of notice under this section, the proper officer may      issue a supplementary notice under such circumstances and in such manner as may be prescribed.]   <br>   <br>  </p><div class="footnotes"><p>1. Substituted by the Taxation Laws (Amendment) Act, 2006 (29 of 2006), section 28, for "writing informing"      (w.e.f.13.07.2006).</p><p>    2. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2011 (8 of 2011 )., section 49, for "a Deputy Commissioner of Customs"        (w.e.f. 08.04.2011).</p><p>3. Inserted by section 94 (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018).</p></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 124. Issue of show cause notice before confiscation of goods, etc. -   </strong></p><p>   No order confiscating any goods or imposing any penalty on any person shall be made under this Chapter unless the    owner of the goods or such person -  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (a)  is given a notice in   <sup>    1</sup>[writing with the prior approval of the officer of Customs not below the rank      of   <sup>    2</sup>[an Assistant Commissioner of Customs], informing] him of the grounds on which it is      proposed to confiscate the goods or to impose a penalty;  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (b)  is given an opportunity of making a representation in writing within such reasonable time as may be      specified in the notice against the grounds of confiscation or imposition of penalty mentioned therein; and  </p><p style="padding-left: 40px;">   (c)  is given a reasonable opportunity of being heard in the matter :</p><p><strong>    Provided   </strong>   that the notice referred to in clause (a) and the representation referred to in clause (b) may, at      the request of the person concerned be oral.</p><p><sup>    3</sup>[<strong>Provided   </strong>   further that notwithstanding issue of notice under this section, the proper officer may      issue a supplementary notice under such circumstances and in such manner as may be prescribed.]   <br>   <br>  </p><div class="footnotes"><p>1. Substituted by the Taxation Laws (Amendment) Act, 2006 (29 of 2006), section 28, for "writing informing"      (w.e.f.13.07.2006).</p><p>    2. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2011 (8 of 2011 )., section 49, for "a Deputy Commissioner of Customs"        (w.e.f. 08.04.2011).</p><p>3. Inserted by section 94 (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018).</p></div></span>



 Section 125

Data from Section 125:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><div id="content"><strong>    Section 125. Option to pay fine in lieu of confiscation. -   </strong><br>   <br>   (1) Whenever confiscation of any goods is authorised by this Act, the officer adjudging it may, in the case of any    goods, the importation or exportation whereof is prohibited under this Act or under any other law for the time being    in force, and shall, in the case of any other goods, give to the owner of the goods   <sup>    1   </sup>   [or, where such owner is not known, the person from whose possession or custody such goods have been    seized,] an option to pay in lieu of confiscation such fine as the said officer thinks fit:   <p><br>    <sup>     2    </sup>    [    <strong>     Provided    </strong>    that where the proceedings are deemed to be concluded under the proviso to sub-section      (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000185/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000046/1000002" alt="section 28">section 28</a> or under clause (i) of sub-section (6) of that section in respect of the goods which are not      prohibited or restricted,    <sup>     3    </sup>    [no such fine shall be imposed]:   </p><p><br>    <strong>     Provided    </strong>    further that] , without prejudice to the provisions of the proviso to sub-section (2) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000185/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000174/1000002" alt="section 115">section 115</a>, such fine shall not exceed the market price of the goods confiscated, less in the case of imported goods the      duty chargeable thereon.   </p><p><br>    <sup>     4    </sup>    [(2)  Where any fine in lieu of confiscation of goods is imposed under sub-section (1), the owner of      such goods or the person referred to in sub-section (1), shall, in addition, be liable to any duty and charges      payable in respect of such goods.]   </p><p><br>    <sup>     5    </sup>    [(3) Where the fine imposed under sub-section (1) is not paid within a period of one hundred and twenty days from      the date of option given thereunder, such option shall become void, unless an appeal against such order is      pending.    <br>    <br>    <strong>     Explanation    </strong>    .-For removal of doubts, it is hereby declared that in cases where an order under      sub-section (1) has been passed before the date** on which the Finance Bill, 2018 receives the assent of the      President and no appeal is pending against such order as on that date, the option under said sub-section may be      exercised within a period of one hundred and twenty days from the date on which such assent is received.]    <br>    <br>   </p><div class="footnotes"><p>     1. Inserted by the Customs (Amendment) Act, 1985 (80 of 1985), section 9(a) (w.e.f. 27.12.1985).    </p><p>     2. Substituted by section 95(i)(w.e.f. 29-3-2018) of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018) for "Provided        that".    </p><p>     3. Substituted (w.e.f. 1-8-2019) s. 78 of the Finance (No.2) Act, 2019 (23 of 2019).    </p><p>     4. Substituted by the Customs (Amendment) Act, 1985 (80 of 1985), section 9(b), for sub-section (2) (w.e.f.        27.12.1985).    </p><p>     5. Inserted by section 95(ii) (w.e.f. 29-3-2018) of the Finance Act, 2018 (13 of 2018).    </p><p></p></div></div></span>

 Section 126

Data from Section 126:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <b>
    Section 126. On confiscation, property to vest in Central Government. -
    <br>
   </b>
  </p>
  <p>
   (1) When any goods are confiscated under this Act, such goods shall thereupon vest in the Central Government.
  </p>
  <p>
   (2) The officer adjudging confiscation shall take and hold possession of the confiscated goods.
  </p>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <p>
   <b>
    Section 126. On confiscation, property to vest in Central Government. -
    <br>
   </b>
  </p>
  <p>
   (1) When any goods are confiscated under this Act, such goods shall thereupon vest in the Central Government.
  </p>
  <p>
   (2) The officer adjudging confiscation shall take and hold possession of the confiscated goods.
  </p>
 
</span>



 Section 127

Data from Section 127:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <div id="content">
   <b>
    Section 127. Award of confiscation or penalty by customs officers not to interfere with other punishments. -
    <br>
   </b>
   <br>
   The award of any confiscation or penalty under this Act by an officer of customs shall not prevent the infliction of
    any punishment to which the person affected thereby is liable under the provisions of Chapter XVI of this Act or
    under any other law.
   <br>
   <br>
  </div>
 
</span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153="">
 
 
 
  <div id="content">

    Section 127. Award of confiscation or penalty by customs officers not to interfere with other punishments. -
    <br>
   </b>
   <br>
   The award of any confiscation or penalty under this Act by an officer of customs shall not prevent the infliction of
    any punishment to which the person affected thereby is liable under the provisions of Chapter XVI of this Act or
    under any other law.
   <br>
   <br>
  </div>

 Section 127A

Data from Section 127A:
Component 1:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 127A. Definitions. - In this Chapter, unless the context otherwise requires. -   </strong><br>   <br>   (a)"Bench" means a Bench of the Settlement Commission;   <br>   <br>   1[(b) "case" means any proceeding under this Act or any other Act for the levy, assessment and collection of customs duty, pending before an adjudicating authority on the date on which an application under sub-section (1) of <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000188/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000189/1000002" alt="section 127B">section 127B</a> is made:   <br>   <span style="padding-left: 40px;">    <strong>     Provided    </strong></span>   that when any proceeding is referred back 2[* * *] by any court, Appellate Tribunal or any other authority, to the adjudicating authority for a fresh adjudication or decision, as the case may be, then such proceeding shall not be deemed to be a proceeding pending within the meaning of this clause;]   <br>   <br>   (c)"Chairman" means the Chairman of the Settlement Commission;   <br>   <br>   (d)"Commissioner (Investigation)" means an officer of the customs or a Central Excise Officer appointed as such Commissioner to conduct inquiry or investigation for the purposes of this Chapter;   <br>   <br>   (e)"Member" means a Member of the Settlement Commission and includes the Chairman and the Vice Chairman;   <br>   <br>   (f)"Settlement Commission" means the 3[Customs, Central Excise and Service Tax Settlement Commission] constituted under <a target="_blank" href="http://taxinformation.cbic.gov.in/suneditor/Acts/1000188/../../../content-page/explore-act/1000676/1000003" alt="section 32">section 32</a> of the Central Excise Act, 1944 (1 of 1944); and   <br>   <br>   (g)"Vice-Chairman" means a Vice-Chairman of the Settlement Commission.  </p><div class="footnotes"><p>    1. Substituted by Act the Finance Act, 2007 (22 of 2007), section 100, for clause (b) (w.e.f. 01.06.2007). Clause (b), before substitution, stood as under: " (b)"case" means any proceeding under this Act or any other Act for the levy, assessment and collection of customs duty, or any proceeding by way of appeal or revision in connection with such levy, assessment or collection, which may be pending before a proper officer or the Central Government on the date on which an application under sub-section (1) of section 127B is made: Provided that where any appeal or application for revision has been preferred after expiry of the period specified for the filing of such appeal or application for revision under this Act and which has not been admitted, such appeal or revision shall not be deemed to be proceeding pending within the meaning of this clause;"    <br>    2. The words "in any appeal or revision, as the case may be," omitted by the Finance Act, 2015 (20 of 2015), section 85 (w.e.f. 14.05.2015). 3. Substituted by the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), section 83, for "Customs and Central Excise Settlement Commission" (w.e.f. 06.08.2014).   </p></div></span>



Component 2:
<span _ngcontent-uwh-c153=""><p><strong>    Section 127A.  Section 127B

Data from Section 127B:
Component 1:

  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
     <b>
      Section
127B. Application for settlement of cases
     </b>
    </font>
   </font>
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
     .

    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <sup>
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      1</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[(1)
Any importer, exporter or any other person (hereinafter referred to
as the applicant in this Chapter) may, in respect of a case, relating
to him make an application, before adjudication to the Settlement
Commission to have the case settled, in such form and in such manner
as may be specified by rules, and containing a full and true
disclosure of his duty liability which has not been disclosed before
the proper officer, the manner in which such liability has been
incurred, the additional amount of customs duty accepted to be
payable by him and such other particulars as may be specified by
rules including the particulars of such dutiable goods in respect of
which he admits short levy on account of misclassification,
under-valuation or inapplicability of exemption notification
    </font>
   </font>
   <sup>
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      2</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[or
otherwise] and such application shall be disposed of in the manner
hereinafter provided:
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3"><b>
     Provided
</b>that no such application shall be made unless, -
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <sup>
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      3</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[(a)
the applicant has filed a bill of entry, or a shipping bill, or a
bill of export, or made a baggage declaration, or a label or
declaration accompanying the goods imported or exported through post
or courier, as the case may be, and in relation to such document or
documents, a show cause notice has been issued to him by the proper
officer;]
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
     (b)
 the additional amount of duty accepted by the applicant in his
application exceeds three lakh rupees; and
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
     (c)
 the applicant has paid the additional amount of customs duty
accepted by him along with interest due under
    </font>
   </font>
   <sup>
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      4</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[section
28AA]:
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3"><b>
     Provided
</b>further that no application shall be entertained by the Settlement
Commission under this sub-section in cases which are pending in the
Appellate Tribunal or any court:
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3"><b>
     Provided
</b>also that no application under this sub-section shall be made in
relation to goods to which section 123 applies or to goods in
relation to which any offence under the Narcotic Drugs and
Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985 (61 of 1985) has been committed:
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3"><b>
     Provided
</b>also that no application under this sub-section shall be made for the
interpretation of the classification of the goods under the Customs
Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975).
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">5</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[(1A)*
          *          *          *]</font></font><br></p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">6</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[(2)*
*          *          *]</font></font><br></p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">(3)
 Every application made under sub-section (1) shall be accompanied by
such fees as may be specified by rules.</span><br></p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">(4)
 An application made under sub-section (1) shall not be allowed to be
withdrawn by the applicant.</span><br></p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">7</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[(5)
Any person, other than an applicant referred to in sub-section (1),
may also make an application to the Settlement Commission in respect
of a show cause notice issued to him in a case relating to the
applicant which has been settled or is pending before the Settlement
Commission and such notice is pending before an adjudicating
authority, in such manner and subject to such conditions, as may be
specified by rules.]</font></font><br></p><p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
  <p lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <div class="footnotes">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
    </font>
   </font>
   <p>
   </p>
   <p lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      1. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2007 (22 of 2007), section 101, or sub-section (1) (w.e.f. 01.06.2007).
Earlier sub-section (1) was amended by Act 10 of 2000, section 86
(w.e.f. 12.05.2000). Sub-section (1), before substitution by Act 22
of 2007, stood as under:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (1) Any
importer, exporter or any other person (hereinafter in this Chapter
referred to as the applicant) may, at any stage of a case relating to
him, make an application in such form and in such manner as may be
specified by rules, and containing a full and true disclosure of his
duty liability which has not been disclosed before the proper
officer, the manner in which such liability has been incurred, the
additional amount of customs duty accepted to be payable by him and
such other particulars as may be specified by rules including the
particulars of such dutiable goods in respect of which he admits
short levy on account of misclassification or otherwise of goods, to
the Settlement Commission to have the case settled and such
application shall be disposed of in the manner hereinafter provided:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      Provided that no
such application shall be made unless 
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (a)  the applicant
has filed a bill of entry, or a shipping bill, in respect of import
or export of goods, as the case may be, and in relation to such bill
of entry or shipping bill or a show cause notice has been issued to
him by the proper officer;
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (b)  the additional
amount of duty accepted by the applicant in his application exceeds
two lakh rupees:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      Provided further
that no application shall be entertained by the Settlement Commission
under this sub-section in cases which are pending in the Appellate
Tribunal or any court:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      Provided also that
no application under this sub-section shall be made in relation to
goods to which section 123 applies or to goods in relation to which
any offence under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act,
1985 (61 of 1985), has been committed:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      Provided also that
no application under this sub-section shall be made for the
interpretation of the classification of the goods under the Customs
Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975).
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      2. Substituted by
the the Finance Act, 2010 (14 of 2010), section 57, for but excluding the goods
not included in the entry made under this Act (w.e.f.
08.05.2010).
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      3. Substituted by the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), section 84(i), for clause (a) (w.e.f. 06.08.2014).
Clause (a), before substitution, stood as under:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (a) the
applicant has filed a bill of entry, or a shipping bill, in respect
of import or export of such goods, as the case may be, and in
relation to such bill of entry or shipping bill, a show cause notice
has been issued to him by the proper officer;.
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      4. Substituted by the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), section 84(ii), for section 28 AB
(w.e.f. 06.08.2014)
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      5. Sub-section (1A)
omitted by the Finance Act, 2015 (20 of 2015), section 86 (w.e.f. 14.05.2015).
Sub-section (1A), before omission stood as under:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (1A)
Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), where an
application was made under sub-section (1) before the 1st day of
June, 2007 but an order under sub-section (1) of section 127C has not
been made before the said date, the applicant shall within a period
of thirty days from the 1st day of June, 2007 pay the accepted duty
liability failing which his application shall be liable to be
rejected.
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      6. Sub-section (2)
omitted by the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), section 84(iii)&nbsp;</font>(w.e.f. 6-8-2014)</font><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">. Sub-section (2), before
omission, stood as under:</span></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (2) Where any
dutiable goods, books of account, other documents or any sale
proceeds of the goods have been seized under section 110, the
applicant shall not be entitled to make an application under
sub-section (1) before the expiry of one hundred and eighty days from
the date of the seizure.
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      7. Inserted&nbsp;</font>(w.e.f. 31-3-2017)&nbsp;</font><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">by the Finance Act, 2017 (7 of 2017)</span><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">, Section 106.</span></p>
   <p lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
  </div>

<!-- saved from url=(0186)file:///C:/Users/aishwarya.dubey/OneDrive%20-%20LAKSHMIKUMARAN%20&%20SRIDHARAN/Documents/TCS/tax_repository_editable/customs/acts/1962_custom_act/active/chapter14A/section127b_v1.00.html -->

  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
     <b>
      Section
127B. Application for settlement of cases
     </b>
    </font>
   </font>
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
     .

    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <sup>
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      1</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[(1)
Any importer, exporter or any other person (hereinafter referred to
as the applicant in this Chapter) may, in respect of a case, relating
to him make an application, before adjudication to the Settlement
Commission to have the case settled, in such form and in such manner
as may be specified by rules, and containing a full and true
disclosure of his duty liability which has not been disclosed before
the proper officer, the manner in which such liability has been
incurred, the additional amount of customs duty accepted to be
payable by him and such other particulars as may be specified by
rules including the particulars of such dutiable goods in respect of
which he admits short levy on account of misclassification,
under-valuation or inapplicability of exemption notification
    </font>
   </font>
   <sup>
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      2</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[or
otherwise] and such application shall be disposed of in the manner
hereinafter provided:
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3"><b>
     Provided
</b>that no such application shall be made unless, -
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <sup>
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      3</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[(a)
the applicant has filed a bill of entry, or a shipping bill, or a
bill of export, or made a baggage declaration, or a label or
declaration accompanying the goods imported or exported through post
or courier, as the case may be, and in relation to such document or
documents, a show cause notice has been issued to him by the proper
officer;]
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
     (b)
 the additional amount of duty accepted by the applicant in his
application exceeds three lakh rupees; and
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
     (c)
 the applicant has paid the additional amount of customs duty
accepted by him along with interest due under
    </font>
   </font>
   <sup>
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      4</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[section
28AA]:
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3"><b>
     Provided
</b>further that no application shall be entertained by the Settlement
Commission under this sub-section in cases which are pending in the
Appellate Tribunal or any court:
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3"><b>
     Provided
</b>also that no application under this sub-section shall be made in
relation to goods to which section 123 applies or to goods in
relation to which any offence under the Narcotic Drugs and
Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985 (61 of 1985) has been committed:
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0.11in">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3"><b>
     Provided
</b>also that no application under this sub-section shall be made for the
interpretation of the classification of the goods under the Customs
Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975).
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">5</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[(1A)*
          *          *          *]</font></font><br></p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">6</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[(2)*
*          *          *]</font></font><br></p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">(3)
 Every application made under sub-section (1) shall be accompanied by
such fees as may be specified by rules.</span><br></p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">(4)
 An application made under sub-section (1) shall not be allowed to be
withdrawn by the applicant.</span><br></p>
  <p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">7</font></font></sup><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3">[(5)
Any person, other than an applicant referred to in sub-section (1),
may also make an application to the Settlement Commission in respect
of a show cause notice issued to him in a case relating to the
applicant which has been settled or is pending before the Settlement
Commission and such notice is pending before an adjudicating
authority, in such manner and subject to such conditions, as may be
specified by rules.]</font></font><br></p><p style="margin-bottom: 0in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
  <p lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
    </font>
   </font>
  </p>
  <div class="footnotes">
   <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
    <font size="3">
    </font>
   </font>
   <p>
   </p>
   <p lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      1. Substituted by the Finance Act, 2007 (22 of 2007), section 101, or sub-section (1) (w.e.f. 01.06.2007).
Earlier sub-section (1) was amended by Act 10 of 2000, section 86
(w.e.f. 12.05.2000). Sub-section (1), before substitution by Act 22
of 2007, stood as under:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (1) Any
importer, exporter or any other person (hereinafter in this Chapter
referred to as the applicant) may, at any stage of a case relating to
him, make an application in such form and in such manner as may be
specified by rules, and containing a full and true disclosure of his
duty liability which has not been disclosed before the proper
officer, the manner in which such liability has been incurred, the
additional amount of customs duty accepted to be payable by him and
such other particulars as may be specified by rules including the
particulars of such dutiable goods in respect of which he admits
short levy on account of misclassification or otherwise of goods, to
the Settlement Commission to have the case settled and such
application shall be disposed of in the manner hereinafter provided:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      Provided that no
such application shall be made unless 
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (a)  the applicant
has filed a bill of entry, or a shipping bill, in respect of import
or export of goods, as the case may be, and in relation to such bill
of entry or shipping bill or a show cause notice has been issued to
him by the proper officer;
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (b)  the additional
amount of duty accepted by the applicant in his application exceeds
two lakh rupees:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      Provided further
that no application shall be entertained by the Settlement Commission
under this sub-section in cases which are pending in the Appellate
Tribunal or any court:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      Provided also that
no application under this sub-section shall be made in relation to
goods to which section 123 applies or to goods in relation to which
any offence under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act,
1985 (61 of 1985), has been committed:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      Provided also that
no application under this sub-section shall be made for the
interpretation of the classification of the goods under the Customs
Tariff Act, 1975 (51 of 1975).
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      2. Substituted by
the the Finance Act, 2010 (14 of 2010), section 57, for but excluding the goods
not included in the entry made under this Act (w.e.f.
08.05.2010).
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      3. Substituted by the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), section 84(i), for clause (a) (w.e.f. 06.08.2014).
Clause (a), before substitution, stood as under:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (a) the
applicant has filed a bill of entry, or a shipping bill, in respect
of import or export of such goods, as the case may be, and in
relation to such bill of entry or shipping bill, a show cause notice
has been issued to him by the proper officer;.
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      4. Substituted by the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), section 84(ii), for section 28 AB
(w.e.f. 06.08.2014)
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      5. Sub-section (1A)
omitted by the Finance Act, 2015 (20 of 2015), section 86 (w.e.f. 14.05.2015).
Sub-section (1A), before omission stood as under:
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (1A)
Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), where an
application was made under sub-section (1) before the 1st day of
June, 2007 but an order under sub-section (1) of section 127C has not
been made before the said date, the applicant shall within a period
of thirty days from the 1st day of June, 2007 pay the accepted duty
liability failing which his application shall be liable to be
rejected.
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      6. Sub-section (2)
omitted by the Finance (No.2) Act, 2014 (25 of 2014), section 84(iii)&nbsp;</font>(w.e.f. 6-8-2014)</font><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">. Sub-section (2), before
omission, stood as under:</span></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      (2) Where any
dutiable goods, books of account, other documents or any sale
proceeds of the goods have been seized under section 110, the
applicant shall not be entitled to make an application under
sub-section (1) before the expiry of one hundred and eighty days from
the date of the seizure.
     </font>
    </font>
   </p><p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%"><font face="Times New Roman, serif"><font size="3"><br></font></font></p>
   <p align="JUSTIFY" lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
      7. Inserted&nbsp;</font>(w.e.f. 31-3-2017)&nbsp;</font><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">by the Finance Act, 2017 (7 of 2017)</span><span style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, serif;">, Section 106.</span></p>
   <p lang="en-US" style="margin-top: 0.07in; margin-bottom: 0.07in; line-height: 100%">
    <font face="Times New Roman, serif">
     <font size="3">
     </font>
    </font>
   </p>
